story:
CONTENDIFY 

WHO AM I?
My name is Corey and I'm an engineer/entrepreneur. I have a background in chemical engineering from MIT. I have been passionate about education and sharing that passion with others ever since I could remember.

WHAT IS CONTENDIFY?
Mathematics is the most fundamental tool needed to achieve almost anything in Science, Technology, Engineering and of course, Mathematics (S.T.E.M.). It is no wonder why there are so many passionate high school students that go the extra mile to show their skills in competitions like the American Mathematics Competition (AMC). However, most math competitions can be made better. As of now:

1) They do not offer a friendly, collaborative environment for students to tackle challenging math problems. Most of the time, students are separated in a room to work on problems privately.

2) They only happen once or twice a year! Who wants to wait that long to feel the joy and rush of competing. 

This is why I created Contendify. 

Contendify allows high school students to compete in math competitions with their friends and peers! These competitions take all the positives of hackathons (where programmers come together in teams to work on cutting-edge projects for 1 or 2 days straight) and combines it with math competitions. Contendify is based in NYC. The competitions are timed and are taken by teams of 2 to 4 students.

Contendify Competitions happen continuously throughout the year so that students can enter many times a year (at least 4 times a month). The competition tickets will be handled using Eventbrite on the Contendify website. The website will be launched very soon as I am developing more math problems for the first few competitions. 

HOW IT WORKS
1) Students will register their teams on the Contendify website.
2) Students will take the Algebra, Geometry or Calculus Quizzes to find out their level. There are 3 levels as shown below.

3) Students will then sign up for the particular event that they can make with their teams. Teams range from 2 to 4 people. 
There can be as many as 20 teams competing with each other in one setting for now.
4) After the students compete, they will have their results posted on the same day. 
Depending on who won 1st , 2nd and 3rd place, prizes will be awarded to the winning teams.

DETAILS ON THE COMPETITION 
1) Tickets to attend the competition range from $5 to $10. Discounts can be awarded to winning teams.
2) The Competition Booklet that the students must complete is a timed test. Students will have 1 Hour to complete 10 to 12 questions. 
There will be problems from each level.
3) Light snacks and drinks will also be provided in each competition. 
Competition event spaces will taken place in beautiful venues as seen below:


EXAMPLE PROBLEMS

ALGEBRA:



GEOMETRY 




CALCULUS 


SCORING

Scores are a function of questions correct. Higher leveled problems are worth more and if there is a tie, then there will be a timed tiebreaker problem.


What We Need & What You Get


WHY CONTENDIFY NEEDS YOU!

I am aiming for $5000 for the growth of Contendify and the improved experience for our math contenders. 

Here are the reasons why your help is essential for the success of Contendify:

1) These competition events are not free for students to attend and compete. Currently, admission to these competitions is around $10. I want to decrease the price for these students by using 75% of the money raised to help pay for the cost of running these competitions. These costs include:

a) The problem creation which occurs with the help of graduate students and professors in the field of mathematics. 

b) The event venue space where students compete.

c) Discounts and prizes for teams that win the competitions.

Prizes include free tickets to compete, free tickets to lectures given by expert professors from institutions such as Columbia University and NYU.

2) The rest of the money raised will be used to spread the word to as many students as possible. It would be a shame for high schoolers to miss out on this great opportunity because they simply have not heard of it. I will use the money to pay for people to go to as many high schools as possible in NYC to speak with math teachers and their students. I will also use it for advertisements (posters).

If I do not reach the entire goal, I will still use the funds for the costs mentioned above.


PERKS!

There are 3 perks depending on how much you donate:

$20

You will receive free admission to a S.T.E.M. Lecture of your choice (Located in NYC).

$50

You will receive free admission to 2 Contendify Competitions.

$100

You will receive free admission to 3 Contendify Competitions and 2 S.T.E.M. Lectures.

$500

You will receive unlimited free admission to S.T.E.M. Lectures.


The Impact

You don't have to be a mathlete to understand the impact of Contendify. Contendify sparks more interest in math education and builds great minds for the future. Mathletes will be able to sharpen their problem solving skills and create a better future for everyone.

_____________________

Building a more academically solid generation of students is my goal in life. In fact, my other project is a non-profit called,Teptu. Teptu is an International S.T.E.M. Research Competition for high school students in NYC and South Africa. I am one of two founders of Teptu. I have worked extremely hard to bring Teptu to fruition. We now have 6 sponsors for Teptu, one of which is Microsoft! We also have WeWork as a sponsor. Check out the website:

www.teptu.com
______________________


Risks & Challenges

I see one risk of Contendify and that is that not enough students will have the opportunity to become a member of Contendify. NYC is a big place and there are tons of mathematically strong high school students. It is my mission to reach out to as many of them as possible, and that is one of the main reasons I need your help. NYC is only the beginning as I want to expand to Boston, Connecticut and beyond!


Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount helps! But if you cannot donate money, there is another way you can help.

Please tell anyone you know that loves math and would be interested in Contendify. Spread the word! If they are interested, they can send me an email at:

harrilal@mit.edu

story:
Hi!  
VEX team 4911 has been invited to attend the Create US Open Championships in Council Bluffs, Iowa this spring! We have entered three events so far this year and have placed First at two of them, (at the other one we burned out a motor in the finals). We currently place 4th in the State for robot skills test and 8th for programming skills, which is measured by how many points the robot can score in one minute.   
The VEX challenge this year is to score  points by putting small foam balls into a low or high goal and lifting your alliance partner's robot off the floor by at least 4 inches!We usually hit 30 out of 32 high goals during a match, but have yet to successfully lift our partner or be lifted by them.    You can learn more about the game challenge at http://www.vexrobotics.com/vexedr/competition/c...
We need your help to raise the $3000 needed to attend the Create Us Championship event.   The entry fee is $450.  Hotels for team members and coaches about $1500, transportation and food for the team and families and parts (extra motors and new batteries!)  for the robots, team t-shirts, banners, etc. $1050.
These students have worked hard to build and program a robot for this years challenge.  They are the engineers of the future and will design things that we cant even imagine yet!  Attending this world-wide event will provide them the opportunity to meet other students from different cultures, share ideas, and grow in their skills. 
This team is one of several teams that are hosted by Michiana Youth Robotics and Engineering, a small non-profit that offers classes and competitive teams to students age 6 and up.

story:
We have all seen how economic insecurity and the lack of legal and policy resources hinder efforts at making the world a better place. Poverty, inequality, and exploitation stop too many of us from realizing our potential and creating the changes we want in the world.

It is not because we aren't working hard enough, or aren't smart enough or dedicated enough; it is because we are operating within a legal and economic system designed to reinforce the status quo.

The forces of exploitation and extraction have THEIR legal and policy organizations (the best known is ALEC, the American Legislative Exchange Council) helping to ensure that the deck is stacked against economic and ecological justice.

Materialized Empathy is dedicated to changing this -- giving grassroots, locally controlled, sustainable economic justice a fair shake. Imagine the difference it would make to have a dedicated, effective, and smart advocacy group on our side. You can help make that dream real by donating and spreading the word.

  • Millions are economically insecure, and we are all ecologically insecure. This insecurity is morally unacceptable and a source of bad law and policy. Materialized Empathy aims to eliminate classism and artificial scarcity in American law, policy, and civic life.

  • Our economy and environment are about to change dramatically. Saving the planet means changing our everyday material practices-- changes that can either benefit the socioeconomically disadvantaged or be disastrous for them. Materialized Empathy shapes law, policy, and community practices that embody both justice and sustainability.


Materialized Empathy, a project of Commonomics USA, is a legal- and policy-oriented educational project. We:

  • research, publish, and teach model law and policy,

  • produce daily news and weekly podcasts, and

  • host and facilitate public deliberation

                                     . . . on sustainable, cooperative economic justice and the law.


Help us bring this future into being:

SUSTAINABLE PUBLIC FINANCE . . . UNIVERSAL ACCESS TO LEGAL AND FINANCIAL SERVICES . . . REPARATIONS AND LOCALLY CONTROLLED DEVELOPMENT. . . COOPERATIVE COMMUNITY ORDINANCES . . . VIBRANT WORKER COOPERATIVES AND MANAGEMENT . . . ECONOMIC JUSTICE FOR THE INCARCERATED . . . LOCAL AGRICULTURE ORDINANCES . . . CLIMATE EGALITARIANISM . . . SOCIOECONOMIC RIGHTS. . . SUSTAINABLE INTENTIONAL COMMUNITIES


Who we are:

Matt Stannard, JD: Longtime economic justice, public and postal banking, and cooperatives advocate. Policy Director at Commonomics USA and advisor to the Public Banking Institute. Author of the soon-to-be-released book, "The American Commons".

Ma’ikwe Ludwig, BA: Climate change activist, consensus facilitator and sustainability educator. Executive Director of the nonprofit branch of Dancing Rabbit Ecovillage, and board member of the Fellowship for Intentional Community.

. . . and the team at Commonomics USA, which has shaped national discourse on public and postal banking, the impacts of privatization, and the need to protect and revitalize the Commons.

Check out our video and our video updates over the next month to get to know us better!


We Need Your Support!

  • Materialized Empathy goes online January 2016 and can officially launch as a full-on project on July 1, with the support of Commonomics USA, a team of researchers and interns in cooperative content production... and you and your networks!

  • Materialized Empathy needs $12K to launch, and $55K to fund our first year of work. This campaign will get us the funds we need to start our work.

This budget includes:

$  7,900                             For staff time*

     1,500                             For our first intern*

        300                             Website and Podcast equipment and costs

        800                             Office rental

      1,500                            Campaign Costs

$ 12,000                       TOTAL CAMPAIGN GOAL


*During the first three months of our 2016 pre-launch period, we will begin research, podcasting, and daily news updates, while cultivating our social and traditional media network. In March, we will present a webinar on classism, economic justice, and the law, and conduct a nationwide survey of anti-poverty, sustainability, and other organizations to build a comprehensive profile of the legal and policy needs of a new, just economy.

Funds raised beyond our goal will allow us to do our work more quickly, and to be able to address a larger number of critical issues in the first year. The sky is pretty much the limit for this work, so please help spread the word widely and give what you can.


The Perks!

Our perks can give you a taste of the world we are working to create. Books, consulting time, a webinar and even a game that teaches through fun... all of our perks are variations on the theme of bringing that better world into being.


Can't give now?

We get it. Part of why this project is so compelling is that folks like us who care about the world can sometimes be awfully tight on cash. You can still help spread the word. We also invite you to get in touch with us if you think you might have a project we could partner with that would benefit from our work, or if you have legal background that could help us move things along.

story:
LEAGUE OF WOMEN VOTERS

The League of Women Voters, a nonpartisan grassroots volunteer organization, was born in 1920 when fearless women fought for and finally attained the right to vote. Originally designed to help 20 million women carry out their new responsibilities as voters and to nurture civic leaders, the League helps voters, women and men, become informed and engaged citizens. Today the League’s work continues to engage and empower diverse voices to participate in our democracy, defend and expand voting rights, and advocate for better laws and public policy.

Voting rights...equal pay for equal work...
there are still struggles to be won and the future is in our hands!

AN EVENT HONORING FIVE GREAT WOMEN

Ruth Garcia-Corrales, PR & Community Affairs Mgr., Curacao, and Western Regional Mgr. & LA Chapter President, National Association of Professional Women
~Recipient of the Civic Service Leadership Award~

Sarah Gavron, Director, SUFFRAGETTE
~Recipient of the Carrie Chapman Catt Leadership Award~

Linda Goldstein Knowlton, Producer, CODE BLACK
~Recipient of the Carrie Chapman Catt Leadership Award~

Abi Morgan, Writer, SUFFRAGETTE
~Recipient of the Carrie Chapman Catt Leadership Award~

Yoruba Richen, Director, Producer, Writer, THE NEW BLACK
~Recipient of the Carrie Chapman Catt Leadership Award~

The event will be moderated by Monica Horan Rosenthal,
award winning actress from Everybody Loves Raymond.


PERKS INCLUDE

Meet and greet with actress Monica Horan Rosenthal

Props from SUFFRAGETTE:

Votes for Women Banner
Suffragette Ribbon


JOIN US ON NOVEMBER 8, 2015!

The League of Women Voters of Los Angeles presents a celebration and fundraiser moderated by award-winning actress Monica Horan Rosenthal, followed by a special screening of Focus Features’
Suffragette,
a film by Sarah Gavron and written by Abi Morgan,
starring Carey Mulligan, Helena Bonham Carter, and Meryl Streep.

Sunday, November 8, 2015

Pacific Design Center
8687 Melrose Avenue
West Hollywood, CA 90069
11:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

To purchase event tickets please click here.

WHY CONTRIBUTE

The League of Women Voters of Los Angeles (LWVLA), a membership organization, is a local League that performs two separate and distinct roles:

    • Voter Service: we present unbiased nonpartisan information about elections, the voting process, and issues.
    • Action/Advocacy: As a nonpartisan organization, we take action on  positions after careful study. We use our positions to advocate in the public interest for or against particular policies or ballot measures.

------------------~~ - ~~------------------

Do you know the herstory of the U.S. suffrage movement? WATCH to see how one woman, Alice Paul, made a difference!


For further information about the League of Women Voters of Los Angeles, please visit www.lwvlosangeles.org. The LWVLA is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization.

Donors* will be listed as a supporter of the League of Women Voters of Los Angeles on the LWVLA’s website: http://www.lwvlosangeles.org.

*Donors may choose to remain anonymous. All donations are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.

story:
Dear Hot Springs School Supporter,
Park I.B. and Hot Springs Intermediate School PTO are asking for your support for our Outdoor Classroom Project. The Outdoor Classroom will be created in the courtyard in between the cafeteria and the gym. An Outdoor Classroom provides many opportunities and over 850 students, kindergarten thru sixth grade would be able to enjoy the benefits of the space.

The space will be interdisciplinary, including discussions, lectures, art projects, discovery, literacy, science, music and math.

The Hot Springs School District has granted the PTO's request for a pavilion to be built later this year.  The pavilion area will have picnic tables and a white board for teachers to utilize.

A rain garden will beautify the space, it will also alleviate an existing drainage problem. The rain garden is being designed by The City of Hot Springs Storm Water Division and Max Sestili. The rain garden work will be completed by a licensed contractor. The majority of costs will be for materials for the rain garden, gravel, soil mix, plants and mulch.

In addition to the rain garden, the Science teachers have requested additional planting boxes, for a total of 13 new planter boxes. With the new boxes, every student in the Intermediate School will be able to garden as part of their Science classes.  

The Literacy space will have ten Adirondack chairs painted by local artists.  Also, there will a mini-library filled with books and magazines donated from Friends of the Library. 

The Science space will feature a weather station, scales and an outdoor sink perfect for outdoor science experiments!

The Math Space will feature a dry erase board and math markings on the existing concrete pad.

Students that have had outdoor education curricula received higher scores on tests, earned higher grades and scored better in math, writing, and reading.  They also developed positive academic attitudes and established greater knowledge gain.  82% of the students at Hot Springs Intermediate are low income and 13% receive special education, two demographics that would benefit from learning in a hands-on environment.

Please consider being a part of our Outdoor Living Classroom Project. With your help, we can make this project successful and make a difference in our students!

story:
Get U.S. There is a group of young South Africans, from diverse backgrounds who have all been accepted to The New York Film Academy to study acting, filmmaking, cinematography or documentary filmmaking. Living expenses in New York City are extremely high, but when converted into South African Rands it becomes a lot more expensive. Although most students received a partial scholarship, we still need to raise funds for the outstanding tuition fees, accommodation, travel expenses, visas and study material.  During the year, we will not be able to work due to the Student Visa we will be on and to apply for the Visas we will need to have all our expenses accounted for. Any donation you are able to offer would be greatly appreciated and will go towards our groceries for the year that we are in New York City.


Our credo is "We are who We are because of Others" and therefore, the fundraising model we subscribe to is "Pay it Forward". We do as many outreaches as possible and film a short piecce about each organisation to help them to market their cause (please see someof our outreaches below). Our ultimate Goal is to help as many people as possible, while simultaneously making our Dreams a Reality, so 10% of funds raised through this Indiegogo campaign will go to an NGO we support, Read To Rise, as part of our mission to Pay It Forward.


Please help us raise $5,76 per student per meal (3 meals a day for 12 months) and donate books to 1500 children in South African Townships through Read To Rise, as part of the 10% Paid Forward from this campaign! Please support us as we support others.


Thank you, from:

Andrew, Corne', Jess, Karabo, Koketso, Niki, and Tam.


Get U.S There Outreaches:




    


“Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.”

- Nelson Mandela

story:
Hi

 We are a group of ten young enthusiasts who are passionate lovers of DIY models. Do it yourself is a method of building, modifying, or repairing objects without the need for professional help. Most of us are in some way are engaged in DIY as a hobby, and some would like to learn how to apply it in their life.

 We can talk about some cool DIY items you can make, but it is way better to see it, because of that we want to organize a DIY festival, here in Belgrade. Festival where we celebrate the DIY culture, bringing together local DIY community and where we can teach each other how to apply the DIY in your home and in your life. We have heard from a lot of people that they are interested and would like to familiarize themselves as to how to apply the DIY but they think that it's complicated and difficult, we think it is not and we want to prove it. 

We believe that you already had a chance in life to make a variety of things on your own, modified old stuff and that you were sometimes surprised by what you did especially from old stuff. We want to bring together people who are willing to see and apply the DIY model and are willing to learn from others. 

The space for our festival we got free (around one hundred fifty square meters), demonstrators work pro bono and we need your money to supplement the material for the workshop, especially material for the New Year's motifs and arranging the space. In addition, we will have unplugged music to entertain visitors. 

Our festival will store a lot of workshops, which will be taught by thirty self-taught craftspeople, specialized in areas such as: wardrobe reconstruction, decoupage, food decoration, jewellery making, toy building, making wicker and other objects. This is the first festival of its kind organized in Belgrade.

 We do not have large corporate sponsors, a lot of materials are donated from small independent shops. 

Our awards (Perks) are as follows: 

Who donates 5 euros, will get access to 3 beautiful recorded workshops ''How to make some cool DIY items (Via Youtube). 

Who donates 15 Euros, will get access to 10 cool recorded workshops, 

Who donates 50 Euros, will get access to 15 DIY recorded workshops and we will send a cool DIY postcard to the address of your choice. Furthermore, you will get half an hour live DIY lessons and video demonstration 

Who donates 100 euros, will get access to 20 DIY recorded workshops, postcard to the address of your choice, one-hour live demonstration (2 workshops), in your name we will donate one pair of winter gloves decorated DIY in the asylum center, here in Belgrade. 

Who donates 200 euros, will get access to 20 DIY recorded workshops, postcard to the address of your choice, two-hour live demonstration (4 DIY Lessons), in your name we will donate one pair of winter gloves decorated DIY in the asylum center and a unique DIY T-shirt or some jewelry with you name will wait for you here in Belgrade whenever you come to Belgrade. 

We expect to have over 300 visitors, great entertainment, hot tea in our DIY cups, great live music, and indeed interesting workshops. The risk for us is that our organization could get a little confused because this is the first time we have organized a DIY festival, but we hope that the good energy and volunteers will overcome it since it is a DIY concept. 

If you like DIY and you are ready to learn then please support us and share and like it.

story:
Every day 10 - 50 rubber dingies with Syrian refugees arrive on the island of Lesvos, Greece. We are a group of international volunteers that are there to help the refugee boats land safely, and to get them food, water and dry clothes as quickly as possible. 

Every boat is loaded with as much as 50 refugees, many of them children down to only days old. With winter, lower temperatures, wind and waves, it is very important to be able to guide the boats the safest landing spots. If not, more children will drown in the Aegean Sea.

The stretch of coastline that we're working on is about 12 km long, and it is impossible to cover that whole stretch 24/7.

During day time, the boats are easy to spot, and it is easy to predict where they will land so that we can drive there and make sure the boat arrives at a safe landing spot. However, more and more boats arrive at night, and then we have no idea about the boats before we hear them. 

With one or more FLIR Ocean Scope 320, we would be able to spot the boats as far out as 1 km. That would give us the time needed to be at the right place and direct the boats with lights to a safe landing spot.

One such scope will cost around $3000, and in order to cover the coastline, we would need at least three!

What We Need & What You Get

  • In order to provide the refugees with safe landing at night, we will need 3 FLIR Ocean Scope 320. Each costs around $3000.
  • Every contributor will get a warm feeling inside! You will of course also
    receive a personal thank you on email and be mentioned on Facebook.
  • We, the volunteers are truly volunteers. We come from countries like Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Netherlands and many other.
    We pay our own travel, our own hotel and our own food. In addition, most of us have collected clothing from friends and family, raised additional funds from the same in order to offer the refugees food and water when they arrive.
    The funds raised will in it's entirety be spent buying the scopes. If there will be raised more than the $9000, the money will be spent improving the conditions for refugees in the camps at Lesvos.

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Daniele Petrella and I’m the president of IRIAE, The International Research Institute for Archaeology and Ethnology, a non-profit research institute with its headquarters in Naples, Italy. IRIAE has, for long time, been carrying out archaeological excavations and ethnological research all around the world, and it counts on members and supporters in Europe, East Asia, the United States, and Africa.

The origin of Japan are still shrouded in mystery. The studies carried out by the Japanese colleagues have defined the periods from the stone age, the so-called Jōmon period, passing through the very early stages of agriculture and the Bronze and Iron age of the Yayoi period, until the time of  monumental and megalith tombs  that characterize the Kofun period.  These chronologies, however, have so far been mainly based on stylistic comparisons and typological analysis, but on a few scientific investigations. Thanks to an extensive use of the modern scientific investigations, it will be possible to obtain a more accurate and precise chronology for these ancient times of Japan.

Well, this is the main purpose of the expedition that IRIAE, in collaboration with TecnArt, an academic spin off of University of Torino specialized in the most modern chemical-physical techniques for the archaeological dating and the study of findings, is organizing in Japan.

In the country, the Italian team will work together with the prestigious University of Okayama and with the Ancient Izumo Museum.

 

We will carry out archaeological excavations and scientific investigations to get a more precise and accurate chronology for the prehistory of Japan, but this is not all. Thanks to the action of a consortium of European partners and Japanese museums, like the above-mentioned Ancient Izumo Museum, innovative exhibitions based on the augmented realty will be realized both in Europe and Japan to obtain a museum experience that will allow everyone to know the results of this research and lead to an enrichment of European museums keeping Japanese collections. 

                    

Now we need your support to realize a start-up that is a prelude to the real expedition, aimed at planning the scientific and archaeological investigations and to reinforce our institutional relationships with local entities, universities, museums and prefectures of competence.

This expedition is important for several reasons. First of all, because it would solve a longstanding mystery about the origins of a country whose culture is found in various forms in the daily life of each of us.

Secondly, it would be the first time that a team of Japanese and westerners would collaborate on this research topic, using a multidisciplinary and coordinated approach, in particular between scientists and archaeologists.

                               

IRIAE was the first Western entity to organize an archaeological expedition in Japan, deals with the research and the discovery of the Lost Fleet of Kublai Khan, this new expedition could close the circle, activating an overland investigation completely different by the previous one realized in underwater environment.

TecnArt will have the opportunity to apply their technologies and expertise to date unique finds contributing in significant way to understand the origins of a so fascinating culture.


What We Need & What You Get

To realize the start up of this adventure, we need 15,000 $ that represent the minimum cost in order to allow six members of the Italian team to travel to Japan for setting the work that will be the basis of the new expedition.

The Team will be composed of 3 members of IRIAE, 2 archaeologists and a video maker of Cinemac Studio (for the documentary) and 3 members of TecnArt.

The fund recovered to this start-up thanks to your contribution, will be entirely allocated to the expedition costs: travel, food, accommodation, Japan Rail Pass for 6 people, plus a 20% for emergencies.


The Perks that we have planned for you are:

1) Greetings (15 $)

# Thanks from IRIAE-TecnArt team with a dedicated electronic postcard

2) Followers (75 $)

# Thanks from IRIAE-TecnArt team with a dedicated electronic postcard

# T-shirt of the expedition

3) I bilieve in you! (100 $)

# Thanks from IRIAE-TecnArt team with a dedicated electronic postcard

# T-shirt of the expedition

# IRIAE Membership*

*What it means to become a member of IRIAE? Click and read our Manifesto

4) Supporter (500 $)

# Thanks from IRIAE-TecnArt team with a dedicated electronic postcard

# T-shirt of the expedition

# IRIAE Membership

# Public thanks on our media channels and social networks

5) Mecenate (1000 $)

# Thanks from IRIAE-TecnArt team with a dedicated electronic postcard

# T-shirt of the expedition

# IRIAE Membership

# Public thanks on our media channels and social networks

# Acknowledgements in the expedition documentary

6) Teammate (2500 $)

# Thanks from IRIAE-TecnArt team with a dedicated electronic postcard

# T-shirt of the expedition

# IRIAE Membership

# Public thanks on our media channels and social networks

# Acknowledgements in the expedition documentary as Patron of expedition

# Invitation to participate to conferences and other meetings as main sponsor as Patron of Expedition


The importance of this start up requires us to organize likewise the departure for Japan, but we have set a minimum:

- From 0 to 7,499 $: the fund will be used to finance the preliminary archaeological research and scientific analysis to better plan the future expedition.

- From 7,500 $ and over: the Start up expedition will start anyhow, by changing the number of the team,starting from 3 people for $ 7,500 to a maximum of 6 people achieving the goal


The Impact

In these modern times where the cultural difference is often cause of conflict, we believe that our project can be a way to get closer people with different traditions and style of life, as the Japanese and Western cultures are. Moreover, the scientific value of our project aims at testing a new multidisciplinary methodology to investigate the “historical roots” of a culture and that can be apply all over the world.

You can give your support in this important mission. Everyone can be fundamental! Experts and supporters!


Risks & Challenges

The start-up phase of the expedition has no particular risks, because it is based on well-established relationships between the Italian team and the Department of Archaeology of the University of Okayama.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not give us a financially support? No problem! There are also other ways to help us. For example, you can share as much as possible our campaign. Help us to "make noise", to spread in many different ways our project.

To help us to promote our campaign, Indiegogo provides a number of useful tools for sharing. Use them. Your contribution is a vital support for us!

story:
Hello. How are you? My name is Azjargal. I am from Mongolia.
 
I'm 14 years old and I study in 62nd secondary school of Ulaanbaatar.
 
My dream is to study in Harvard university
 
My parents who follow a nomadic way of life,  live in countryside it is 200km far from capital city, Ulaanbaatar.
 
I live with my aunts in Ulaanbaatar city. Every summer, i visit my parents and help them to herd their animals.
 
My first step to my dream is to go and live with american family  in 2016  by  involving in Junior language course program of  "Education first" agency  http://www.ef.com

If it will go to my plans...

First. I can learn about America more.
Second. I can improve my english.
Third. I will make many new friends.
And. I can do it my first step to my dreams.
 
Please, support me dear brothers and sisters.

story:
From the voyage in the Niari area is born the project Adopt a field, feed a child“.

The Parish of Pieve Dugliara (PC-Italia) joined the Parish of Dolise (Republic of Congo) to collect the necessary funds to enable the project.

In a region out of the colonialism and wars of the 80s and 90s of last century, subject of deforestation and practice of “slash and burn” that  deplete the soil, it is expected to introduce techniques of cultivation, breeding and production that able the development of a culture of agricultural production.

In order to support the life and the growth of the young local population has been developed the social farming project for self-maintenance of children.


Dal viaggio nell'area di Niari è nato il progetto "Adotta un campo, sfama un bimbo". La Parrocchia di Pieve Dugliara (PC - Italia) si è unita alla Parrocchia di Dolise (Repubblica del Congo) per raccogliere i fondi necessari per permettere l'avvio del progetto.

In una regione uscita dal colonialismo  negli anni 80-90 del secolo scorso, soggetta a deforestazioni e pratiche di "slash and burn" che esauriscono il suolo, l'intento è quello di introdurre tecniche di coltivazione, allevamento e produzione che garantiscano lo sviluppo di una cultura di produzione agricola.

Al fine di supportare la vita e la crescita della giovane popolazione locale è nato il progetto di agricoltura sociale per l'auto mantenimento dei bambini.


The social project “Adopt a field, feed a child” is promoted by:

- Father Jean Badinga is from the Congolese Parish of Dolisie (Republic of Congo), in which the agricultural project will be developed to face of the needs of food, health and education of children.

- don Giuseppe Lusignani is from the Italian Parish of Pieve Dugliara (PC-Italia), where the points of fundraising and the warranty committee were established.


Il progetto sociale "adotta un campo, sfama un bimbo" è promosso da:

- Padre Jean Badinga della Parrocchia congolese di Dolise (Repubblica del Congo), dove il progetto agricolo sarà sviluppato per affrontare il bisogno di cibo, salute e educazione dei bambini.

- don Giuseppe Lusignani della Parrocchia italiana di Pieve Dugliara (PC-Italia). dove sono stati stabiliti i punti di raccolta fondi e della commissione di garanzia.


The project is declined on the main fronts : 

- Organization for agricultural development of an area of ​​45 hectares divided into 2000 fields to devote to the support of a child ;

- Allocation of each field to social use , following a donation by a lender ;

- Through the adoption of a field , you have the guarantee of an annual pension equivalent to support a child ;

- Use of resources available within the country itself ;

- Prospects of viability of the project after a first injection of funds ;

- The project is practical, not too expensive , and has the potential to be repeated the other situations.


Il progetto si declina su dei fronti principali:

- organizzazione per uno sviluppo agricolo di un'area di 45 ettari divisi in 2000 campi da dedicare al sostentamento di un bambino

- assegnazione di ogni campo ad uso sociale, a seguito di una donazione da parte di un finanziatore

- attraverso l'adozione di un campo, si ha la garanzia di una rendita annua equivalente per sostenere un bimbo

- utilizzo delle risorse disponibili all'interno del paese stesso

- prospettive di autosufficienza del progetto dopo una prima iniezione di fondi

- il progetto è pratico, non troppo dispendioso, ed ha il potenziale per essere ripetuto il altre situazioni.


Adopting one of the field of the project you will allow the setting up of an agricultural crops or a small farm whose proceeds will be used to feed a child and to support him in his growth, by “Adopt a field, feed a child” donate it means produce, put those in need in a position to sustain themselves.


Adottando uno dei campi del progetto permetterai l'avvio di un campo o di una piccola azienda agricola i cui proventi verranno usati per sfamare un bambino e supportarlo nella sua crescita; con "Adotta un campo, sfama un bimbo" donare significa produrre, mettere chi ha bisogno in posizione di sostere sè stesso.


The project focuses on the theme of sustainable development drive in the countries of Equatorial Africa , by creating opportunities for enterprise training, through the conversion of the territories abandoned by the crisis of colonialism . The main theme is sustainability understood as creating an opportunity for economic development as well as social , environmental considerations. The initiative proposed by " The New Africa " , a working group which provides its know -how and to promote the agricultural vocation of the land on African soil , is the idea of developing a social project dedicated exclusively to three strong demands emerged locally : to improve the living conditions of children , improve sanitary conditions and implement education.

The social plan is based on the " Adopt a field , a Feed a child " and provides for the development of the agricultural area of ​​45 hectares divided into 2000 fields with annual revenue to social use , each designed to support a child . Fields for social purposes will constitute the expansion of 15 existing villages and will benefit from the support of the infrastructure system and services made ​​in the business plan . The project will include the construction of training centers , a health care physician, a center where you can work products and the addition of crops and livestock . 

The initiative includes : 

- Donations of shares from 200 euro per year for the adoption of a field whose proceeds will go to help a child in the local community ; 
 - With the adoption of each field to social use it will require the assignment of an area for the development of conservation agriculture and for an equivalent area to be dedicated to the preservation of biodiversity ; 
 - Other donations will be used to equip the schools and open first aid points in the villages of Niari.



Il progetto mette al centro il tema dello sviluppo auto sostenibile nei Paesi dell'Africa Equatoriale, dalla creazione di opportunità d'impresa alla formazione, attraverso la riconversione di territori abbandonati dalla crisi del colonialismo. Il tema principale è la sostenibilità intesa come creazione di una possibilità di sviluppo economico oltre che sociale, nel rispetto ambientale. L'iniziativa proposta da "La Nuova Africa", un gruppo di lavoro che mette a disposizione il proprio know-how e che vuole promuovere la vocazione agricola dei terreni in territorio africano, consiste nell'idea di sviluppare un progetto sociale dedicato esclusivamente a tre forti esigenze emerse localmente: migliorare le condizioni di vita dei minori, migliorare le condizioni igienico sanitarie e implementare l'istruzione. 


Il piano sociale si fonda sull'iniziativa "Adotta un campo - aiuta un bimbo" e prevede lo sviluppo agricolo di un'area di 45 ettari divisi in 2000 campi con rendita annua ad uso sociale , destinati ognuno al sostentamento di un bimbo. I campi ad uso sociale costituiranno l'espansione di 15 villaggi esistenti e potranno avvalersi del supporto del sistema infrastrutturale e dei servizi realizzati nell'ambito del piano industriale.

Il progetto prevede anche la realizzazione di centri di formazione, un centro medico di assistenza, un centro dove poter lavorare i prodotti e l'aggiunta di coltivazioni e allevamento.


L'iniziativa prevede:

- donazioni di quote a partire da 200 euro annui per l'adozione di un campo i cui ricavati andranno ad aiutare un bimbo della comunità locale;

- con l'adozione di ogni campo ad uso sociale si richiederà l'assegnazione di un'area per lo sviluppo di agricoltura conservativa e di un'area equivalente da dedicare alla preservazione della biodiversità;

- altre donazioni saranno utilizzate per attrezzare le scuole e aprire punti di primo soccorso nei villaggi del Niari.

story:
CSI is a humanitarian organization that provides free surgical services to enhance the lives of underprivileged children.

  • Children’s Surgery International is a non-profit organization which serves underprivileged children around the world by providing free surgical services in a compassionate, and culturally sensitive manner while providing  professional training, education and support to surgeons, nurses and other caregivers in their local communities.

  • Many of these children have no other access to medical, let alone surgical services. Our surgeries include reconstructive surgery for cleft lips and palates, facial deformities, urological malformations and general pediatric surgery.

  • Our goal is to provide the locations we visit with the proper skills and resources so they can perform the procedures locally and eventually no longer require our services through our network of professionals and volunteers  .

  • We are a humanitarian organization dependent upon volunteerism and donations from foundations, corporations and individuals. For CSI to provide free medical surgery in third world countries we need to meet a certain amount of funds each year.We are looking for contributions to support our next mission trips to Bahir Dar Ethiopia and Vietnam in February 2016.

  • Contributions help CSI to provide highly specialized surgical services performed by top-notch pediatric providers. 

    - Surgical supplies that allow for safe and high quality care.

    - Education supplies used to teach local healthcare providers.

    - Medical equipment for local medical providers that promote self-sufficiency.

Our Goal: To raise $10,000 to support upcoming missions in 2016 to Ethiopia and Vietnam. 

The Impact

CSI is unique among pediatric surgical mission organizations in that they measure success not just in terms of numbers of patients served or surgeries performed. Success is also measured by how many local health care professionals have received training and enhanced their skills, allowing them to treat their own patients in the future. 

CSI carefully chooses locations around the world who show interest in enhancing their training, in addition to allowing CSI teams to perform surgeries.  Surgeries are performed alongside local professionals. CSI forms relationships and commits to returning until that hospital has what it needs to take care of the children they serve, and their staff can confidently perform the surgeries independently.

At CSI, volunteerism and teamwork are essential. Talented teams of surgeons perform reconstructive surgery for cleft lip and palates, facial and neck deformities, urological malformations and also general pediatric surgery. Anesthesiologists, Nurse Anesthetists, Pediatricians and Pediatric Nurses care for children with the support of essential volunteer non-medical mission volunteers.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to talk to your family and friends about CSI as they continue to expand and impact more lives. Even if you are unable to leave a contribution we are always looking for volunteers wanting to join us on our mission trips. If you would like to know more about CSI, visit their website.

story:
As internet connectivity improves in Africa, our survey of 3000 African teachers showed us that 90% of them are searching the web for curriculum resources and information to improve their classroom teaching. 

Despite this, they said the internet sources they find do not meet the needs of the African curriculum, nor is it relatable  to the African environment. This leaves teachers no choice but to continue using outdated information to deliver lessons. To eliminate this challenge, the Einstower team developed an innovative solution with the support of SPARK at the University of Leeds. 

The solution? TeacherLearn.

 

 

TeacherLearn is the first ever web-based application which provides teachers in Africa with easy access to quality training and local educational resources all at the click of a button.  We collaborate with top teachers in Africa to create classroom-tested resources, which are specifically tailored to improve classroom teaching and students’ learning outcomes.

So far, we have tested TeacherLearn with hundreds of teachers and the response was fantastic:
“Lesson planning became so much easier’
“My students’ engagement in class shot up hugely!”
“Finally this has arrived! Bonus: So user-friendly!!”

After such positive feedback and effective impact, we want to grow and expand TeacherLearn in terms of number of resources and teacher training courses we provide. Doing that requires a huge amount of finance. 

by contributing a small sum, thousands of teachers will have access to quality support and resources tailored to improve learning outcomes for millions of children in Africa.

 

SCREENSHOTS FROM THE PLATFORM

 

 

 

Most teachers want to transform their classrooms but they need that extra support and resources to do so. TeacherLearn is designed to support teachers who are looking:

  • To develop their teaching skills 
  • For guidance on how best to teach their curriculum subject
  • For local content and stories to improve classroom teaching delivery and students’ learning outcomes but find it difficult to find the appropriate content and sources
  • To support students with learning disabilities and difficulties in their classroom but do not have the training. learning resources and support to do so.

 

 

 

Since 2016, we have invested time and money into the following: 

  • Identify and train teachers to be content creators for other struggling teachers
  • Designing our platform, www.teacher-learn.com, so it can be adaptable on both desktop and mobile phones and handle the capacity of over a million teachers using it
  • Successfully carried out beta testing of TeacherLearn with 300 target teachers in Nigeria
  • Created over 1000 resources 
  • Created our first TeacherLearn community: a community of teachers from 10 schools in Port Harcourt, Nigeria who come together to learn from each other and exchange ideas.

 

 

Our target is to raise £42,000 by December 2019. We will use the funds to:

  1. Content creation + Build more partnerships with top teachers in Africa

We are looking to add more content to TeacherLearn. More specifically, we plan to add 8,000 resources by the end of 2020. To do this, we need to partner with more teachers who can create quality and effective resource packs.  

Teachers are paid a commission for each Resource Pack they create. 

    One Resource Pack (contains 4 resources) = £12

    We are looking to create 2,000 Resource Packs (8,000 resources) = £24,000

 

2)   Recruit graphic designers to support our current team 

After the content has been created, we need skilled people to convert and design the resources into an electronic format so that it can be accessible to teachers on the platform.

To achieve our goals, we will want to add 3 graphic designers to the team to keep up with the workload:

   To pay 1 graphic designer = £3,000 (yearly)

   Therefore, we need £9,000 (yearly) to pay 3 graphic designers. 

(PLEASE NOTE: These wages represent the average monthly wage of a graphic designer in most African countries. It is, in most cases, 3 times the minimum wage.)

 

3)  Marketing

The remaining £9,000 will be used to create more awareness about TeacherLearn through marketing. Consequently, we can reach out to more schools and teachers to help transform their classrooms and students’ learning outcomes.

 

 

By raising £40,000, we will be able to fully launch TeacherLearn into schools in Nigeria, then expand to other African Countries.

We want to end the era of sending unprepared, under-trained teachers into African classrooms.

TeacherLearn will provide quality and effective support, training and resources to teachers and schools across the continent. Not only will this improve learning outcomes for millions of children in Africa, millions of teachers will have achieved an exceptional standard of training to unlock the potential of all of their students.

 

 

1)  Click this link to know the Einstower story.

2) Click this link to know about our other projects.

 

 

SPREAD THE MESSAGE

Please join us to transform classrooms, teaching standards and students’ learning outcomes in Africa through TeacherLearn.

If you cannot donate, please help contribute by sharing our campaign to everyone you know, especially to those who want to make a difference and have a passion for education and equal opportunities for students all around the world.

 

THANK YOU

story:
My name is Dayra Gaitan Crespo and I am originally from Rivera, Colombia. I moved to Salt Lake City, Utah in 1999, right after graduating with a BA in Modern Languages, from Universidad Surcolombiana. I also hold a M.Ed. in TESOL from Grand Canyon University, and have worked as an ESL teacher since 2003.

As a language teacher of over 15 years, I have become very familiar not only with my students’ struggle to learn due to their low reading levels or limited English skills, but also my colleagues’ frustration with the lack of adequate resources to help these students. Most of the online resources currently available have been created by big name corporations or by people who have never taught in a classroom, making them unfit for the real needs of today’s teachers and students. That’s why Elliteracy was born! I was committed to creating an online educational platform to help teachers become more effective in helping their students improve their oral reading fluency, pronunciation and spelling. All of this, while giving them the flexibility to use their own curriculum and providing them with state of the art technology that allows students to receive immediate input, as if their teacher were right by them!

This increasing urgency to help my students and peers, fueled my desire to make this idea a reality. I could not let one more year go by without creating Elliteracy. I knew I had to risk it all. With my husband’s encouragement and support, we set out on this journey. We started our business plan and contacted several developers, all which agreed on how complex and costly this project would be. Although we did not reach our funding goal here on indiegogo, we were able to complete the development of our site, and are happy to say that we are live now at www.elliteracy.com

Since the end of the school year is approaching, we have decided to allow the site to grow organically for now, as we continue to test and improve every feature.  We have some teachers already registered, who like me, get to use Elliteracy with their English language learners and struggling readers, every day. As a teacher, nothing is more rewarding than seeing your students feel empowered to learn and that’s exactly what Elliteracy does. When students complete recording their reading, they not only receive a score with the number of correct words read, but also, a list of the specific words that were mispronounced. They are then, able to hover over the words and listen to the correct pronunciation, repeat the words, listen to the whole passage again, and even listen to their own recording! ELLiteracy helps teachers give specific and timely feedback to individual students, a teaching practice almost impossible to implement in our large classrooms. ELLiteracy helps students take ownership on their learning while building a growth mindset. They realize that with practice, a good teacher, and a little help from technology, they too can be successful in school. As in the words of author George Couros, “Technology will not replace great teachers, but technology in the hands of great teachers can be transformational.”

My hope is that today, you too, feel encouraged to make a difference in the learning experience of millions of students, whether signing up or sharing this project with your friends and families.

I hope you can  help us,

                                                      help teachers,

                                                                                          help their students!

 

                                                     Thank you, Dayra.

story:
The Story of Two Families -- Tragedy and Joy 
 

TRAGEDY:  June 15, 2015 was the last breakfast the Andersen family ate together. It was rushed, with quick kisses and a scolding for 3 year old Bobby for spilling his milk.  Later that morning Bobby found the gun his father had hidden in the closet under his sweaters. He looked down the barrel,and accidentally pulled the trigger.  Five months later – wracked with guilt, blame and tears – Bobby’s family ripped apart.     

JOY:  December 15, 2012 was the day before Jackie’s 8th birthday. He was excited as he searched  for his hidden presents -- but he found a gun in his dad’s bedside drawer.  Jackie grabbed the gun!  The gun started to wail a loud siren noise and there was a black thing covering the trigger.  Jackie pushed the scary gun back in the drawer and turned --his mother stood in the doorway.  Five years later, Jackie is healthy and alive.  Dad’s gun is still in the drawer, protected from curious teenagers.

"This campaign is not about gun control.  It is about gun safety. 
We can all agree on that."

 

Headlines Show the Tragedies

“Gun that killed Eric Klyaz, 10-year-old Scripps boy, was kept loaded.” 
"Savion Barrow, Rock Hill boy, killed by self-inflicted gunshot wound." 
"4-year-old William Andersen kills himself while playing with a gun.” 
"Leslie Wilcox dead of gunshot wound to head, suicide suspected."

Statistics show that in this next hour a child just like these will likely lie dead from a bullet or be fighting for his life in an ambulance rushing to the ER, his hysterical parents asking themselves, “What did we do wrong?  How could we let this happen?!”  
 

Our Mission & Message

First, we must warn over 22,000,000 families with guns and young children that their hidden guns are NOT safe. They are pain and death waiting for a child – unless they are protected. 

Second, we must show parents new gun guards that kids cannot remove, but adults can take off quickly in an emergency, without a key.  Unprotected guns are one of the leading causes of accidental child deaths!

We support using any device to stop a child from pulling the trigger!  But our favorite is the new CHILDSAFE1, a trigger blocker that no child has ever removed -- but trained adults can remove in 2 seconds.  It has two loud alarms to scare kids and warn parents the moment it is touched. It fits most handguns and long guns, and is easy to carry in a car or purse. Dads love it, and moms, too!

*** click HERE to learn more about ChildSafe1 ***

 

Your contribution lets us warn parents with kids in mortal danger.  Remember, a child is shot every hour of every day. 
 

Every dollar you give will warn 5 families 
and help protect 10 children!


Parents and grandparents don’t realize a hidden gun can actually put their family at more risk!   It takes over 30 seconds to find and ready most hidden guns. More in a panic. Too long!

The best gun safety device stops children, but comes off fast. That’s why our top rated trigger blocker is ChildSafe1.  Why?

  • ChildSafe1 has a lock no child has ever removed
  • Dual LOUD alarms that warn parents and frighten kids
  • A 2-second release once parents learn how.
  • No key, combination, or fingerprint reader. It resembles a childproof medicine cap.
  • Ready now to save lives, like all other devices recommended on our website


A Story of how a trigger
blocker saved a Phoenix Family

Click Photo to see video

 

How Your Contribution Will Be Used

30% for mass advertising on radio, TV, print, social media and billboards.

15% for direct contact with retailers and gun trainers.

25% for outreach to parents, parent groups, civic and religious organizations, police departments, and Individual volunteers to spread the word. Events will let us reach gun dealers, parenting conferences, gun trainer workshops, women’s self-defense training events, among others.

20% for purchase of #1 rated ChildSafe1 units directly from manufacturer to distribute, including to nonprofits and low-income families if enough is raised. Otherwise all funds will go to directly warning parents.

5% donated to other charities which promote teenage suicide prevention programs.

5% administrative costs, including professional services, printing, postage, videos, website, etc.  Not one dollar of your support will go for rent or salary expenses.

    

Talk to your kids about gun safety.  That's critical! 

But remember they are children, not little adults.

The burden of safety is on the parents, not the kids!      

 

Timeline: When Will We Start Protecting Children?

NOW!  There is NO DELAY in putting your gifts to work protecting at-risk children! 

*** We’ve already spent over $25,000 in our quest to save children. ***

The day this campaign closes, we will start . . .

  • sending out tens of thousands of emails to families;
  • blasting the news on paid social media – Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn, etc;
  • firing up our massive advertising on Google, Twitter, Instagram and Facebook so parents looking for help will immediately find us;
  • buying targeted radio and even some television ads;
  • placing already developed print ads in family magazines;
  • contacting over 100 groups whose focus is protecting children.
    teens, and families;
  • contacting reporters at newspapers, magazines, online, and radio & TV for press stories
  • and much, much more – depending on what we raise in this campaign. 

The more generous you are, the more families we will reach!  For example, with a $100 contribution, we can warn 500 families and protect 1,000 children -- thanks to you. 

You can choose whether your money is spent nationally or in just your state.  And our newsletter updates you on how many families we’ve warned so far.

How Many Kids do You Want to Protect?

ALL gifts are Tax-Deductible!

 Everyone wants to save children from disfiguring or deadly gunshots.  Each support level includes free Thank You Gifts.

 How many kids do you want to protect? 
Your contribution x 10 = the children you will protect!

There is NO DELAY in putting your gift to good use saving children!  Warnings go out daily.

IMPORTANT NOTE on REWARDS:  If you selected a Reward with any Expert consultations, you'll receive an email with a list of the specific topics and experts to choose from.

PLEASE CONTRIBUTE NOW.  It may be the best deed you do all year!

story:
$25,000 enables more teachings, more connection, more sangha, more often. 
 

We plan to invest $25,000 in: 

  • a new digital home 
  • a technological streamlining, bringing our courses from Realize and weekly sitting at Worldwide Insight together onto one place, making it more accessible and available. 
  • New on demand courses, available for your download as and when you like!
  • 50 more weekly teachings! 
  • Closer partnership with local meditation groups. 
  • A closer working relationship with you, our loyal community.
  • A team of people to spend the time each week lining up teachers, polishing the system, pressing the buttons and sweeping our virtual meditation hall. It takes love, care and hard work to be ready every week! 

We want to bring the platform, the teachers and you, the community, closer together. 
 

Why Fund The Campaign?


Each and every $ donated is a gift, a seed which strengthens our sangha. 

Thousands of people have sat together in our Sunday sessions. 

That’s you in Australia, New Zealand, America, the UK, Finland, Israel, France and Holland, taking our seats, our virtual cushions, every Sunday. 

Together. 

Thousands have downloaded Martin Aylward, Stephen Batchelor, Caverly Morgan and Ruth King direct to their pockets and enjoyed their courses and teachings on their way to work, on train journeys, or just sitting at home. 

Each sit, each course, each session we wake up a little bit more, together. 

Together, we make the sangha stronger. 

Join us and share in some of these amazing benefits:

  • online courses with renowned teachers
  • a private group session every three months with four of our teachers
  • lifetime access to all content

And more! 
 

A Final Word  

Whilst our campaign is short term, our hopes are long term.  

We believe more people enjoying more teachings more of the time is a necessary thing. We believe more and more of us waking up together, online, is a good and necessary thing.  

If you share that vision, then support us however you can. With love, goodwill, by sharing the campaign with friends and, of course, with money!

story:
"I started The GEMS Camp for the girls who are ridiculed for being smart. Girls who do everything they're supposed to do, but have to stay in their environments just because they don't have anywhere else to go. I wanted to give them what was given to me - a quality learning experience that changed my life." ~ Saki L. Milton, Founder 

Since 2010, The GEMS Camp has engaged more than 300 girls in Dallas and Houston in STEM. Our holistic approach addresses risk factors that are barriers for traditionally underserved populations in STEM. With your generous gift of any size, you help make this summer possible for them. Go ahead, get your bling on by giving  a donation of any size. You'll receive a small token of appreciation for each giving level just to say, "Thank you."

So, jump in and take a look around our campaign site...Share within your network. We've tried to tell you our story as it continues to unfold. #BLING

What We are Doing...

Our goal is to raise $10,000 for both summer programs -- the 2018 global STEM trip to Italy (June 5-21) and the 2018 GEMS Summer Camp held at the University of North Texas at Dallas (June 24-30). Your gift is 100% tax-deductible and all proceeds go towards programming expenses --travel, housing fees, insurance, meals, airfare, transportation, meals, technology access, uniform, and learning supplies.

Italy...Eight of our precious Gems will experience a 17-day trip to Italy that involves exploring both modern and ancient architecture in the beautiful cities of Rome, Naples and Florence as well as finding out more about STEM fields internationally. By partnering with us, you can change the trajectory of a girls' future by giving her U.S. Passport access to the world.

UNT Dallas...Our flagship summer camp returns with a twist - residential housing. We believe girls will get a true campus life experience while learning new content, developing as leaders, and building bonds of friendship. Girls apply and 30 rising 7th-9th grade students will be accepted and mentored by local high school and college female STEM scholars. Guest speakers represent STEM-based organizations in the Dallas-Fort Worth area such as FritoLay-Pepsico, Mary Kay Cosmetics, Hilti, Microsoft and much more. Your gift opens the door to endless possibilities for girls who are traditionally underrepresented in STEM fields.

View our Prezi to learn more about what we do and why we do it.

GIVING LEVELS AND PERKS

story:
Spread the word!

 

Use the IndieGoGo social media tools to share our campaign!

Follow us on Twitter @moonshotinc and retweet our campaign!

Follow us on Facebook @moonshotincubator and share our campaign!

Share our Moonshot Incubator Trailer with everyone you know!

story:
Hi!  My name is Sharon Meade and I am a survivor of childhood abuse who developed Dissociative Identity Disorder (Multiple Personality Disorder) as a way to cope with the on-going trauma in my early childhood.  After three years of intensive therapy, a lot of inner healing and doing things afraid, I have fully integrated and no longer have parts (altars).  

This campaign will be used to create a professional three-minute sizzle reel (DVD) to send to potential hosts (churches, mental health facilities, conferences, hospitals, women's groups, crisis centers, domestic violence shelters etc.) for inspirational speaking engagements.  It will include professional video editing, blank DVDs, cases, mailing expenses, flyers, and labeling costs.  Additionally, it will cover the cost of a lunch and learn session to introduce the ministry to our local community in order to share this newly available resource.  One person reached out to me and it gave me hope and opened up the door to my healing.  Because of one person, I felt loved and was able to allow the Lord to heal my deepest wounds.  Sharing this message of hope and healing could be the difference between life and death for someone feeling suicidal in the same way I used to feel.  I am so thankful that I learned that I am valuable and that God loves me extravagantly.  I no longer have panic attacks, nightmares, flashbacks, self-harming behaviors, or deep depression and hopelessness.  It is so important that trauma victims know that God loves them, and healing is available for them too!  Your contributions will help us achieve an avenue to get this message out to hurting women everywhere.  The Lord has done many miracles in the last four years of this journey and I believe that He has only just begun.  He has given me a vision of speaking in front of thousands of people, bringing hope to the broken and setting the captives free (Isaiah 61:1). 

Estimated startup cost: $500.00

Philips DM4S6H00F/17 4.7GB 16X DVD-R Recordable Video Discs (Pack of 100) $22.59

Fellowes 98335 Slim Jewel Case, 100 Pack $23.59

Avery CD Labels - 100 Disc labels & 200 Spine Labels $23.98

Avery CD/DVD Label Applicator $9.49

Professional HD video recording and editing $300.00

Shipping & handling charges $100.00 (The average cost to send out a CD in a jewel case or Single DVD in the case in a padded envelope, First Class within the US is approx. $2.00 with delivery confirmation.  Hand delivery will lessen a number of DVDs requiring mailing.)

Lunch & Learn budget $500.00 

  • Subs, chips, drinks, desert 
  • Information packet 
  • promotional takeaways (ink pens, magnets, sizzle reel DVD) 
  • facility (free)
  • staff (free/volunteer) 

What You Get

We are excited to be offering one of a kind perks by providing digital photos of authentic journal entries from Sharon's personal therapy sessions while she was in treatment for Dissociative Identity Disorder.  In addition to these fascinating entries, you will receive the story behind the photo that explains the journal entry and how healing occurred in that particular situation.  

If we do not reach our entire goal, all funds we do raise will be put first towards creating the DVDs and then remaining money will be put towards awareness and distribution.  

PLEASE SHARE!

Everyone knows someone who's life has been affected by trauma.  Please share this with friends and family and on social media to help spread the word!  

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Check back for updates to see what awesome things God does through this campaign!  

Thank you and blessings to you!
story_txt:
Hi!  My name is Sharon Meade and I am a survivor of childhood abuse who developed Dissociative Identity Disorder (Multiple Personality Disorder) as a way to cope with the on-going trauma in my early childhood.  After three years of intensive therapy, a lot of inner healing and doing things afraid, I have fully integrated and no longer have parts (altars).  
This campaign will be used to create a professional three-minute sizzle reel (DVD) to send to potential hosts (churches, mental health facilities, conferences, hospitals, women's groups, crisis centers, domestic violence shelters etc.) for inspirational speaking engagements.  It will include professional video editing, blank DVDs, cases, mailing expenses, flyers, and labeling costs.  Additionally, it will cover the cost of a lunch and learn session to introduce the ministry to our local community in order to share this newly available resource.  One person reached out to me and it gave me hope and opened up the door to my healing.  Because of one person, I felt loved and was able to allow the Lord to heal my deepest wounds.  Sharing this message of hope and healing could be the difference between life and death for someone feeling suicidal in the same way I used to feel.  I am so thankful that I learned that I am valuable and that God loves me extravagantly.  I no longer have panic attacks, nightmares, flashbacks, self-harming behaviors, or deep depression and hopelessness.  It is so important that trauma victims know that God loves them, and healing is available for them too!  Your contributions will help us achieve an avenue to get this message out to hurting women everywhere.  The Lord has done many miracles in the last four years of this journey and I believe that He has only just begun.  He has given me a vision of speaking in front of thousands of people, bringing hope to the broken and setting the captives free (Isaiah 61:1). 
Estimated startup cost: $500.00
Philips DM4S6H00F/17 4.7GB 16X DVD-R Recordable Video Discs (Pack of 100) $22.59
Fellowes 98335 Slim Jewel Case, 100 Pack $23.59
Avery CD Labels - 100 Disc labels & 200 Spine Labels $23.98
Avery CD/DVD Label Applicator $9.49
Professional HD video recording and editing $300.00
Shipping & handling charges $100.00 (The average cost to send out a CD in a jewel case or Single DVD in the case in a padded envelope, First Class within the US is approx. $2.00 with delivery confirmation.  Hand delivery will lessen a number of DVDs requiring mailing.)
Lunch & Learn budget $500.00 

Subs, chips, drinks, desert 
Information packet 
promotional takeaways (ink pens, magnets, sizzle reel DVD) 
facility (free)
staff (free/volunteer) 


What You Get
We are excited to be offering one of a kind perks by providing digital photos of authentic journal entries from Sharon's personal therapy sessions while she was in treatment for Dissociative Identity Disorder.  In addition to these fascinating entries, you will receive the story behind the photo that explains the journal entry and how healing occurred in that particular situation.  
If we do not reach our entire goal, all funds we do raise will be put first towards creating the DVDs and then remaining money will be put towards awareness and distribution.  
PLEASE SHARE!
Everyone knows someone who's life has been affected by trauma.  Please share this with friends and family and on social media to help spread the word!  
Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Check back for updates to see what awesome things God does through this campaign!  
Thank you and blessings to you!

story:
Our Slovenian Beekeeping Mission:

Our goal is to be the first school in the United States to build, and maintain, a Slovenian hive. We need your help to accomplish our goal! Slovenian beekeeping is a technique that originated in Slovenia over 100 years ago.  Slovenian beekeeping is more efficient, and is healthier for both bees and humans.

We were inspired by the fact that Slovenian students of all ages learn beekeeping basics and the bee’s importance to the environment. We hope to spread that concept here in the US by offering AZ hive tour, workshops for local aggricultual groups, beekeeping associations, and schools. We also hope to start a 4-H club in our county that focuses on bees because there is not one in our county currently.

Within our classroom this hive will help us achieve our secondary goal of expanding our microeconomy by selling nucs, expanding our current honey sales, and various products from the hive (lip balm, creams, soap, and candles).

We also hope to start a scientific research, with comparing and contrasting the Langstroth hive with the Slovenian hive.  

Our School:

Woodside Montessori Academy offers the full Montessori educational experience, educating students from three years old through eighth grade. Our school offers a challenging and stimulating academic environment where students are guided by faculty members who are knowledgeable, dedicated, and caring. Our in-school academic atmosphere is complemented by the wide variety of real life experiences.

Based largely on Dr. Maria Montessori’s ideals and teachings, our program reflects a love and respect for each student. It is completely student-centered, with a commitment to the success and happiness of each of our students.

As a community we recognized the need for an adolescent program which would meet the unique psychosocial characteristics of the student of the third plane. We feel that the addition of the adolescent program to the school community creates a point of satisfaction and fulfillment in ushering our young adolescent students into high school in a healthy, self confident manner and well prepared. They are a vital, integrated part of the community; they are leaders for younger students and models for what a healthy adolescent can be.

The mission of the adolescent program is to provide opportunities for adolescents to be self-confident and gain self-knowledge, to belong to a community, to learn to be adaptable, to be academically competent and challenged, and to create a vision for their personal future; thus, to empower early adolescents.

What We Need & What You Get

Our expenses break down into two categories - the physical needs of the Slovenian Bee House and the educational needs of the young beekeeper.

Physical expenses include: Preparation of the site, fencing and installation, building materials for the house and construction fees, eight two-level hives, four nucs, comb foundation, hive tools, bee suits, smoke sticks, Carniolan bees.

Educational expenses include: Travel to Slovenia for eight students and two adults with the leading US expert on Slovenian hives, Suzanne Brouillette. Slovenia is the size of New Hampshire but has over 10,000 beekeepers, during this trip students will be immersed on Slovenian culture and have opportunity visit a variety of hives and learn from their keepers. We will also visit two schools to see how they run their educational programs so that we can bring that home to our community.

Money made from this campaign will be spent first on physical expenses and then on educational expenses.

When you contribute to our project we will share with you some of the products that come from our hive, handcrafted artwork, and tours of this unique bee house. Your contributions will help bring environmental awareness, a love of bees, and help us become the first school with a Slovenian bee house in the United States. See the “perks” section of our site for complete details on how we will show our gratitude for your donation.

About Slovenian Hives

Slovenian beekeeping is a technique that originated in Slovenia over 100 years ago! Slovenian beekeeping is more efficient, and is healthier for both bees and humans. It removes the burden of lifting an eighty pound hive super, (where the honey is stored) so smaller children and adults who may not be able lift such a heavy object. The frames where the bees reside slide out of the back of the hive, which removes the hassle of having to lift the top off and take everything out, including the bees, which aggravates them. A Slovenian Hive allows the bees to be much calmer and more peaceful than in the Langstroth hive.  Since we have children on campus who are very young, and hope to bring people of all ages and abilities to learn about bees, calmer bees who are less likely to sting are ideal.

    The Slovenian bee house is essentially a shed with specially fitted beehives placed in the front, where the bees’ entrances/exits are located. In the house, there is enough room for storage and a work space for honey extraction and/or other necessities and/or activities that we may need to do to take care of the bees.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute monetarily but you can help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign with friends and family!
