story:
We have developed and designed Belarusian, English, French, German, Greek, Italian, 
Portuguese, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Swedish and Ukrainian  languages and we want to make an invoiced Braille alphabet's Lit-Lotto for blinds.

We've already made an organic prototype with all our love, it remains good old games when all family with guests and neighbours kids sat around one table. Rules of Lit-Lotto appeals to the classic number’s lotto’s mechanic that is proven by several generations of players. We bring some new conditions and details to make the process of learning language easy and funny. Everybody is involved.

 

It can be more than one winner. You can add your own rules to this simple mechanic: with a leader who spells every letter or without, with special Christmas prizes and a ribbon on the Wish-tree. The most important thing is learning languages and culture with the pleasure of learning. We propose this ready to use product as a good addition to your Christmas table. As well, every proverb has it's own very deep meaning, and for me, it's important which one I pull out today - it remains me the Christmas guessing game. We left a shirt of a card with a proverb for therapeutic colouring - fine motoric is very important for developing linguistic skills. And the icing on the cake is philosophy: we let our kids tie a ribbon on the Wish oak every time they win the LIT-LOTTO, we explain to them that wishes could be different, but only those can make you happier that contain love and care about others. We illustrated this idea by the qualitative production line: the philosophical musical, the calendar-tree and other magic souvenirs. 

We are an international multidisciplinary team (Belarus - UK), creative agency Smart Space Farm - with successful experience in design, production, music, theatre, events, agriculture, and marketing. We do amazing things, moved by creativity and the idea of social enterprise, trying to develop new ideas instantly and every day, but first of all 

We are mothers: 

As mothers, we want our children to grow up wise and educated in the ways of the world. In order to create a bright future for them, we’ve looked to the past—using traditional storytelling methods to educate children, better preparing them to participate in the modern world.

Ulia Kudzina is the creator of the social media brand OhMyDoeling! The author of the idea of Magic calendar and a social entrepreneur, the co-founder of Smart Space Farm. 

She is   a mother of two kids, she is the producer of the  philosophical musical “The Wish-Oak grew on the Green Doeling's Head" . It’s a Christmas story full built upon the traditions that we grew up with and we are honoured to share it with you. A Good Magician carved a Doeling figure and gave it the power to realise people's desires. But before the Green Doeling's power could be activated, it would have to complete a quest to understand what makes people the most happy. 

The Green Doeling travelled the world asking everyone “what would make you happy?" But everyone had different desires: love, a successful career, more rain for their crops, less rain and more sunshine—there was no end to the variety of answers that the Doeling was given. In the end, just as Green Doeling was ready to give up, she had the idea that only those wishes could make people happier, that contain love and care about others. Once Green Doeling understood this very truth, the Wish-Oak started to grow from the Green Doelings head.

Nika Wegosky  co-founder of Smart Space Farm

She is the creator of the conception of Lit-lotto, an art-activist and a mum of two smart boys. We made a charity festival OhMyDoeling! together around this Philosophical musical fairy tale on the Christmas holidays'15

And we appreciate working together. Prolonging the Green Doeling's story, I wrote a little fairy-tale about Bubby who came to the Wish-oak, tied a ribbon around a branch and asked to become a cosmonaut, but the ribbon has untied. 
- Why? - asked Bubby
- Because your wish is not wise - answered Doeling
- So how can I make a wise wish? - wondered Bubby
-  Ask for wisdom and tie the ribbon again - and you will see then - suggested Doeling
After Bubby asked for wisdom, acorns from the Wish-oak became letter-tiles, and leaves became cards with proverbs. 
- What do I have to do with all of this? - asked Bubby
- Learn all proverbs and come again -  Doeling replied - a wise wish will come true. 
That's why one, who wins in LIT-LOTTO set, ties a ribbon around the "Wish Oak"

 

Every product with the OhMyDoeling! label contributes to charity. In a case of LIT-LOTTO, we will donate part of the income to create the LIT-LOTTO for visually impaired and blind people in Braille alphabet.  We want to make the world of the visually impaired kids cuter because somebody cares.  Our aim is to create an invoiced LIT-LOTTO that will have several regimes from 3 to 10  with different sounds of the same letter because Braille is the same for different languages. We want to make the world of cecutient people more broad and understandable, available for socialisation and friendly. Because of we care, and we want this world to be a nice place for everybody. That's what our PERKS are about: all of them are tactile in different ways. We want to share this feeling with you. You are welcome to check it. 

Our dream is to start our own complete energy sufficient production line, but before that we plan to release 1200 sets of LIt-Lotto in different languages - we are in one step from production stage and this step is 19 000 Pounds. Please help us to raise - and we will make great social impact in fun and creative way. 
We have greate conception of development as an educational you-tube channel and an application that help kids to let their computer time with purpose for their brains. But to develop all this we need your helping hand - please think for a second, if you care, please, help and share the news about us.

We've already had a conception of the game for helping visually impaired people to learn reading, And there is a team of professionals who is ready to start, but we haven't found a business partners yet, that's why we apply for the crowdfund - and you are one of those, who can help. 

  • We've assembled an amazing team to bring to your home an hour without screens with a nice, ecological, from natural materials product, that teaches language and wisdom. 

We need funds to make LIT-LOTTO affordable in every language that has alphabet - you get a LIT-LOTTO set in a language you've chosen. 

  • We need funds for equipment to make letter-tiles from the best ecological birch tree, with laser-graphic on them, to print things, to sew pouches from natural linen, for logistic and designing LIT-LOTTO in new languages - we can cover all of this just partly, that's why we need your help.
  • And you will get unique perks in change: your family will get LIT-LOTTO in English, Italian, French, Portuguese,Spanish, Russian, Ukrainian, Belarusian and other languages  (watch PERKS - for details) by special, lower than retail, price earlier than a Christmas. 
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal? Answer : Our goal is to start with 1200 of LIT-LOTTO sets in one batch - to make it affordable for a customer, but we can make it less or more, but it will cost more or less for us. Anyway, we want to develop this direction. All PERKS will be delivered in time anyway. 

The Impact

We want our children to grow wise and educated in a wise and educated world. And what is wiser than proverbs that passed down through history from tongue to tongue? and what is making people more educated than knowing languages?
We hope that

  • Lit-Lotto will become great instrument for integrating emigrants and their kids into the society and culture. 
  • As soon as Lit-Lotto becomes popular it can give a job from 7 till 15 talented people including visually impaired people. 
  • Blind kids will find out easy way to learn Braille alphabet and new language
    If you care, please, donate - it depends on your decision very much. 

  • I think you want the same good things for your children too, as every parent does - so let do it together
  • We have a quite good portfolio about making the world better check our Youtube channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoOob2Nd3ivTEli4iqFYiBw and our Facebook .https://www.facebook.com/smartspacefarm/ 
  • We were honored to participate in the TEDx Niamiha conference to present our Charity Oakwood: from idea to realization. 

Risks & Challenges

There are several risks we are worried about 

  • Too little bakers and too much bakers - we have troubleshooting plan for every scenario for being sure you will get your LIT-LOTTO before Christmas
  • December is busy time for all mailers and deliverers - we cared about our logistic plan - to make sure that every set will be delivered on time. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute but you like the idea - you can help anyway 

  • Like the LIT-LOTTO Facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/LittLotto/ and share it with your friends who learn new languages or have toddlers.
  • We will donate several sets of LIT-LOTTO to those who has liked us and those who shares our campaign news since the campaign started - so it's a chance to get one LIT-LOTTO or the Magic Doeling wooden figure for pushing buttons. 
  • We often make promotions for the Magic Doeling owners, so please follow our community on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/LittLotto/
  • Contact us by mail smartspacefarm@gmail.com
  • Check our web-page smartspacefarm.com
  • And do not hesitate to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

And do not hesitate to use the Indiegogo share tools!


And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who Am I?

To assist the reader in understanding the veracity of the following information, I have included a link to my YouTube video that demonstrates the ancient knowledge and the legend that belongs to my family name.

I am the direct-lineal descendant of one of the original 10-thousand of the ancient past, and our family is known around the world as the 7 Samurai.

The written prophecies of antiquity identify our ancestral heritage, my birth, purpose, and this is what compels me to fulfill the legend of my family name and my purpose.

This fact is corroborated by data produced by modern science that identifies a population of @250-million in the first millennium whose ancestors were the original 10-thousand.

In the time of my ancestor, everyone was known by their kind (of mankind) and it was essential to know who you are, and what you possess.

In the present, a persons heritage has been lost, and replaced by identities, with names, and labels of race. As a result everyone does not know who they are, and the lack of this knowledge will affect their fate.

Ask Yourself

Would you like the opportunity to confirm or deny if an inhabited world is hiding in plain sight, and would you like to know if you or your loved ones possess a visible mark of an inheritance, or are marked with a curse, and would you like to review a solution that everyone can use to change their fate?

If the answer is yes to any of the 3 questions above, please read the following and click on the links to view the video samples.

OVERVIEW

Explanation of the Fundraising Project - What Participants Receive

The Special Edition purpose and goals summarized for information

a. The opportunity to secure a participation slot.

b. Participants receive the 1 hour Special Edition, 30 minute Video Instruction, Reference Guide used with the ICU Application*

c. The Participation fee covers the cost of licenses for development of ICU Application.

d. The funds are paid to a recognized nonprofit, and public charity, managed by a Board of Directors.

e. The funds are allocated for licenses, video, and remote production.

*The Android ICU Application (v96) is the first release - October 2016

 

The Special Edition communicates Knowledge, Wisdom, & Understanding that everyone can achieve

The Participation program is the early release of the Special Edition

Participants will be able to reserve one of the 1000 Participation Reservations to receive the Special Edition as follows;

Overview of the 1 Hour Program

Video Introduction - The Explanation of Our Existence - The Speck

The Explanation of the 3 Subjects & What Participants Will Learn

An Inhabited World is Hiding in Plain Sight

Would You Like The Opportunity to Photograph - What Is Hiding In Plain Sight?

Photographs have been captured of legendary-mythological living creatures from the writings of antiquity, and participants can produce photographic evidence with their cellphone camera and the ICU Application.

The Mark of Inheritance, The Mark of the Curse

Do You Possess The Mark of the Inheritance or The Mark of the Curse?

Mankind has lost the knowledge of their heritage, because it has been replaced with an identity, and categorized by race to disguise their orgin to prevent them the opportunity to change their fate. Participants will be able to use the scientific method of the Smithsonian to learn who they are, and their cellphone camera with the ICU Application to reveal if they possess an inheritance or a curse.

The Solution Everyone Can Use

Would You Like To Defeat Death & Remove Its Claim On Your Soul?

The mystery is revealed in the writings of antiquity and the instructions are provided to Participants on how to cleanse their flesh with the light of the sun, by using the optimum position to drive darkness out of their bodies that will remove death's claim of their soul/spirit, which is revealed in these writings as their reward. The ICU Application is used with the cellphone to measure the results they achieve and provide photographic evidence of their success.

Summary

The Special Edition communicates Knowledge, Wisdom, & Understanding that everyone can achieve

The Mission of the Program

The mission of this program began with my ancestor who was one of the original 10-thousand that are the ancestors of the 7-billion in the present.

The ancient knowledge of the previous myrietes  (10,000 years) was a secret kept by my family and our physical differences, attributes were used to evaluate the hypothesis of each subject in the Special Edition.

The Purpose of the Program

There is a contentious line drawn between science and the recorded history of religion, separating believers and non-believer and offered an opportunity for a interdisciplinary research that could apply the tools of science to disprove or verify the claims of the humanities.

The Participation Program

The Special Edition is a 3 subject presentation that allows everyone to evaluate the hypothesis, review the references, and by following the instructions in the use of the ICU application to produce photographic evidence for their personal review and consideration.

How Was the Program Formed?

A multidisciplinary research was required to develop a methodology that was simple to present with recognized sources that everyone can use to reacquire this lost knowledge by combining the references of antiquity and comparing the results they will produce.

The Evaluation Framework

The development required the disciplines of science and the participation of the humanities to evaluate the results of the investigation, and produce a presentation that would allow everyone to use their personal knowledge and experience and compare the recognized references and reproducible evidence they will produce.

Summary of the Journey

The journey to this time in the present has required 3-decades of exhaustive investigation, and the commercial development and availability of handheld devices that possess computing power are available to the public and allows everyone to photograph and confirm-what is hiding in plain sight.

The Impact

If everyone used The Solution, according to the writings of antiquity, then death could not claim the remaining souls of mankind.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can get the word out and share what you have read to help those who seek answers to the difficult questions and you can easily use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Important

Nous faisons la vente de lunettes soleil du style Ray Ban Wayfarer munies de branches en aluminium où l'on y retrouve notre logo dessus. Comme sur la photo plus haut!

Message:

  •  Votre financement servira à payer la majeure partie de nos dépenses à l'obtention de nos achats à notre fournisseur!
  •  Nous voulons remercié chaque contributeur qui s'y mette à cœur en leur donnant une récompense!

 L'impact:

  •  Nous sommes fier d'offrir un petit don qui sera irréprochable pour la fondation Mira (5% du coût sur chaque lunettes vendus)
  •  En espérant que vous allez contribuer pour une bonne cause.

story:
We need a new CASITA PAYASA (Clown Prep Home)

We have to leave the space we occupy today as soon as possible and we do not have the resources to do it.

The Clown Prep Home gives us the resources to sustain the social work we do.

It is here, in Casita Payasa, where we meet before and after the visits and interventions to the various places we go to. 

It is here where the classes and workshops are developed.

Casita Payasa is our home.

Necesitamos una nueva CASITA PAYASA

El espacio que ocupamos lo tenemos que dejar lo antes posible y no tenemos los recursos suficientes para hacerlo.

En este espacio se desarrolla la Escuela Clown , que nos brinda los recursos para sustentar la labor social que realizamos.

Es la Casita Payasa donde nos juntamos antes y después de las visitas e intervenciones, donde se desarrolla la Escuela y se dictan los talleres y charlas.

Para nosotros la Casita Payasa es nuestro hogar. 

To achieve this we need your support..

With your collaboration you will become ambassador of joy.  Thanks to you we will graduate more Humanitarian Clowns and bring joy and love to all the places where we are allowed to put our red noses.

We are convinced that the vibration of playful love is so high that it transforms every space we go to, every person we meet; it's totally magical, it is love.

We need $ 30,000 US dollars to be able to rent a new and adequate space, to set it up, refurnish it, and cover the rent for a reasonable amount of time. This funds will help us a lot while we generate the resources through the preparatory school that will permitt the organization to be self-sustaining.

We have beautiful rewards for your support. From being an Ambassador of Joy to sponsoring a young person to become an Emergency Clown Doctor.

The funds we collect, in case of not reaching the goal, will be allocated to the development and implementation of the 13 social projects we have in progress.

Para lograrlo necesitamos de tu apoyo.

Con tu colaboración te convertirás en embajador de la alegría, gracias a tí llegaremos a ser más Payasos Humanitarios y llevar alegría y amor a todos los lugares donde se nos permita meter las narices.

Estamos convencidos que la vibración del amor lúdico es tan alta que transforma cada espacio al que vamos, a cada persona que nos cruzamos, es totalmente mágico, es amor.

Necesitamos $30mil dólarespara poder alquilar un espacio adecuado, acondicionarlo para nosotros y cubrir el alquiler por un tiempo razonable mientras generamos los recursos mediante la escuela para seguir siendo autosostenibles. 

Tenemos hermosas recompensas por tu apoyo. desde ser un embajador de la alegría hasta patrocinar a un joven para que se convierta en un Doctor Payaso de Emergencia.

Los fondos que recaudemos en caso de no llegar a la meta serán destinados al desarrollo e implementación de los 13  proyectos sociales que tenemos.

We want you to know us better

About us?

We are a Peruvian NGO with more than 4 years doing social work patroniced by our school. In addition to visiting hostels, hospitals, prisons and all types of vulnerable population, we develop social projects of different kinds led by our Clown Doctors. 

 Queremos que nos conozcas mejor

¿Quienes somos?

Somos una ONG peruana con más de 4 años haciendo labor social solventada por nuestra escuela. Además de visitar albergues, hospitales, cárceles y todo tipo de población vulnerable, desarrollamos proyectos sociales de diferente índole liderados por nuestros doctores Payaso.

Why do we exist?

Because we believe that joy is the ultimate cure for all kinds of shortcomings and that good mood is key to coping in the best way the difficult moments.

We are sure that SMILE and LOVE are the most powerful weapons.

¿Por que existimos?

Por que creemos que la alegría es la cura máxima para todo tipo de carencias, que el estado de ánimo es determinante para sobrellevar de la mejor manera los momentos difíciles.

Estamos seguros de que la SONRISAy el AMOR son las armas más poderosas.

How do we do it?

We created the Clowns Emergency School where in a period of almost a year we have formed Clown Doctors. The formation of the doctors is guided with love and respect, They go through a deep process of healing and self-knowledge to be ready and heal the neighbor with tools of love.

At the end of humanitarian training, each doctor presents a social assistance thesis, where he must involve his greatest interest and contribute / execute his project with a community giving space to the joy in different populations.

An Emergency Clown Doctor is a person involved with the emotional health and welfare of society.
 

¿Cómo lo hacemos?

Creamos la escuela Payasos de Emergencia en donde en un periodo de casi un año formamos Doctores Payasos. La formación de los doctores es guiada con amor y respeto, Pasan por un proceso profundo de sanación y autoconocimiento para estar listos y sanar al prójimo con herramientas de amor.

Al culminar la formación humanitaria, cada doctor presenta una Tesis de ayuda social, en donde debe involucrar su mayor punto de interés y aportar/ ejecutar su proyecto con una comunidad dandole espacio a la alegría en diferentes poblaciones.

Un doctor Payaso de Emergencia es una persona involucrada con la salud emocional y el bienestar de la sociedad.

 

What have we achieved so far?

+ We have 13 active social projects.

+ We are 13 Emergency Clown doctors who visit all type of population carrying love and joy.

+1056 Clowns have passed through our school.

+ We have 32 volunteers.

+ 384 visits to Hospitals.

+ We have attended 192 emergencies of LOVE.

+ 7680 happy patients have laughed along with us.

+ 8 different Communities intervened. 

+ 6 Theatrical sets.

+ We have seen more than 10 thousand people smiling in our urban interventions.

¿Qué hemos logrado hasta ahora?

+ Tenemos 13 Proyectos Sociales activos.

+ Somos 13 doctores Payasos de Emergencia que visitamos todo tipo de población llevando amor y alegría.

+ Han pasado por nuestra escuela 1056 alumnos Payaso.

+ Contamos con 32 voluntarios sociales.

+ 384 visitas a Hospitales.

+ Hemos atendido 192 emergencias de AMOR.

+ 7680 pacientes felices han reído junto a nosotros.

+ 8 Comunidades Intervenidas.

+ 6 puestas Teatrales.

+ Hemos visto sonreír a mas de 10 mil personas en nuestras intervenciones urbanas.

story:
Short Summary

・We are university students in Osaka,Japan. We major linguistics.

・As I have seen many international students struggle with learning Japanese, I think it's very important to provide a place to write/speak Japanese.

・But in reality, there are not many places where you can really practice writing and speaking Japanese.

・Your donations will be spent for the promotion to let people around the world know about us.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

・We want more people(+10000 people) to know about us and start a really brand new way of learning Japanese.

・We don't need much money but people who really want to learn Japanese seriously. In order to let people know and experience, we need to promote.

・Ever since I entered my university, I've been always interested in teaching Japanese to people around the world.

・The impact

・Currently, there are some similar services like us. 

・But they are usually expensive(+100 USD for an hour) to use and some serious people can not have the chance to learn Japanese by talking to a Japanese person.

・I've taught Japanese to more than 50 international students at my university and all of them said I was a really good teacher. 

・If you want to see how things work on our service, just let us know that you want to use our service first and , if possible, decide if you donate or not.

Risks & Challenges

・As we have no more than 5 teachers right now, we  might need to hire more Japanese teachers in the future.

・Other Ways You Can Help

・Just like us on Facebook and Twitter!

https://www.facebook.com/GekkoJapan/

https://twitter.com/GekkoJapanese

story:
At 21 years old, two years into my college education, and with enough life experience to know that the world is bigger than me - I've decided to dedicate a large part of my life to helping others better theirs. It's my goal to make volunteering in parts of the world that could use my help an annual practice. The more time I can dedicate, the better. If I can't raise the money to go to Jaipur, I have to take out loans to do so - which will stunt my future ability to contribute more. So help me start this trend off right!

I've secured placement with Love Volunteers to work with children who have been living on the street without access to basic education, and often don't even know how to clean themselves properly. The children are provided with free education, educational materials, uniforms and play materials.  During my four week placement, I'll teach these children basic english, mathematics, colors, shapes, numbers, animals, sounds, hygiene awareness, mannerisms, and so much more. Help me give these children a head start on life, and ultimately advance theirs. 

Volunteering comes at a cost. In order to provide their volunteers with safety, shelter, and basic necessities so that we can focus on our projects, there are a number of costs associated with the organization I've chosen - as well as travel costs. I've broken down the costs below, which you're welcome to fact check, so you know that the money is not going to my pockets - but rather back into the community of Jaipur and in part, any of my volunteer projects to follow. 

Costs:
Indian Employment Visa Fee: $141
Love Volunteers 4 Week program: $855
Travel Insurance (required): $125
Flights: $1950
120 hour TEFL Course: $149

Total Necessary Cost: $3220
Cost I'm trying to raise: $2294

*Even once the campaign reaches it's deadline, donations are still accepted!
story_txt: At 21 years old, two years into my college education, and with enough life experience to know that the world is bigger than me - I've decided to dedicate a large part of my life to helping others better theirs. It's my goal to make volunteering in parts of the world that could use my help an annual practice. The more time I can dedicate, the better. If I can't raise the money to go to Jaipur, I have to take out loans to do so - which will stunt my future ability to contribute more. So help me start this trend off right!I've secured placement with Love Volunteers to work with children who have been living on the street without access to basic education, and often don't even know how to clean themselves properly. The children are provided with free education, educational materials, uniforms and play materials.  During my four week placement, I'll teach these children basic english, mathematics, colors, shapes, numbers, animals, sounds, hygiene awareness, mannerisms, and so much more. Help me give these children a head start on life, and ultimately advance theirs. Volunteering comes at a cost. In order to provide their volunteers with safety, shelter, and basic necessities so that we can focus on our projects, there are a number of costs associated with the organization I've chosen - as well as travel costs. I've broken down the costs below, which you're welcome to fact check, so you know that the money is not going to my pockets - but rather back into the community of Jaipur and in part, any of my volunteer projects to follow. Costs:Indian Employment Visa Fee: $141Love Volunteers 4 Week program: $855Travel Insurance (required): $125Flights: $1950120 hour TEFL Course: $149Total Necessary Cost: $3220Cost I'm trying to raise: $2294*Even once the campaign reaches it's deadline, donations are still accepted!

story:
Hello everyone!

My name is Suzette Levy, in past years I have been collecting back packs and school supplies for the children in the community of Walkerswood Jamaica.  This year I will be focusing on the nursery school in the community (3 to 5 years old). The school’s population has been steadily increasing and currently has an average of 48 students. My mission this year, as a former student, is to help raise funds to complete renovations to the school building, as well as providing every child with a back pack.

The Walkerswood basic school has been part of the community for over 50 years.  Due to the lack of funding, the physical structure has deteriorated over a period of time.  If you take a look at the pictures uploaded, several years ago renovations were started, but was not completed due to lack of funds. The school is funded solely by the payments of  the parents, and at times contributions from community members. 

There are a lot of renovations that need to be done, but we hope that we can raise enough funds to be able to complete them all before the kids begin school. The school needs to repair the roof, finish the additional classrooms with new bathroom facilities, fencing the school ground and rewiring the electric of the building.

We have many fundraising plans in place for the spring and summer months, however, for those far and wide who can't attend, we hope you can contribute online. 

We hope you can find it in your hearts to contribute to this school. If we surpass our goal that would be amazing! All additional funds will go to the backpack program and school supplies. If you have any additional questions please leave a comment. Thank you and please spread the word!

Sincerely,

Suzette Levy

story:
Our Story

The students of Libby Elementary on the South Side of Chicago know about the importance of community organizing to create positive change.  Since partnering with Our American Voice (OAV), a non-profit civics advocacy organization, the students at Libby have taken great strides to improve not only their school, but the entire Englewood and Back of the Yards communities.

In just two years, these students have created an anti-bullying after school program, designed an outdoor classroom and community garden with the Chicago City Planning Commission, and recruited hundreds of volunteers to help repaint the school.  Impressive work for elementary school kids!

The Libby students are discovering and maximizing their ability to make concrete changes in their community. Many of these inquisitive students have taken an active interest in the Civil Rights movement, focusing on how the youth peacefully demonstrated to improve their circumstances.

To stoke this interest, OAV has arranged a field trip to some of the most important sites of the Civil Rights movement.  Over the course of four days, 6th, 7th and 8th grade students from Libby will travel to Memphis, Birmingham and Selma.  Along the way they will visit the National Civil Rights Museum, the Birmingham Civil Rights Institute, the Slave Haven Underground Railroad Museum and many more of the movement’s most important locations. The students will be blogging, conducting live video interviews and actively reflecting on their experiences with classmates and teachers after visiting each site.

To make this trip successful, the students of Libby need your help!

We are raising money to cover the costs of train tickets, meals, hotel rooms, and entry tickets to each of the sights on the trip. Your contribution, no matter the size, will ensure that each of these students will be able to join in this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. If you are unable to contribute, please share our campaign on your facebook page or tweet our our link with the hashtag #OAVSelma.  


Thank you !!!

story:
THANK YOU FOR VISITING OUR INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN!

Pastoralist Child Foundation is a US-based registered nonprofit that works to stop FGM/C (Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting) and forced child marriage in Kenya. "Pastoralists" are semi-nomadic people whose livelihood is primarily dependent on the herding of cattle, goats and camels. Girls in the Samburu tribe (cousins to the Maasai tribe) are standing up and voicing their opposition to these 2 ancient, harmful traditions that negatively affect them. By contributing to this campaign you'll empower 50 teen girls ages 13-17 when they attend this summer's educational workshop from August 9-13 during their school holidays. Pastoralist Child Foundation has secured $2,100.00 towards the budget and needs to raise an additional $1,625.00.  You'll make life-saving impacts on the lives of girls as they courageously resist long-standing traditions that can no longer be tolerated. YOU are making history by joining in their efforts to resist the status quo that just doesn't make sense in today's world. "Times are a changing" as they say. The time is now. Join us as we answer the call to accelerate the abandonment of FGM/C and child marriage once and for all! GIRLS' LIVES MATTER!!

GIRLS BELONG IN SCHOOL AND DESERVE TO LIVE HAPPY, HEALTHY LIVES FULFILLING THEIR DREAMS! 

The Samburu tribe is a beautiful tribe with many unique and wonderful traditions. Our goal is to preserve the positive aspects of the Samburu culture and remove the suffering of girls who are marginalized due to retrogressive traditions.  

Samburu tribe teenagers in exquisite traditional attire

Many effects of FGM/C and forced child marriage are detrimental:

  • extreme pain when cut with an unsterilized knife or razor blade, making girls vulnerable to HIV infection
  • shock, profuse bleeding or hemmorhaging (sometimes resulting in death)
  • long term/lifetime emotional, physical and psychological effects
  • painful menstruation, internal infections, infertility
  • negative impact on girl's socio-economic opportunities
  • high drop-out rate from primary school due to forced marriage
  • early first pregnancy before the girl's body is mature, leading to higher infant mortality
  • difficult childbirth and more incidents of post-partum  haemorrhaging 

The August 2015 workshop will be facilitated by healthcare professionals and social workers who all agree that FGM/C and forced child marriage should be eradicated. They will teach the following subjects: 

  • Female Genital Mutilation/Cutting (FGM/C)
  • Child Marriage
  • Teen Pregnancy
  • Sexual & Reproductive Health
  • HIV/AIDS/STDs
  • Self-Awareness
  • Self-Esteem
  • Gender-based violence
  • Health & Sanitation
  • The importance of formal education
  • Planting Moringa trees

Girls having a lively brainstorming session during the April 2015 workshop
It's plain and simple - Girls don't want to be harmed anymore. They don't want to follow the status quo "just because it's tradition."  The harmful, non-medical (unnecessary!!) procedure of FGM/C will be replaced by Alternative Rites of Passage - replacing "the cut" with educational workshops followed by ceremonies with songs, dance, poetry, drama, and exchanging gifts. Now THAT'S the way to celebrate womanhood! 

  

Thanks to contributors to this campaign, more girls like "Naserian" will not undergo FGM/C.

Girls’ education leads to increased income for girls themselves, but also for nations as a whole. Better educated girls become women who have smaller, healthier families with lower infant mortality rates, and maternal mortality. Primary education significantly helps reduce infant mortality, and secondary education helps even more because women know how to use health services, improving nutrition and sanitation, and taking advantage of their own increased earning capability. In addition, girls who get a quality education marry later when they’re better able to bear and care for their children.

Pastoralist Child Foundation's work is recognized by the Hon. Dr. Linah Jebii Kilimo, Chairperson of Kenya's Anti-FGM Board. She has met with us and visited our educational camp in 2014. Dr. Kilimo assured the girls that she's working hard to accelerate the abandonment of FGM/C and child marriage in Kenya. 


AUGUST 2015 EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOP BUDGET:

We sincerely appreciate every amount donated towards this August's camp.   

  • Please share this Indiegogo fundraising link with your social networks.
  • Ask your employer to match your donation through the Employee Gift Matching Program.
  • Make a donation in honor or memory of a friend or loved-one who values education. How about your favorite teacher, professor or parents who have installed the love of education in you?
  • Ask your loved-ones for a donation in your name.
  • Indiegogo online donations are very secure. However, if you're not comfortable with donating online, please mail your check to: 
Pastoralist Child Foundation, 51 Clark Street, Glen Ridge, NJ 07028 USA

  Donations to Pastoralist Child Foundation are tax-deductible. 

                   We're a US registered 501C3 public charity -  tax ID #46-2346090

story:
About Bajeviro

help2kids has a partnership with Bajeviro, a local primary and nursery school serving children from low-income families in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.  While education is technically free in Tanzania, there are a number of extra costs in obtaining an education that keep kids from school. Financial barriers like purchasing the mandatory uniforms, paying test fees and buying textbooks often prevent children from low-income families from attending school. help2kids covers these additional educational costs so that children in the Mbezi Beach area of Dar es Salaam, can attend school regardless of their economic background. Bajeviro serves about 300 students ranging in age from 4 to 16. 

Über Bajeviro 

help2kids unterstützt eine lokale Grundschule mit integriertem Kindergarten. Dabei bieten wir eine kostenfreie Schulbildung für Kinder aus benachteiligten Familien aus den nördlichen Stadteilen von Dar es Salaam an. Obwohl die Grundschulbildung in staatlichen Grundschulen in Tansania theoretisch kostenfrei ist, bleibt die Möglichkeit der Schulbildung aufgrund der Kosten für Schuluniformen, Prüfungsgebühren, Schulmaterialien und Bücher, für Kinder aus ärmeren Familien meist dennoch verwehrt. help2kids übernimmt diese zusätzlichen Kosten und ermöglicht den benachteiligten Kindern aus Mbezi Beach die Grundschulausbildung. In unserer Partnerschaftsschule Bajeviro, sind es mehr als 300 Kinder im Alter von 4 bis 16 Jahren, die von der Vorschule bis hin zu Standard 7 die Klassen besuchen.

The Food Program

help2kids provides two nutritious meals per day to the students of Bajeviro Primary School. Research shows that hunger impedes focus and has a negative impact on both school attendance rates and learning. We seek to eliminate this barrier to education by providing a healthy breakfast before school and a nourishing lunch to keep students energized through the afternoon. Many of our students rely on these meals for their overall nourishment.

Das Ernährungsprogramm

help2kids bietet den Schülern der Bajeviro Grundschule jeden Tag zwei reichhaltige Mahlzeiten an. Untersuchungen haben ergeben, dass Mangelernährung die Aufmerksamkeit verringert und die Teilnahme am Unterricht gefährdet was sich direkt auf die Zukunftsperspektiven der Kinder auswirkt. Wir versuchen durch unser Ernährungsprogramm diese Barrieren zu eliminieren und den Schülern eine angemessene Schulbildung zu ermöglichen. Für viele unserer Schüler sind die Mahlzeiten in der Schule die einzigen verlässlichen Nahrungsquellen. 

Where You Come In

Our students come from low-income families. Often, the only regular source of nourishment they receive comes from the help2kids Food Program. Through this program, we provide the 300 Bajeviro students with two healthy meals per day. With your donation, you help ensure:

·  Every student receives a healthy breakfast and lunch at school

·  No students has to attend class hungry

·  Students focus on their studies and are better equipped to succeed and thrive

·  Each student can grow strong through a balanced nutritional intake

Hier kommst du ins Spiel

Unsere 300 SchülerInnen kommen aus ärmsten Verhältnissen. Oftmals ist das Frühstück sowie das Mittagessen in der Schule die einzige verlässliche Nahrungsquelle der Kinder. Mit deiner Spende ermöglichst du:

·  Jeder Schüler erhält zwei nahrhafte Mahlzeiten täglich

·  Kein Schüler muss hungrig in die Schule gehen

·  Schüler können sich uneingeschränkt auf das Lernen konzentrieren

·  Jeder Schüler kann sich durch eine ausgewogene Ernährung mit Vitaminen und Mineralien bestmöglich entwickeln kann

Impact

With your support, the students of Bajeviro Primary School attend school with the resources needed to develop strong bodies and minds.  Studies show that food programs improve school attendance and optimize learning once students are inside the classroom.  

Auswirkungen

Mit deinem Engagement hilfst du den Kindern der Bajeviro Grundschule in Dar es Salaam, Tansania, die Grundschule mit bestmöglicher Unterstützung, vollem Bauch und damit verbundener Lebensfreude sowie in einem sicheren Umfeld absolvieren zu können. Untersuchungen haben ergeben, dass Ernährungsprogramme den regelmässigen Unterrichtsbesuch fördern und die Schüler sich besser auf ihre Aufgaben konzentrieren können.

Other Ways to Help

Spread the word! Please tell your friends, families, coworkers, and acquaintances about help2kids and the Food Program in Tanzania. Please share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter and wherever else you talk to people about what matters to you! You have the ability to make a big impact in making sure students from low-income backgrounds have the opportunity to grow strong and reach their potential. 

Andere Wege, wie du helfen kannst

Bitte erzähle deinen Freunden über help2kids und unser Ernährungsprogramm in Tansania. Bitte teile unsere Kampagne auf Facebook, Twitter und wo du überall aktiv mit Leuten in Kontakt kommst. Du kannst viele aus benachteiligten Familien stammende Schüler direkt beeinflussen und ihr Leben sowie ihre Zukunftsaussichten verbessern.




About help2kids

help2kids is a young and dynamic, Swiss-based non-profit organization operating in Tanzania and Malawi.  We seek to improve the lives and opportunities of vulnerable children by meeting vital needs to enable and empower kids to pursue successful and sustainable futures.

On-site, help2kids has a strong team made up of local and international staff that supervise each project.  In addition to Bajeviro, help2kids has educational partnerships with Mwandaliwa Nursery School in the Bunju region of Dar es Salaam, and with a Preschool and Primary School in Lifuwu, Malawi. We have Sports Programs in both Tanzania and Malawi, empowering children through team sports.

help2kids also has a Health Project in Tanzania, providing healthcare for all 300 students of Bajeviro, our Children’s Home, and three partner orphanages, and supports a health clinic in Lifuwu, Malawi.

The help2kids Children’s Home is our flagship project located in the Mbezi Beach area of Dar es Salaam. There, we provide a safe and loving home for 31 children as well as everything kids need to grow and thrive: nutritious meals, a cozy bed, quality education, medical checkups, psychological support (if needed), myriad free time activities, and a family environment.

Über help2kids

help2kids ist ein junges und dynamisches Kinderhilfswerk aus der Schweiz mit Projekten in Tansania und Malawi. Wir geben täglich unser Bestes, um die Leben und Zukunftsmöglichkeiten unserer Kinder durch die Abdeckung sämtlicher Grundbedürfnisse zu verbessern.

Vor Ort betreut ein aus internationalen und lokalen Mitarbeitern geformtes Team sämtliche Projekte. Neben der Bajeviro Grundschule unterstützt help2kids die Mwandaliwa Nursery School in der Bunju Region nördlich von Dar es Salaam in Tansania sowie den Tiyanjane Kindergarten und die Kazembe Primarschule in Lifuwu, Malawi.

help2kids bereibt ausserdem ein Health Center in Tansania, welches die medizinische Grundversorgung aller 300 Schüler der Bajeviro Grundschule, der 31 Kinder im help2kids-Kinderheim sowie der drei Waisenhäuser, welche mit help2kids zusammenarbeiten, sicherstellt.

Das help2kids Kinderheim liegt im Stadteil Mbezi Beach, 20 km nördlich von Dar es Salaam. Dort bieten wir unseren 31 Kindern ein sicheres und liebevolles Zuhause um sie bestmöglich auf ihr zukünftiges Leben vorzubereiten. Dazu gehören: ausgewogene Ernährung, ein kuschliges Bett, gute Ausbildungsmöglichkeiten, präventive medizinische Untersuchungen, bei Bedarf psychologische Unterstützung, viele Freizeitaktivitäten und ein familiäres Umfeld.

Jeder Schüler erhält zwei nahrhafte
Mahlzeiten täglich
· 
Kein Schüler muss hungrig in
die Schule gehen
· 
Schüler können sich uneingeschränkt
auf das Lernen konzentrieren 
· 
Jeder Schüler kann sich durch
eine ausgewogene Ernährung mit Vitaminen und Mineralien bestmöglich entwickeln
kann

Impact
With your
support, the students of Bajeviro Primary School attend school with the
resources needed to develop strong bodies and minds.  Studies show that food programs improve school
attendance and optimize learning once students are inside the classroom.  

Auswirkungen
Mit deinem Engagement hilfst du den Kindern
der Bajeviro Grundschule in Dar es Salaam, Tansania, die Grundschule mit
bestmöglicher Unterstützung, vollem Bauch und damit verbundener Lebensfreude
sowie in einem sicheren Umfeld absolvieren zu können. Untersuchungen haben
ergeben, dass Ernährungsprogramme den regelmässigen Unterrichtsbesuch fördern
und die Schüler sich besser auf ihre Aufgaben konzentrieren können.


Other Ways to Help
Spread the word! Please tell your friends, families, coworkers, and acquaintances about help2kids and the Food Program in Tanzania. Please share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter and wherever else you talk to people about what matters to you! You have the ability to make a big impact in making sure students from low-income backgrounds have the opportunity to grow strong and reach their potential. 

Andere
Wege, wie du helfen kannst
Bitte erzähle deinen Freunden über
help2kids und unser Ernährungsprogramm in Tansania. Bitte teile unsere Kampagne
auf Facebook, Twitter und wo du überall aktiv mit Leuten in Kontakt kommst. Du
kannst viele aus benachteiligten Familien stammende Schüler direkt beeinflussen
und ihr Leben sowie ihre Zukunftsaussichten verbessern.





About help2kids
help2kids is a young and dynamic, Swiss-based non-profit organization operating in
Tanzania and Malawi.  We seek to improve
the lives and opportunities of vulnerable children by meeting vital needs to
enable and empower kids to pursue successful and sustainable futures. 
On-site, help2kids has a strong team made up of local and
international staff that supervise each project.  In addition to Bajeviro, help2kids
has educational partnerships with Mwandaliwa Nursery School in the Bunju region of Dar es
Salaam, and with a Preschool and Primary School in Lifuwu, Malawi. We have Sports
Programs in both Tanzania and Malawi, empowering children through team sports.
help2kids also has a Health Project in Tanzania, providing healthcare
for all 300 students of Bajeviro, our Children’s Home, and three partner
orphanages, and supports a health clinic in Lifuwu, Malawi. 
The help2kids Children’s Home is our flagship project located in
the Mbezi Beach area of Dar es Salaam. There, we provide a safe and loving home
for 31 children as well as everything kids need to grow and thrive: nutritious
meals, a cozy bed, quality education, medical checkups, psychological support
(if needed), myriad free time activities, and a family environment. 




Über
help2kids
help2kids ist ein junges und dynamisches
Kinderhilfswerk aus der Schweiz mit Projekten in Tansania und Malawi. Wir geben
täglich unser Bestes, um die Leben und Zukunftsmöglichkeiten unserer Kinder
durch die Abdeckung sämtlicher Grundbedürfnisse zu verbessern. 
Vor Ort betreut ein aus internationalen und
lokalen Mitarbeitern geformtes Team sämtliche Projekte. Neben der Bajeviro
Grundschule unterstützt help2kids die Mwandaliwa Nursery School in der Bunju
Region nördlich von Dar es Salaam in Tansania sowie den Tiyanjane Kindergarten
und die Kazembe Primarschule
in Lifuwu, Malawi.


help2kids bereibt ausserdem ein Health Center in Tansania, welches die medizinische Grundversorgung aller 300 Schüler der Bajeviro Grundschule, der 31 Kinder im help2kids-Kinderheim sowie der drei Waisenhäuser, welche mit help2kids zusammenarbeiten, sicherstellt.Das help2kids 
Kinderheim liegt im Stadteil Mbezi Beach, 20 km nördlich von Dar es 
Salaam. Dort bieten wir unseren 31 Kindern ein sicheres und liebevolles Zuhause um sie bestmöglich auf ihr zukünftiges Leben vorzubereiten. Dazu gehören: ausgewogene Ernährung, ein kuschliges Bett, gute Ausbildungsmöglichkeiten, präventive medizinische Untersuchungen, bei Bedarf psychologische Unterstützung, viele Freizeitaktivitäten und ein familiäres Umfeld.
campaign_city: Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, United Republic of

story:
Get the Scoop!

Applying to graduate business school is hard...really hard. Getting in is even harder. The top schools reject 90% of those who apply.  Most of those rejected are highly qualified applicants, with high GPAs and test scores and impressive work experience. Why are such incredible applicants rejected? They make silly mistakes in their applications, or worse, they are unable to articulate a compelling story.

HBS Accept will change that.  Our approach is personal and holistic. 

  • ACCESS:  Unlike competitors in our industry, with HBS Accept applicants have unprecedented access to the company's founders. 
  • DIVERSE OPINIONS:  Our review process is different also, every essay and resume sent to HBS Accept undergoes a dual-review.  First, by an English MA.  Then, by an MBA. This dual-review process eliminates silly errors and ensures that even the most poorly-written essay receives actionable feedback on story, style and content.
  • FOCUSED EXPERTISE:  While our competitors stretch their expertise by offering law, undergrad, and Phd services, HBS Accept focuses on providing top quality business school advice.  Although our advice will improve any business school application, our expertise is strongest at: Harvard Business School, Stanford, Wharton, MIT, Tuck, Kellogg, Booth, Columbia, Yale SOM, and Haas.


Where is my money going?

This campaign will kick-start the growth of an infant company.  Specifically, we hope to raise $3,000 to:

  • Enable eCommerce and commercialization of HBSAccept.com
  • Purchase Social Media Advertising
  • Create Marketing Materials
  • Pay our editors
  • Procure Legal Services and IP Protection

Although we will happily provide the perks throughout and after the campaign, if we do not meet our goal, we will not be able to continue our dream of helping others tell their unique stories.


What do I get in return?

Just look at our perks! You will get access to world-class admission consulting at blow-out one-in-a-lifetime prices! Our IndieGoGo Perks are identical in every way to our normal consulting services with only one exception...Price!

In addition to MBA Admission Consulting, we are offering the opportunity to help launch our "Women in Business" and "Diversity in Business" funds. These two funds (which are unique in our industry, as far as we can tell) are funded through a portion of HBS Accept's profits and offer deserving women and US under-represented minorities free resume reviews and mock interviews.  This is a great choice for anyone who doesn't need our services but still wants to help our campaign or anyone who has benefited from diversity in business.


How Else Can I Help?

Help us get the word out about HBSAccept.com and this campaign! Please share this campaign on your social networks and tell anyone you know that is interested in an MBA to check us out!


Meet the Team!


David Hamilton (Founder)

After graduating with Honors at the Kelley School of Business at Indiana University, David set out to try to make a difference in the world.  His search brought him to Eli Lilly & Co., an innovation based pharmaceutical company offering patient solutions in Diabetes, Oncology, and other therapeutic areas David cares about.

At Lilly, David most recently served as the Controller/CFO of Lilly's multi-hundred million dollar clinical trial organization.  He also was responsible for Strategic Planning of the $5B Research and Development organization.  After six years at Lilly, David wanted to expand his impact by seeking an MBA. With Ginny's editing help, David was accepted to three Ivy League Business Schools and ultimately chose to attend Harvard Business School.

David's time at Lilly helped him discover a passion for mentoring and helping others.  A passion that led him to start HBS Accept and hbsaccept.com.  It is his hope that his insider knowledge of Harvard Business School and experience in the application process will help others reach their highest potential.  

In his free time, David enjoys hiking, kayaking, and spending time with his daughter, Loralei, and wife, Jessica.

Ginny Stutz (Chief  Editor)

Since first setting pen to paper the magic that is writing took hold, allowing Ginny to breathe life onto a blank page creating worlds that had only ever been able to live in her imagination. Little did she know those first few ink strokes would not only impact her own life, but enflame a passion for helping others find their own voices.

This mission encouraged Ginny in gaining a MA in English and a MA Certificate in Professional Editing from Indiana University. Armed with these degrees, she has been able to encourage students and show them that writing is not something to be feared, but rather something that can help them be heard. Working at both Marian University and Indiana University-Purdue University in Indianapolis she has taught English Composition as well as worked on several published anthologies over the writings of Ray Bradbury and George Santayana.

On those rare occasions she's not battling Microsoft Word hunched over her laptop, Ginny enjoys spending time gardening and cooking. Nothing is more relaxing than whipping up something delicious and enjoying the scents rising from the oven.

HBS Accept is an independent admissions consulting organization.  HBS Accept is not affiliated with Harvard Business School.

story:
Academy of Champions

Many players are dreaming of becoming professional gamers in DotA2 or League of Legend and other games, to enter the international arena with their teams, or to join the existing teams, but due to lack of experience, lack of a coach and a lack of funding, they have difficulties. 

The purpose of the company is to raise enough funds for development, design and promote of the educational website, which helps everyone to become the professional cybersportsmen and to find its place in the game industry.

What we need & what you get

Our requirements are simple: we are seeking the startup capital on development, launch, and promote of the educational website for cybersportsmen. Also funds for the organization of the tournament online on DotA 2 and League of Legend which will accompany the start of the project are necessary for us. Then, we will reach self-sufficiency.

If you are the gamer or want to devote your life to cybersport then this project is especially for you. You will be able to learn how to play professionally such games as DotA 2 and League of Legend, and thanks to a new approach to cybersports education, you will accelerate this process and you will make it more fascinating.

• All educational programs will be constructed on the basis of the analysis of the professional cybersportsmen games.

• We are against habitual guides because the general data only on characters strategy and mechanics of the game are presented. The whole process of training will be interactive and fascinating.

• The system will use API DotA 2 and League of Legend, and will make the program of training personally for each gamer.

What the Academy of Champions is: the possibility of service

The unique system of coaching

By means of special testing, the system will determine the level of the gamer and will provide him the personal program of training, based on his knowledge, abilities, experience and preferences.

Work on the bugs

Each game will be conducted and analyzed by the system in order to identify the errors of the gamer, and then will give him a personalized advice how to avoid them in the future

The achievement system 

A special achievement system for the gamers teaching, that will encourage each gamer to improve their play level is developed. The main indicators of gambling such as: GPM (gold per minute), EPM (experience per minute), the number of kills, deaths, supports, the number of kills creeps, properly collect artifacts, and many others are taken as a basis.

Mini games for physical indicators of the gamer improvement

Set of special flash games for the reaction, speed, and accuracy of the gamer training. These skills are necessary and important for each professional cybersportsmen.

Courses for the commentators

 We will tell everyone how to comment the competitions of teams correctly and interesting and we will give an opportunity to have the practice to comment the training games of the trained teams.

Courses for the strategists

On the website, there will be a special "A strategic calculator". Everyone will be able to make a strategy for the game and to learn its pluses and minuses then to offer to the registered teams to use it and to become the full-fledged member of the team.

Courses for the team’s managers

We will tell everyone about the team manager duties and how to cope with the problems, and we will give an opportunity to find a team and to become its official representative in a cybersporting world.

Searching for the team to enter the world arena

To win the international championship, it is necessary to have reliable and skilled allies. It is not so easy to find them. Our website will have a special section where you can find a suitable teammate.

Personal advice from professional gamers

Any team will be able to send a record of their game to the professional cybersportsman and to receive feedback, with information about pluses and minuses of it, and to have a practical advice how to improve their skills.

Requirements of the international companies for gamers sponsoring

On a portal, the main requirements of the international companies sponsoring cyberteams will be submitted. Each registered team will be able to send a request for sponsoring, and at mutual consent to become an official representative of the chosen brand

Online Dota 2 and League of Legend tournament

Time in half a year, we will held a tournament of the international level for the registered teams in which it’ll be possible to benefit sponsorship from our project.

Live stream on twitch and youtube

At desire, any team will be able to broadcast their game in real time on Twitch and Youtube with the personal commentator provided by our portal

Why do you must to believe, that this website is really necessary to the gamers and to the world?

Developing this project, we were based on the personal experience and on the problems disturbing to the cybersport development at the international level such as:

Insufficient financial support of the teams and the players

One of the main reasons stopping cybersport development - is a shortage of financing. Brands unwillingly sponsor cyberteams because they do not see the benefit in it. The reason is the lack of fan audience.

Absence of the gamer’s motivation

Unfortunately, most of the cybersportsmen finish their career very much early. At some moment, they simply do not see the prospects for the professional growth. Even more often, they should think of the family welfare, but to find interesting and profitable work it appears not so simply, after all they devoted the most part of life to the games. Dreams die in such way.

Public opinion

Most of the people who don't have relations to cybersport consider that cybersportsmen are the small children who have nothing to do and that’s why they are playing cybersport, but nobody thinks that for achievement of professional level it is necessary to train hard and diligent and constantly improve their skills. Also, the cybersportsmen is a real profession, you can earn money. In other words, in cybersport still, as well as in soccer, basketball, hockey and other kinds of sports.

Closeness of professional cybersports community

To get to all professional teams, it is possible only by the invitation. For this purpose, the gamer needs to show himself online and offline tournaments, to play only with the strongest rivals and to pass multi-stage selection.

As you see, by means of this project, we are solving real problems of cybersport and we can help players to realize their dream – to become a professional cybersportsmen.

Why’ve we chosen flexible financing?

Everything is very simple, the prize fund of a tournament will depend on the quantity of the raised funds. At achievement of the sum of $200 000, in each discipline the prize fund will equal $50 000. If more sum there will be collected, then more fund prize there will be at each discipline.


How can you still help?

To publish information about this company on the website or the blog and to share this page on all your social networks.

Further, we will develop and support the cybersports industry as such companies as Valve, Riot games, Blizzard, and others do it.

We will break the barriers together on the way to the professional cybersport!

story:
About My Walk-a-Thon

Hey everyone!  Lisa Watkins here.  As you may know, in 2010 and 2012, I spent one month each summer walking 500 miles in and around St. Louis…to and from work, to the YMCA, around local parks, going as far as Maplewood, Frontenac, and the Loop (and back!) from my apartment in the City of St. Louis.  All of the funds raised through my “One Woman Walk-a-Thons” benefitted Sherwood Forest, where I spent 6 summers as a counselor and support staff member. 

I’ve played a role in the Sherwood Forest Alumni Association over the past few years, reaching out to former staff members and campers.  In hearing the stories of these individuals, some of whom spent their days at Sherwood Forest many decades ago, I have realized the lifelong impact that this special place can have.  Children who were once growing up in poverty, with camp as their only summertime activity and support system, are now productive, successful adults who love to share their stories and give back to the place they still call their “home away from home.”

The 2010 and 2012 Walk-a-Thons raised over $3,400 combined.  And guess what.  I’m walking 500 miles again this July in support of Sherwood Forest and their efforts in the St. Louis community!  All donations will go directly to support Sherwood’s mission: transforming the lives of children in need through powerful programs that allow them to discover their self-worth, realize their potential, and become productive citizens. 

I’d love to have your support as I hit the road and walk another 500 miles this July!

About Sherwood Forest

Sherwood Forest is a year-round youth development organization anchored in a month-long summer camp experience. Sherwood Forest transforms the lives of children in need through powerful programs that allow them to discover their self-worth, realize their potential, and become productive citizens. Sherwood Forest helps kids discover the best in themselves so they can grow up to do good in the world.

By balancing traditional camp adventures with evidence-based programs that reinforce and support school-year learning, Sherwood Forest connects with, educates, and inspires the youth of St. Louis.  


The Impact of Sherwood Forest

  • 100% of recent Leadership Training graduates have attended college or technical schools.
  • More than 2/3 of graduates in the last quarter-century have kept in touch with Sherwood Forest of their own accord, and more than 90% of them no longer live in poverty.

  • Leadership Training campers have given nearly 50,000 hours of community service.  Program graduates include professionals such as lawyers, teachers, professors, psychologists, police officers, software designers, social workers, school administrators, and members of the military and Peace Corps. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't make a monetary contribution to my walk, you can help by:

  • Keeping me company on my various walks around town!
  • Promoting my cause through social media (Instagram or Facebook).
  • Using the "share" tool here on Indiegogo to spread the word about my efforts.

On behalf of all of the kids at Sherwood Forest, thanks so much for your support!  You really are making a difference in their lives!
Thanks again,
Lisa

with camp as their only summertime activity and support system, are now productive,
successful adults who love to share their stories and give back to the place
they still call their “home away from home.”
The 2010 and 2012 Walk-a-Thons raised over $3,400 combined.  And guess what.  I’m walking 500 miles again this July in
support of Sherwood Forest and their efforts in the St. Louis community!  All donations will go directly to support
Sherwood’s mission: transforming the
lives of children in need through powerful programs that allow them to discover
their self-worth, realize their potential, and become productive citizens.  
I’d
love to have your support as I hit the road and walk another 500 miles this July!
    About Sherwood Forest

Sherwood Forest is a year-round youth development organization anchored in a month-long summer camp experience. Sherwood Forest transforms the lives of children in need through powerful programs that allow them to discover their self-worth, realize their potential, and become productive citizens. Sherwood Forest helps kids discover the best in themselves so they can grow up to do good in the world.
By balancing traditional camp adventures with evidence-based programs that reinforce and support school-year learning, Sherwood Forest connects with, educates, and inspires the youth of St. Louis.  


The Impact of Sherwood Forest

100% of recent Leadership Training graduates have attended college or technical schools.

More than 2/3 of graduates in the last quarter-century have kept in touch with Sherwood Forest of their own accord, and more than 90% of them no longer live in poverty.

Leadership Training campers have given nearly 50,000 hours of community service.  Program graduates include professionals such as lawyers, teachers, professors, psychologists, police officers, software designers, social workers, school administrators, and members of the military and Peace Corps. 



Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't make a monetary contribution to my walk, you can help by:  Keeping me company on my various walks around town!
Promoting my cause through social media (Instagram or Facebook).
Using the "share" tool here on Indiegogo to spread the word about my efforts.


On behalf of all of the kids at Sherwood Forest, thanks so much for your support!  You really are making a difference in their lives!
Thanks again,
Lisa

story:
What Is The Chicago Freedom School?

The Chicago Freedom School (CFS) was founded in 2007 by individuals committed to social justice who recognized a need for a citywide effort to provide educational opportunities for young people to gain new skills and build alliances across neighborhoods, identities and ideologies. Every year the Freedom Fellowship brings together a cohort of young people of color ages 14-17 to develop leadership skills, study the history of past and current social justice movements, and learn strategies to create positive social change. The current model begins with a four-week Summer Leadership Institute followed by five months of mentorship and activism work in small teams. During this time, they design and implement an action project to address a justice issue in their communities under the themes Healthy Communities and Fair and Just Schools.

“I used to be unsure I could change anything that was wrong. Now I am thinking of an action plan because I know I can. I used to be unsure of my power. Now I am sure my voice means a lot.” –Sandra, Freedom Fellow Alum

Now in its 8th year, CFS is getting ready to welcome a new group of Freedom Fellows. Join us in supporting youth leadership development by making a financial contribution.

More About Chicago Freedom School Programs

YOUTH LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT

  • FREEDOM FELLOWSHIP: CFS’s centerpiece program featuring interactive popular education classes, anti-oppression training, and leadership skill building. Following an intensive summer program, CFS provides ongoing support to Fellows as they carry out action campaigns aimed at effecting social change in their schools and communities.
  • YOUTH LEADERSHIP BOARD: A group of CFS youth alumni work to ensure that youth are an integral part of organizational programs and initiatives. Among other efforts, YLB members co-facilitate programs, recruit and interview new staff and Freedom Fellows, and represent CFS in a range of settings.
  • TECHNICAL SUPPORT: As requested, CFS provides resources, consultation and facilitation for youth groups and youth development professionals.

TRAINING AND ORGANIZING

  • REV UP: This four-day national training for adults provides best practices to support youth organizing capacity building and sound youth-led programming. Rev Up combines issue-based organizing, leadership and identity development, movement-building history and anti-oppression practices.
  • UNDERSTANDING ADULTISM AND CREATING YOUTH PARTNERSHIPS: This half-day seminar helps adult participants understand and deconstruct the internalization of adultism and provide tools and resources through which adults can learn how to be responsible and effective allies to youth.
  • ANTI-RACISM TRAINING FOR WHITE ALLIES: This workshop explores how white privilege is manifested in individuals and society. Participants receive practices and tools to interrupt racism and learn how to take action against racism as individuals and as a collective.
  • MOVEMENT-BUILDING AND ACTIVISM TRAININGS: CFS staff and facilitators design and provide customized offerings for schools, organizations and institutions to enhance civic engagement and youth development efforts.

EDUCATION

  • PUBLIC PROGRAMMING: The Chicago Freedom School sponsors a range of public events, seminars and film screenings. These programs provide community members with opportunities to learn about the history of social justice movements, explore relevant current events and to engage in educational efforts that support anti-oppression work and community building.
  • PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATIONS: Since our founding, CFS has collaborated with various social justice and liberatory organizations to support leadership development among youth and utilize education as a means to promote social change.
  • SOCIAL JUSTICE LIBRARY: CFS maintains a comprehensive lending library at its offices for youth and adult activists and educators across the city. CFS Members have free access to all holdings.

story:
What is it?

The Kukama people are a group of people indigenous to the Amazon. Their language (also Kukama) is being threatened with extinction due to the fact that the elders of the community are the only ones that are still fluent in the language. Therefore, in order for this language to stay alive, it needs to be taught. 
So, the goal here is to fund Escuela Ikuari (the language school) that is currently trying to survive so that Kukama does not disappear completely. We need to teach the young generation, so that they may carry on the cultural traditions of their ancestors. 
Although the instructors at the school are not asking for much, what they do need is enough to keep the school going. This involves money to keep their space open, provide basic teaching materials, as well as a small financial stipend to allow these teachers to spend their time teaching. The school needs $17,000 to stay open for a year. 
There is truly no way that this campaign could possibly fail because every dollar that is given toward this cause will be put directly into the school so that it may stay open as long as donations permit. 
Why is it important?
When a language is lost, the world is at a massive risk for the loss of a rich culture. By preserving this language, the younger generation and the generations that come after would then be able to understand what their ancestors lives were like, truly understand their stories, and maintain their way of life. 
What are the perks for donaters?
Any contributer who donates $25 or more will be personally mentioned on the local Nauta radio!
Past Success
In the past, we have used this forum to raise enough money to make a video advertising the importance of the Kukama language. The links to these videos are found on the gallery page!
We need your support in this campaign to be just as successful to bring our plan to fruition. 
Other ways to help:
Share this information with you friends! Whether it be by word-of-mouth or be sharing it on your Facebook page, any bit helps!

story:
Check out our perks! --> 

For students, these include access to our full (password-protected) 70-minute lecture on Hypothesis Testing and personalised consultation with David ! 
 

Who am I?

Hi, my name is Dave, and I'm an assistant professor at a university in Sydney, Australia. In 2010, I made a 10 minute Youtube clip teaching university-level statistics in a quirky way. A couple of months went by, and I completely forgot about this video and plugged along with my uneventful life as an academic. A few years later, I rediscovered my video and to my amazement, I had over 100,000 views! The comments by viewers were amazing and really encouraging. Some of my favourites: 

"One of the best educational videos I've ever watched. Thanks."

"This is the most awesome explanation ever! pure genius. Love you Loads!"

"Wonderful. Nice explanation. I will never forget"

"This was really good, do more for god sake!"

"I wish I could give you guys 20 likes. THanks!!!!"

"Great teaching style, and hilarious back story!"

"This is a really well explained video! I'd have to say that you explain even more clearly than khanacademy. hope you continue making videos!"

"bloody good, simply brilliant! you should come teach at my college!"

"awesome presentation. This is how I'm going to explain it to guys at work!!"

"DUDE, YOU MAKE LIFE SO MUCH EASIER!!! THANK YOU SOOOOO MUCH!!!!!"

Since then, I've been making more clips and, as of today, my channel has over 270,000 views and 1,176 subscribers. I've taken this as a sign that perhaps I should pursue this online teaching thing further. Check out our Youtube channel here! 

 

So what now?

We've decided to create an online teaching platform that provides quality university-level statistics tuition at very affordable student prices. This service will be targeted towards those who are struggling with statistics, but will also be suitable for students at all levels. We will be applying an innovative approach to providing online consultation to students in an effective and personalised manner. 

 

How are we different?

In many universities, students are taught statistics based on the assumption that they are already very quantitatively literate. Obviously, this isn't the case for a huge proportion of students. Our teaching style assumes the student knows nothing about stats (na da!), and we begin teaching from the ground up: By telling a story that we can all relate to, such as being lied to by a dodgy friend. This makes statistics more relatable, and learning is made much easier once you understand why you're learning each concept in the first place.

We will also be developing an efficient personalised online consultation system  so students can receive video explanations for their questions. 

 

Where will your contributions go?

Your contribution will help us create a high-quality membership website that facilitates the delivery of online lectures along with a consultation section for students and practice exam papers with video solutions. The average cost for a professional web designer and developer to produce a premium-quality membership-based video learning website is $9,900 (quotes from Australia, Singapore, and Thailand). Requirements include: corporate identity, online marketing, social media management, video production, and mobile applications. Domain name, hosting, and logo design are budgeted to be $500. 

We would also like to concurrently propel 2 education-related causes we're passionate about: Raising funds to purchase eye-glasses for disadvantaged Burmese primary school students in Thailand, and sponsoring an orphanage in Pattaya, Thailand, that provides excellent education opportunities for their kids. Click here for more details.  

At least 20 percent of all funds received will go towards 2 education-related charitable causes. If we receive less than our $13,000 target, 20% of all money will go towards charity. If we receive money in excess of our $13,000 target, then 20 percent of $13,000 and all funds in excess of $13,000 will go towards charity. Click here for more details. 

 

FAQ: Are you diluting our contributions by giving 20 percent to charitable causes? I want 100 percent of my contribution to go to your teaching website. 

This is a very good question. Because what we’re providing in return as contribution packages are services, we’re willing to work harder to achieve not only the creation of our teaching website but also the charity outcomes we’re aiming for. So don’t view the charitable causes as obstacles to us achieving our goal of creating our online teaching website – we’re willing to provide more services (lectures and consultation packages) in return for achieving both our goal and the charity work we aim to do.  

If you feel strongly about earmarking 100 percent of your funds to creating our teaching website, no worries! Just let us know (via indiegogo message or email), and we'll contribute 20 percent of that amount to charity using our personal funds while 100 percent of your contribution is directed towards creating our educational website.      

CLICK HERE for our crowdfunding blog and more details! 

IMPORTANT: When emailing us to receive your perks, please use the same email address as the one used when contributing on indiegogo.com so we can identify you from our list of contributors.
