story:
About the artist:

NICK PETRONZIO

Nick Petronzio is a second generation sculptor, painter and artist that began his career in fine art working under the tutelage of his father Robert Petronzio at age twelve. Coming from an artistic family, mother Dora Bendahan a potter & sister Nina, a furniture and interior designer of Plushhome, the artist knew his calling from an early age.
Acclaimed for his versatility in style, technique and knowledge of materials, the award wining artist has produced works that range from the reproduction of a Pietro Cipriani bronze sculpture for the J. Paul Getty Museum to several fiberglass Disney characters including Mickey Mouse, Rex and Pluto for Disney's theme parks world-wide. The artist has also realized and enlarged several sculptures for celebrated artists including; Vincent Capraro's (Bull fighter), Yayoi Kusama's (Hymn of Life Tulips), Erin Lareau's (Walk of the Glass Slippers), Tanya Ragir's (Doubt kills the warrior) and most recently, Nick has produced two monumental sized sculpture enlargements for Jim Carrey.In addition to the interactive, educational and public sculpture work Nick has developed, the artist has also created several key sculptures for film & television productions including Darren Aranofsky's "The Fountain" and Rob Cohen's "The Mummy; Tomb of the Dragon Emperor". Nick practices his craft daily and is always expanding his knowledge, style and technique. His personal sculpture work reveals his understanding of the human and animal anatomy and their gestural movement but ultimately the experience, spirit and interconnectedness of all things in nature. His fascination with the human form and with mankind's broad emotional range has inspired him to create dynamic and sensitive works that carry a quality of timelessness.

Nick Petronzio is based out of Los Angeles, California where he continues to work on commissioned projects as well as expand his own personal sculpture collection. The artist also instructs private sculpture and drawing courses.


The Vision

 

Turning this 1,200 gallon shark tank into an interactive Pirate Ship Exhibit which allows young children a once in a lifetime experience. Kids will have the opportunity to board the Pirate Ship while donning their pirate gear, eye patch and all. Once aboard they will with supervision be allowed to feed the live sharks and rays swimming below them through the top hatch on the deck of the ship. For years we have enjoyed watching the excitement of these young children as they experienced these live feedings. Now we look to take it to a completely new level by merging this experience with that of being a pirate on the high seas. Please help bring this never before experience come to life.

 

The Build requirements

 

Once Nick Petronzio went over the plans, tank measurements and needs to complete this project he estimated the job would cost $50,000 to deliver everything we are looking for. After talking to Nick about this estimate being possibly out of our reach he informed us that he can give us a stripped down version for $25,000. We would so love to be able to deliver these children the Disney quality Pirate ship. If unable to reach the $50k required to give the children the Disney quality ship we will settle for the $25k stripped down version allowing them to still live this experience. We will leave it to you to decide. Either way we will give 100% to bring this project to life!

 Artist Nick Petronzio's rendering of the $25k version

The Impact

 

Getting children interested in the world they live in. Learning skills do not develop in a vacuum; they develop through learning and internalizing the process. A love for learning develops from the satisfaction of understanding and the curiosity to know more. This exhibit is designed to develop that curiosity.

story:
The Haven Retreat 

is a friendly and simple mountain space for yoga and meditation open to all backgrounds.

  • As the Director of Mindful Living, LLC,  a modest holistic wellness company, I wish to grow the services provided to host a dedicated practice space to cultivate well-being.
  • A Haven is a retreat option for those wishing to start or develop a practice in meditation and yoga.
  • A Haven is offering collaborative partnerships to share the space with local wellness practitioners: acupuncturists, massage therapists, etc.  
  • Mindful Living, LLC offers specialized Bi-lingual Spanish teachings.

We need to raise $15K to build a yurt.

  • $12K for a 30' yurt Colorado Yurt Company pricing
  • Includes the stove pipe outlet, roof insulation, and crating (for shipping)
  • Peaceful mountain location in Black Hawk, CO
  • Sustainable and earth-friendly building
  • See the business plan here.

All backgrounds are welcome.

Meditation and yoga free of dogma and full of possibilities: 

  • Contributing to a peaceful society by training peaceful people
  • Retreats will provide home grown organic meals, the option of honoring silence on the grounds and support to solo retreat stays.
  • A client of Mindful Living, LLC reports: "I wanted some emotional balance. Since learning to meditate and establish a daily practice, problems don't linger in my mind and I feel better able to handle life's ups and downs." 

Challenges

Over the years, I have volunteered to raise funds for the American Heart Association, a former Peace Corps site, a meditation community and the Mountain Forum for Peace. I have served on boards and committees and worked the front lines of community service. It is now time to take what I have learned and apply it to my own company, such that the lessons are not lost and can be "paid forward".

  • The key word is "paid". Since 1987 I chose to work in the human service industry. If you do not know, it does not pay well.
  • All who know me will say I am frugal to a fault. This fund is my effort to raise the bar on what it will take to meet my growing goals of service to the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not have spare funds to offer:

  • We need help with construction of the yurt. In the beginning, we will need unpaid volunteers or interns to help with retreats.
  • Please share with any one you know who may be interested.

With gratitude,

Teresa Keller

A Haven is offering collaborative partnerships to share the space with local wellness practitioners: acupuncturists, massage therapists, etc.  
Mindful Living, LLC offers specialized Bi-lingual Spanish teachings.
   We need to raise $15K to build a yurt.  $12K for a 30' yurt Colorado Yurt Company pricing

Includes the stove pipe outlet, roof insulation, and crating (for shipping) Peaceful mountain location in Black Hawk, CO Sustainable and earth-friendly building
See the business plan here.
    All backgrounds are welcome. Meditation and yoga free of dogma and full of possibilities:   Contributing to a peaceful society by training peaceful people
Retreats will provide home grown organic meals, the option of honoring silence on the grounds and support to solo retreat stays. A client of Mindful Living, LLC reports: "I wanted some emotional balance. Since learning to meditate and establish a daily practice, problems don't linger in my mind and I feel better able to handle life's ups and downs." 
    Challenges Over the years, I have volunteered to raise funds for the American Heart Association, a former Peace Corps site, a meditation community and the Mountain Forum for Peace. I have served on boards and committees and worked the front lines of community service. It is now time to take what I have learned and apply it to my own company, such that the lessons are not lost and can be "paid forward".  The key word is "paid". Since 1987 I chose to work in the human service industry. If you do not know, it does not pay well. All who know me will say I am frugal to a fault. This fund is my effort to raise the bar on what it will take to meet my growing goals of service to the community.    Other Ways You Can Help If you do not have spare funds to offer:  We need help with construction of the yurt. In the beginning, we will need unpaid volunteers or interns to help with retreats. Please share with any one you know who may be interested.
  With gratitude,Teresa Keller

story:
Overcoming Walls!

The wall separating Berlin has been gone for over a quarter century. Yet, other walls, both visible and invisible, are still all around us. Social exclusion and inequality are continuing realities -  realities that the United World Colleges movement can help to change. 

The UWC Short Course "Overcoming Walls" is aiming to do just that. We will bring 60 young people from Europe and the Mediterranean region together in August, in a village close to Berlin, and take them on an intense learning journey to start to discover and transform "walls" in their communities.

The project is funded mostly by the European Union through their Erasmus+ program - yet to make it fully accessible to participants from background where crucial walls are to be overcome, we need your help!

What We Need

We have committed to taking 10 fantastic participants from Moldova, Lebanon and Syria who need more support than the EU provides, because we believe that they can enrich the group and make a crucial difference in their home countries long after the course ends.

For these participants, we need an additional contribution to travel costs, waivers for the participation fees and funding for new passports etc. Please help us to follow-through with this needs-blind admission! in return, you will, in any case, receive good karma but you can also select other perks as an expression of our gratitude.

Hear from former participants

Here is what former participants said about UWC Short Courses that some of us organized in the last couple of years:

  • You gave participants the chance to experience UWC in a nutshell, but more importantly, you showed us how to change the world
  • The feeling of friendship and appreciation of diversity made me realize how narrow my life and my outlook on life were before the course
  • Some people said it would make my CV bigger, but, instead, it enlarged my heart
  • I wish everyone could experience what I have experienced here because I believe that the world would then look very different and a great deal better


Please spread the word and follow us

Please spread this campaign to anyone who may be interested - Indiegogo offers many tools for this. Also, please like us on Facebook to stay tuned in: www.facebook.com/overcomingwalls

During the course, participants and team members will create a blog on www.overcoming-walls.de - make sure not to miss this

Finally, if you have any questions or comments, we are looking forward to hearing from you on Facebook or per email to lukas.wallrich@overcoming-walls.de


If you are curious: some further information

The United World College movement strives to make education a force to unite people, nations and cultures for peace and a sustainable future. For that, the movement runs 15 schools across the globe, as well as an increasing number of summer programs that aim to expand its reach to more students from an even more diverse range of backgrounds.

The UWC Short Course ‘Overcoming Walls’ is a 15 day residential summer programme organised by UWC Germany to spread UWC values, and enable critical engagement and youth dialogue in Germany and beyond.

The first UWC Short Course in Germany took place in 2009 (“Shaping Society!”), followed by a special UWC Short Course focusing on sustainability in Freiburg, 2012 (“Taking responsibility”).

Against the background of recently developing tensions in European societies, this Short Course will bring 60 young people together to discuss, assess and seek to transform ‘walls’ within society. The programme will enable participants to explore historical and present case studies of social conflicts caused by internal, mental ‘walls’ that peaked in physical walls being erected (e.g.the Berlin Wall, Walls in Israel, or heavily fortified border fences between the US and Mexico, or Greece and Turkey). More importantly, they will also consult case studies in which a successful social transformation occurred to deconstruct existing ‘walls’. The programme will consist of workshops that discuss relevant social theory as well as opportunities to meet the community and help in and learn from existing civil society organisations and initiatives. The participants will also develop their project delivery skills by organising mini-projects for the documentation of their learning experiences, and for sharing their learning back home.

The team of international trainers and facilitators is made up of UWC alumni and experts who are familiar with the issues of social injustices and social conflict. In addition, students of the UWC Robert Bosch College, a new member of the UWC family that focuses on sustainability, will join the team to share their learnings and experiences.

Researchers, community organisers and  politicians will supplement the programme with engaging talks and hands-on workshops. Furthermore, participants will get the opportunity to interact with a broad range of people who have important stories to tell, from holocaust survivors to present-day refugees.

story:
About this project

I have something you need! Do you want your child to reach their full potential? Does your child need to improve their concentration in school? Have more confidence? Reduce their stress? Learn about forgiveness and gratitude?

Hi I'm Kim! I’ve created My HOPE Dolls. They are spiritual and meditation plush talking dolls for every day life. Do you know someone who is suffering from illness? Do you want to create peace and love? Are you against bullying? Against gun violence? Are you a military family? Do you support the LGBTQ community? Are you trying to learn forgiveness? Do you have things in life you are grateful for? Are you trying to overcome grief? My Hope Dolls are fun, educational, therapeutic and bring comfort to kids and adults. They make a great birthday gift, holiday gift or any time gift!                                                      

                                                 

An added feature of My HOPE Dolls is that you can record your own personal message on them and the recipient will have your beautiful message to carry with them.   If you’re a grandparent who lives far away, a military parent who is deployed, or you know someone who is in the hospital, the recipient will have your personal message to treasure.

You can be spiritual without practicing meditation. Spirituality and meditation are not a religion. If you are Jewish, Muslim or Christian you can practice spirituality and meditation.

Have you ever experienced grief so great where a piece of yourself died too? I experienced a great loss in my life when my baby died.  With the help of fertility drugs, I became pregnant, but my baby died during my second trimester of pregnancy. My life was turned upside down. My life’s plans had changed. I know what it’s like to be given a treasure and have that treasure taken away from you. I relied on my spirituality and mediation to overcome grief.  During that process,  the idea of My HOPE Dolls was born. My Hope Dolls are in memory of the baby I lost. As E.M. Forster said, “We must be willing to let go of the life we planned, to have the life that is waiting for us”. 


Here's How You Can Be a Part of Making This        Happen 

1. Pick a reward to the right and make a pledge. Early donations encourage others to donate too.

2. Tell your friends, family, co-workers, neighbors. We need as much help as possible. We are hoping to surpass the $25K goal. So please Tweet it, Facebook it, Blog it, Talk it up!

Where Does My Pledge Go?

Your generous pledge will pay for manufacturing all the dolls and their clothes.

What Will I Get for It?

In addition to knowing that you made a worthwhile and meaningful project come to fruition, you also get some perks! Everything from book bags, t-shirts and Thank You tweets.  You will also be the first to own your own unique My Hope Doll!

Do you want to be a miracle in the life of a child? You can pay it forward and donate your perk. Your perk will inspire and empower a little girl in need. Once you pay for your perk and let us know you'd like to donate it, we will give it to a charity that will give it to a little girl in need. You can even choose which charity you'd like to donate it to from our list of selected charities. 

What Will You Do With "Extra" Money?

The message is in the clothes. So it's important that we are able to manufacture as many clothes designs as possible. That way we can spread our messages about love, forgiveness, meditation, peace and gratitude.

Our initial goal of $25K will allow us to manufacture the dolls and 3 clothes designs.

Stretch goal #1 is to raise $75K so we can manufacture more clothes designs and start our line of kid products including book bags, clothes, puzzles, yoga mats and more.

Stretch goal #2 is to raise 125K to manufacture all of our clothes designs and expand our line of kid products.

Once we surpass $125K we will be able to create boy dolls and produce new girl dolls beyond the 6 we have so far. We can manufacture many more clothes and kid products to help spread  our messages. 

Our ultimate goal is to create a cartoon series and a line of children's books teaching our messages. 

Why Should I Pledge Right Now?

Firstly, because you want to be a part of creating something wonderful - and your early donation helps encourage others to donate, too.

Secondly, we have Early Bird Specials 1 and 2 where you can get perks at discounted prices.

Also, and this is of utmost importance: If we don't raise our goal, we can't manufacture our unique collection of dolls and kid products. You don't get our great perks and we can't move forward. Sadly, no one gets a chance to own this unique collection of dolls. 


We Want Your Testimonials

Once you receive your My HOPE Doll, email us your story with the heading: 

What My HOPE Doll means to me.

Send us a picture of you and your My HOPE Doll in your favorite outfit from our collection. Include your name, city, state or country you live in. We will be posting stories on our webpage.


So, let's all start spreading the word and give our children a tool that will help them in life!

I am passionate about this project, and I invite you to be a part of it. Thank you for reading this and watching our video. And thank you so very much for pledging and helping us spread the word! 


In Gratitude,
Kim

 

HOPE FOR:

New job                     Overcoming grief

                                               Healing from sickness      Infertility

                                               Equality          A family to love me 

                                    Peace within ourselves      Passing an exam

                                                  To find love        Anti-Bullying

                                              To be loved          Better at sports

                                            Food            Starting a new business

                                     Shelter          Peace within our community

                                          Financial security        Anti-Violence

                                                 Anti-racism          Anti-sexism 

                                             Overcoming fear    Losing weight

story:
Who are we?

The Austin School of Film @ Motion Media Arts Center is a 501c(3) non-profit independent film, art, and technology center that supports every aspect of production from idea to distribution. Our goal is to educate, train, and develop emerging artists of all ages to be active participants in shaping our 21st century culture.

We are not a traditional college. We are not a for-profit business. We are not a private entity. We are a non-profit media arts center and school providing affordable and accessible media arts courses for both youth and adults in Central Texas. In addition to our classes, ASoF offers free fall, spring, and summer screening series, artist events and exhibits, artist workspace and much more.

We are a dedicated to the belief that film and media arts can be--and is--a financially accessible art form both in and outside of the classroom. 

A star is born!

In 2005, Cine Joven: Filmmaking in Spanish was founded  by Austin School of Film. In its earliest incarnation, it was a bold experiment in class and culture-hopping, social-engineering outreach. Austin School of Film's reasoning was, essentially, if Austin's Hispanic youth was underrepresented at the Austin School of Film, then why not take the ASoF – instructors, gear, and all – to the Hispanic youth?


Cine Joven in it's earlier years with Angs Gallegos, Cine Joven student & ASoF intern from Monterrey, Mexico.

....And that is exactly what we did! Our first programming for Cine Joven: Filmmaking in Spanish was hosted at San Juan Diego High school in Austin, Texas. It was the perfect way to offer both younger kids and older teens from the potentially lower-income Latino, Mexican-American, and immigrant communities a way to find their own unique voices in a rapidly expanding global media-scape. 

What is Cine Joven now?

Students ages 14 - 18 who participate in the Cine Joven program learn how to create a short films inspired by the telenovela format in Spanish and learn the basics of filmmaking through an innovative crew format. This after-school program provides hands-on exercises in composition, camera movement, storyboarding, image, sound development and software training on such programs as Final Cut Pro. Students will also be encouraged to incorporate their experiences during the writing process and to play all the crew roles including acting during the shoots. They will work closely with artistic mentors such as professional filmmakers, artists and editors. Not only will the students who partake in this program gain invaluable digital media skills and film production experience, but also gain necessary skills for their future careers.

Cine Joven, Winter 2014. Progress shot from new series.

Cine Joven students from Del Valle Highschool.

Throughout the years, as the completely free youth outreach program has continued to grow, we have worked directly with such high schools such as as Del Valle High school, David Crockett High school, Anderson High school, and Ann Richard's School and have had students from all over Central, Texas participate in the program.


Mundos Diferentes, Episode 1. View more episodes here!

Thus far, Cine Joven: Filmmaking in Spanish has completed 9 episodes on our ever-popular Mundos Diferentes (A Different World)  series entirely created by students ages 14 - 19 years old. 

How can you help?

Help us keep our Cine Joven: Filmmaking in Spanish Outreach Youth going and growing in the Central, Texas community! 

Cine Joven students from Anderson High school, instructor Tania Romero and actor/artistic mentor Lorelei Linklater.

Your support will help us complete and expand our exciting brand-new series featuring a new cast and crew of students of the Cine Joven program. Our new series features guest artistic mentors and filmmakers from all over the world such as Pedro Resende (Lisbon, Portugal), Angs Gallegos (Monterrey, Mexico), and Austin's own Eli Black. Our new series also has a once in a life time chance to be featured on television network El Rey.

Film Still: Actor & Artist, Lorelei Linklater in Cine Joven's upcoming series.

What will your donations do?

Filmmaker Eli Black and student Diego Lozano on set of Cine Joven's new series.

Your donations will go directly to Austin School of Film's Outreach Program, Cine Joven: Filmmaking in Spanish and completion our brand-new upcoming series. All donations are tax-deductible.

Your donations will ensure our program can continue to offer free admission to any and all students in Central Texas and provide them with digital media education and training from guest filmmakers, artists, and instructors.

This includes but is not limited to:

~ Classroom space and basic school supplies

~ Access to up-to-date software such as Final Cut Pro X, Adobe Suite, Motion Graphics and iMovie

~ Access to industry standard cinematic equipment and cameras

~ Professional artistic mentors in cinematography, sound, lighting, and software training

~ Provided lunch and dinners for students and crew on shoot and in-classroom training

and much more! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to the campaign, please contribute in other ways if at all possible.

~ SHARE OUR STORY!

~ Repost on social media like Facebook and Twitter!

~ Let us know if you know local restaurants or groups that would be willing to cater or donate food for cast and crew!

~ Volunteer your time!

Your support will help us complete and expand our exciting brand-new series featuring a new cast and crew of students of the Cine Joven program. Our new series features guest artistic mentors and filmmakers from all over the world such as Pedro Resende (Lisbon, Portugal), Angs Gallegos (Monterrey, Mexico), and Austin's own Eli Black. Our new series also has a once in a life time chance to be featured on television network El Rey.Film Still: Actor & Artist, Lorelei Linklater in Cine Joven's upcoming series.What will your donations do?Filmmaker Eli Black and student Diego Lozano on set of Cine Joven's new series.Your donations will go directly to Austin School of Film's Outreach Program, Cine Joven: Filmmaking in Spanish and completion our brand-new upcoming series. All donations are tax-deductible. Your donations will ensure our program can continue to offer free admission to any and all students in Central Texas and provide them with digital media education and training from guest filmmakers, artists, and instructors. This includes but is not limited to:~ Classroom space and basic school supplies~ Access to up-to-date software such as Final Cut Pro X, Adobe Suite, Motion Graphics and iMovie~ Access to industry standard cinematic equipment and cameras~ Professional artistic mentors in cinematography, sound, lighting, and software training~ Provided lunch and dinners for students and crew on shoot and in-classroom trainingand much more! Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot contribute to the campaign, please contribute in other ways if at all possible. ~ SHARE OUR STORY!~ Repost on social media like Facebook and Twitter!~ Let us know if you know local restaurants or groups that would be willing to cater or donate food for cast and crew!~ Volunteer your time!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Edward Iron Cloud III, member of the Oglala Sioux Tribe and lifetime resident of the Pine Ridge Reservation. Please help me  acquire 1500 acres of land near my community of Porcupine and adjacent to a bison pasture I manage for the Knife Chief Buffalo Nation, a Native-run community organization. While eventually, I would like to incorporate this land into the Knife Chief Pasture, my  goal is to use it as a camp for individuals and groups visiting the Reservation which will raise the funds to pay for the lease each year and purchase fencing that will be needed for the bison. 

The camp will be outdoor class room and camp ground to teach, promote Lakota Culture to native youth and adults as well as non-native youth and adults willing to learn. Activities would include hikes, camping, horse back riding, equine therapy, putting up tipi's, buffalo pasture tours, gathering of traditional wild foods and plants. Camp will be open to stay for fee to help pay for expanses and scholarships form youth campers.

This project is sponsored by the Lakota Lands Recovery Project (LLRP) a special project of Village Earth, a 501 (c)(3) not-for-profit organization that has worked with grassroots Lakota for 15 years. All donations are tax-deductible (less the value of any perks you may choose to receive). Village Earth has worked with Mr. Iron Cloud  and the Knife Chief Buffalo Project since 2003. 

What We Need & What You Get

The land is currently part of the BIA/Tribal Range Unit Leasing System. To obtain a lease I will need to raise $8,000. I would like to raise an addition $2000 to set-up a tipi-camp and showers. I have identified several "perks" to encourage donors including camping on the land and tours of the Pine Ridge Reservation, our bison pasture and surrounding area.

The Impact

This land has traditionally been used for grazing cattle. Acquiring this land would enable me make it available for use by Tribal and non-Tribal programs an eventually, to expand the pasture used by the Knife Chief Buffalo Nation. 

Risks & Challenges

I am familiar with the challenges of managing a lease and land on the Pine Ridge Reservation. However, the biggest challenge will be trying to make the yearly lease payment each year. Hopefully this Indigogo campaign will also raise awareness about this land and the opportunities that exist for individuals and groups to rent it for camping and other programs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate at this time, other ways you can help include:

  • Sharing this campaign with your friends and family with a direct appeal for their support. 
  • Sharing this on your Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and other social media accounts.

story:
Rainbow Children® movement stories classes offer an alternative, holistic, balanced and effective self-development education for children.  Your support with this project will help us to resource the next generation to become all they can be, to benefit them and the world that we all share.

The key benefits and outcomes for children participating in Rainbow Children movement story classes are:

* Increased ability to focus

* Awareness of emotions and how to self-regulate

* Increased cardio-vascular fitness

* Flexibility – both in body and mind

* Ability to relax

* Reconnection of body with mind

* Appreciation of the joy of movement/non-competitive exercise

* Feeling connected to self, others and the greater community

By offering a joyful connection to self, others and nature, Rainbow Children aims to ease the problems that we see in adolescents and young adults such as depression and addiction.

The project has been successful, with the development and delivery of classes through a network of dedicated teachers and a 'use at home' book and CD.  So far, however, the project is mainly reaching children whose parents already have an interest in alternative and holistic educational methods.  The aim of this funding is to reach a wider range of children, those whose lives would not otherwise be enriched by this type of education; enabling a campaign to reach out to schools to let them know about this ground-breaking approach and to encourage them to include these classes as part of their curriculum. 

By donating to this project you will be giving children the opportunity to experience the joy of connection, clear and focused attention, balanced development and free self-expression.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised will fund a website specifically aimed at schools (which will be www.movementstories.com), ‘off the shelf’ materials for school teachers to use in classes, an e-mail, telephone and free demo class campaign to reach schools across the UK. 

There are a number of benefits for those donating to the project – books, CDs, personal development tools for adults, magical events for children and the heart-warming feeling of enriching children’s lives. 

Should the we raise less than the total amount, the e-mail and telephone campaign will simply be reduced in scope to reach the geographical areas that we feel will benefit most.

The benefits of this approach

There has been much research into the benefits of yoga and mindfulness and their benefits in schools but the problem with both of these approaches or even both approaches combined is that when they are in the midst of stress and trauma, few children have the ability to sit still enough to take part in a sitting practice or stay on a yoga mat for an hour. If you are not ready to sit in classroom then you are not ready to do sitting meditation or reflective movement practice. Our over-stimulated students simply cannot sit still. Teachers tell kids 100 times a day to sit and pay attention. It doesn’t work.

To engage children and achieve mental, physical and emotional release, relaxation, mindfulness, body-mind connection and awareness a combination of approaches is necessary. It is also of utmost importance that the methodology is FUN! Adults can reason as to why an activity is good for them (such as mindfulness and yoga) and thus stick to it until the positive results are felt. Children need to enjoy something to keep focus, participate fully and stick with it. Rainbow Children ticks all of the boxes with its unique format of free-form dance and self-expression through movement, creative yoga-style movement, music, song and breathing/relaxation/creative visualisation techniques all held within captivating, therapeutic teaching stories with enchanting characters.

This method enables children to develop and own their own sense of belonging, of feeling, of personal power, of love, of voice, of intuition and of connection, and that the answers to our problems and questions often lie within our own ability to resolve.  If we are inclusive in all aspects of ourselves and others, we can journey forward together towards a colourful and rewarding future.

Risks & Challenges

Marketing to schools is not an easy task.  However, with my MSc in Marketing with a focus on Social Responsibility and years of marketing experience prior to training and working in the holistic education field, I will have a good chance of success. 

By producing materials for the website that teachers can utilise in their own classes (formatted to fit with the Personal, Social and Health Education (PSHE) curriculum) the campaign will be useful as a tool for teachers and will therefore reach children to some extent however successful the campaign aim of many Rainbow Children teachers teaching in mainstream schools is.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute at this time, please do share with anyone who may be interested in supporting this project, either through social media or e-mail … Indiegogo have easy to use ‘share’ tools on this site.

www.rainbowchildren.co.uk

story:
East New York Memorial Classic is 501(c)(3) not for profit organization. Six guys from Brooklyn, NY decided to start a basketball tournament to give the youth in the community the opportunity to showcase their talent. There were tournaments all around city and uptown but nothing this huge in Brooklyn. So we established the East New York Memorial Classic and are currently approaching our 10th year. The starting point was rough but we remained focused. We've grown over the years from t-shirts to jerseys. Then we expanded from 8 teams to 16 teams. Lastly, from a couple of hundred fans to a few thousand on a nightly basis. Through our dedication, focus and hard work we have become one of the best tournaments in the tri-state area.

      As we want to expand, broaden our horizons and share our visions we're looking to incorporate a junior league for our youth. The talk around the city is that kids playing street ball on the playgrounds are non-existent. We beg to differ, if you are a fan of basketball, you know that playground basketball is alive and well. With that being said, we want to give them somewhere they can come and gain the necessary structure and foundation needed to succeed in a competitive environment. With the help of anyone that donates, we can help the youth live up to their full potential.

     With our tournament we look to teach kids some important aspects of life. One way of doing that is through sports. This can be very important because it teaches them teamwork and how to do it in an organized way. This will be an outlet for our youth to use their energy in a positive way. This also will be another way for those who are socially challenged to collaborate with someone with a common interest. Our goal is to build the confidence needed to make them want to reach for success. We're looking forward to being a positive influence on our youth as they progress through life.

     Also, by supporting our campaign, you will help us with our back to school give back. There are so many children who lack the support from family members. With this funding we would be able to help children get the school year started off correctly by providing them with school supplies. Just a little assistance like this goes a long way in a child's mind.

story:
Short Summary

I am 33 years and the CEO of Amidarr A-mole. A firm formed to create jobs and opportunity for young and talented Africans with focus in Technology and Agriculture. I am a BSc Actuarial Science graduate from the Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology. I formed my business whiles in school and had plans to employ 999 young people by 2020. This is my hope to help Africa create jobs and set hopes for the young ones coming up.


I am seriously campaigning to raise fund to support a worthy idea : www.edu-gh.net  which is a subsidiary of Amidarr A-mole’s operations.

Focus :

We earnestly need funds to setup our local school software , train our young employees, and expand our operations to over 1000 schools in Ghana.

Most school children are downhearted over their academic reports at the end of every term because they believe that is not the true reflection of their performance. This is due to errors in their reports, which are mostly generated manually. This more times discourages students from attending school.



Over 85% of schools in Ghana do not have an Management system to accurately access students performance as most is done manually ; full of errors. Others who have systems to use complain about inaccuracy of information generated or non-expertise to help manage the system. We have therefore tested a system that could solve both the management system type and requisite support personnel problem.
Our tested system was meant to provide an accurate information system to schools and create employment for the youth in our society.
How the system was tested ?
1) The System: We wanted to get software as a service (SaaS) system that would work perfectly. Though we are developers we tried to get an already existing system to test our plans. Therefore joined Fedena as an OEM partner Fedena is easy customizable ERP software for schools. With this Idea we were able to get about 25 schools within 2months.

2) Create Employment:  We were able to employ 21 young talented people. Those employed were graduates from certified IT training centers in Ghana including NIIT and IPMC. Others too were brilliant young Senior high school graduates.
Our focus was to create a sustainable livelihood for the young and provide a better school management system  for schools.
And this had been deeply ascertained by the aforementioned testing software system.
Our Employment structure(funding our employees)- our system was designed to generate a recurring fund from the schools. This is easily achievable by charging server cost from the school and also each student paying a small amount (0.25cent) per term to save the systems operation. This technique is convincingly acceptable by the schools since our system runs online.

Why Our Campaign?

We are using an OEM system, which does not belong to us and does not fit our local education system. Since the system was customized to suite our local educational report system, the report generated is a bit different from what is expected. Hence, the need to get our locally manufactured management software. We have young talented developers to help facilitate the new online application software.
Also since our young staff needs training before they are deployed to their various stations (schools) to manage the system, we urgently need a training center for training, testing, research and development. A fully equipped center for such a purpose involves getting a state of the art IT lab.

In short, we will create more employment for the youth and provide a better system to help in generating examination report for schools in Ghana.

The Funding:
We need USD 64,500 for the entire project. This is for the software development, setting up a computer lab and management.

Software Application Development  and Online Server Cost: USD19,000.
Training Centre Setup Cost: USD  37,500
Nationwide Branding and Advertising : USD  6,500
Management and Misc : USD 1,500
Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.

Though we plan to raise 64,500 for the entire project we could easily manage any amount that we get. The total amount is for the total software development (which comprise 12 modules: Academics, Examination, Library, Hostel ,HR, Registration, Attendance, Time Table, Resource Centre, Assignment, Finance and Transportation. 
If we are not able to meet our target, any fund generated would be used on the primary modules to start with. And with time internally generated funds would be used to complete the rest.


Impact:
How can school children be encouraged to go to school if their end of term reports misrepresents their efforts? Most school children in Ghana are mentally worried due to the inaccuracy of academic performance reports they receive at the end of each school term.
On the other hand, most young people after graduating for professional IT certification institutions do not get employment. Unemployment rate in Ghana is very high currently. And will get worse due to IMF restriction coming on board. The issue is then that, how can we as ordinary people help in the creation of jobs for our fellow people. That is our main focus now, and we need your help to achieve just that.

Risks & Challenges

As a BSc Degree Holder in Actuarial Science, I have led our team to worked so hard to reduce the risk factor and the error margin in our operation. Though we have some challenges ahead of us, we still have a larger strength position to let this idea happen.

This is because, the IT and Management Information System to be precise is taken hold of our daily operational management tasks. We cannot generate accurate information without using the latest and accurate technological methodology.

Nonetheless, we cannot rule out the potential of software development delay due to decision taken today been subsequently overtaken by event. We can also envisage the difficulty in getting most schools at the initials since many schools prefer tried and tested systems. Hence our growth pace will increase with time.

But with our well-organized system and an already tested approach, we hope to grow faster than even planned. We have a well-planned approach to the system development and also to the branding and marketing of the product.

Our "to create-employment " focus has led us to develop a multi-level- marketing platform which we would aid our system to spread faster thus getting more remuneration to all stakeholders and creating the employments as well. Our employment focus for our company to recruit young IT oriented people, train them on our software then send them to the schools to manage the system on our behalf. And as we offer this service, the school and the students pay money for our services offered.

Other Ways you can Help:

Fellows who are good in ruby on rails could offer their time and expertise in helping us develop the application. We will also appreciate and accept support in kind, as in the form of a computer, a projector, an interactive whiteboard.

the error margin in our operation. Though we have some challenges ahead of us,
we still have a larger strength position to let this idea happen.
This is because, the IT and Management
Information System to be precise is taken hold of our daily operational
management tasks. We cannot generate accurate information without using the
latest and accurate technological methodology. 
Nonetheless, we cannot rule out the
potential of software development delay due to decision taken today been
subsequently overtaken by event. We can also envisage the difficulty in getting
most schools at the initials since many schools prefer tried and tested
systems. Hence our growth pace will increase with time.
But with our well-organized system and
an already tested approach, we hope to grow faster than even planned. We have a
well-planned approach to the system development and also to the branding and
marketing of the product. 
Our "to create-employment "
focus has led us to develop a multi-level- marketing platform which we would
aid our system to spread faster thus getting more remuneration to all
stakeholders and creating the employments as well. Our employment focus for our
company to recruit young IT oriented people, train them on our software then
send them to the schools to manage the system on our behalf. And as we offer
this service, the school and the students pay money for our services offered.
Other
Ways you can Help:
Fellows who are good in ruby on rails
could offer their time and expertise in helping us develop the application. We
will also appreciate and accept support in kind, as in the form of a computer, a
projector, an interactive whiteboard.

story:
What will the game be like?

Unlike a typical statistics class, this game is not about calculations. The statistical calculations are done for you. This game is about interpreting statistical results and developing the mental models to reason about the world probabilistically. 

It is inspired by The Oregon Trail, a classic game that lets you make a series of bad decisions and then learn from them!

What will I be able to do after playing the game?

After playing the game, you will be able to:

  • Have a gut sense for what a standard deviation of 2.4 means
  • Have a gut sense for what correlation coefficients of -0.4, 0.1, and 0.6 look like
  • Use the correlation coefficient between two variables to make predictions of one variable based on the other
  • Justify use of normal distribution models using the Central Limit Theorem
  • Use a graphical form of Bayesian hypothesis testing to pick the more likely hypothesis
  • Apply a z-test to determine if the difference in the sample mean is statistically different
  • Interpret p-values (very carefully)

Why statistics?

There's an entire subject dedicated to explaining randomness in real life and how we can model its behavior to our advantage!

I fell in love with statistics during my time at MIT, and I want to take the concepts from serious statistics classes and pool them into a game about everyday life so they are accessible to more people.

Who are you?

I am a graduate of the MIT Computer Science Department and the MIT Media Lab. I am a freelance programmer with the World Bank working on intuitive data visualizations for rural populations. In my free time, I work on  interactive stories about probability like Adventures in Cognitive Biases and The Raccoon Princess and the Fox Prince: A Bayesian Parable. 

Timmy's Journey is going to be different from anything I've worked on in the past... it is going to be my first full-fledged game.

What age group is this for?

The game is for adults and kids (14+) due to the amount of logical and mathematical maturity assumed. If you are of sound mind and want to reason rigorously, this game is for you!

Is this frequentist or Bayesian statistics?

The game begins by explaining frequentist concepts since those are the concepts more prevalent in mainstream media. However, I am a trained and raised Bayesian and the game will have Bayesian hypothesis testing.

What is the Sorcerer's secret?

I am not telling yet, but it is the same as my secret...


A huge thanks to Luke Cheng (video footage), Eric Chisholm, Rachel Fong, Cory Li, Alia McCutcheon, Brienne Strohl, Carlo Fernando V, Bret Victor, Reese Von West (the orange cat), Sherwin Yu, Eliezer Yudkowsky, and Yan Zhang for making this game and campaign possible!

story:
Hi everyone!

A little while ago we got to know the situation of the Tecal community located in Limón.

Community situation:

When the community was first discovered, their houses were maid out of black garbage plastic bags, they did not have electricity and the water supply was about 1km away. Due to its location, in rainy season the community normally gets flooded and there is no access by car.

The people of the community work for the banana plantations but there are times in which the production pauses and they lose their jobs, leaving them without any income to provide food or clothes to the families so we want to help them.

This is us trying to access the community in rainy season...

Our project: Raise money to build decent roads, food & clothes!

The local council has agreed to provide the gravel and employees to build proper roads for free but the community has been asked to pay for each wagon (12 wagon aprox) to carry the gravel to the location.

Each wagon costs $100 and the average income per family is $25 a week to feed about 5 people.

So here its were we ask for your help!

What will this money cover?

- Approximately 12 wagons of gravel (could be more)

- Basic groceries for 52 families (rice, beans, oil, canned food, etc)

* Hygiene products such as toilet paper, sanitary pads, toothpaste, etc.

*A toy for each kid (they currently play with rocks, broken plastic buckets or anything they find)


We would like to say THANK YOU! in advance for your help and we promise to post pictures of the progress.

Regards,

Carolina and Mario

Founders of Foodfilling Hearts

story:
Hello,

Thank you for supporting my campaign to study abroad in Barcelona, Spain. My name is Jacobo Montejano and I am currently a Senior at California State University, Fresno where I am completing my degree in Business Administration with an emphasis in Management. This campaign is to raise money to get the opportunity to travel to Barcelona with the CSU, Fresno International Business/Craig School of Business Summer Study Abroad Program. The course is 6 weeks long and will earn 4 units from an intense Production/Operations Management course.

I Got Accepted Into The Program!!

I have been working hard for a long time and it has finally paid off! The main obstacle at this point is the cost of the program and now I need to raise the funds to make my dream a reality! This program would be beneficial in completing my schooling where I would take part in a 6 week long, 4 unit course in Productions/Operations Management. At the other end, in a world where globalization is becoming more and more important - this course would expose me to international businesses and allow me to create partnerships with international firms. This is a tremendous opportunity, so please help me achieve this dream.

How Can You Help?

The program consists of several different fees: tuition, air travel, and extra costs. All together the costs add up to $3900, but I only need $2550 since I was awarded a Travel Grant totaling to $1350 due to high academic achievement. I would be both ecstatic and extremely grateful for any and all donations to this campaign. If you cannot donate, I understand, but please help me reach my goal by other means. Please spread the word by sharing the link or by anything else you can do, it all helps.

Thank you very much, and I am extremely grateful for your generosity.

Sincerely,

Jacobo Montejano

Please know that because of the Indiegogo policies, I will only be able to campaign for 60 days at a time. If I do not reach my goal amount in that time they will charge me 9% of the current donation. If I DO reach my goal, they will only charge 4%.

story:
Our Story

We are helping our friend and colleague, Rhoena Dehaan, build a new school, daycare, and community space in her hometown village of Kwakwani, Guyana in South America.  Rhoena was born in this village, but she has lived in Canada, teaching preschool and college for many years.  She goes back every year to visit and support her village. Quentin Krogstad and Janet Steeves are teachers who have become passionate supporters of The Guyana Project, and this campaign is their effort to help grow it.
This is a grassroots, personal, and heartfelt campaign, and we are friends and fellow educators helping Rhoena to realize her childhood dream of bettering her community through education.  This is not a registered charity, but simply a collection of caring people trying to make a difference in the world.  The benefit of this is that there are no administrative costs or other fees, and all of your donation goes directly and completely to the work being done.
This campaign is important because it allows us to recognize our place of privilege and give to those who have less.  By creating a safe, healthy school environment, we are giving children an opportunity for education and success that was previously unavailable to them.  This school is a concrete, authentic example of people working together to reach across the globe to make a real difference. 
By contributing even the smallest amount to join with us, you become part of both a local and global community committed to making the world a better place.

What We Need & What You Get

So far, we have raised over $30,000 in the past 2 years, which assisted in the construction of the outer shell of the school.  We need over $100,000 to finish the construction and furnishing of the building, landscaping, creation of a playground, and much more.

We have broken down donations into actual, physical items which will be purchased or made with specific donations.

For $10, you can contribute to the school library.  Your name will be written in the book(s) you purchase.

For $25, you will buy a chair for the school.  These chairs are handmade in the village of Kwakwani, so this donation benefits the community twice!  You can have your name on the chair you donate to show your connection.

For $50, you can purchase a stack of cinder blocks.  Your name will be placed on the wall as a supporter of the building.

For $100, you can buy a locally hand-made table for the school  Your name will be displayed here.

For $250, you can contribute to the playground.  Your name will be put on a piece of playground equipment.

For $500, you can can buy a door or window.  Your name will be in a prominent place on the door or window.

If you have a specific request for your donation, email Quentin or Janet and we will work to accommodate your request.

    The Impact

    This project directly improves the lives of 65 children in the village of Kwakwani right now.  Also, people in the village have found employment as labourers, drivers, cooks, teachers, and more.  The building, once completed, will also serve as a de facto community centre where many community gatherings can be held.

    Balmoral Junior High School and Bow Valley College have been strong supporters of this project.  This May and June, 10 students from BVC will be in Kwakwani on a month long practicum trip at this and other schools in the community.

    One of the beautiful aspects of this project is the multi-national and multi-generational component.  We are working with preschool-aged children in both Guyana and Calgary.  Students from grades 5-9 at Balmoral JHS have been actively engaged in raising the bulk of the funds to date, and they are committed to the growth of this project for years to come.  Students at BVC have also been fundraising, and they are giving up time and money to do their practicum there.  Teachers at BVC and Balmoral JHS have been strongly supportive of Rhoena and The Guyana Project.  Friends, family, students, and colleagues of all ages have joined together to make this dream a reality.  Join us.  Be a part of making this concrete, positive difference in the world.

    Risks & Challenges

    There have been challenges along the way.  Building in a remote village in a country far away is a tenuous undertaking.  Some costs have been higher than anticipated, some materials have been difficult to get or transport, and we have expanded the original plan for the building (this is primarily because adding a second floor now was much cheaper in the long run than adding on a second story later).  The fact is, however, that future work will only happen as more money is raised.  Rhoena is an incredible and dedicated woman who has sacrificed a great deal to get this project where it is, but now it is our turn.  We need to step up. now, to make this a reality.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    While money is required to complete this project, there are other ways you can support us as well.

    Spread the word!  Tell friends, family, and co-workers about this.  Use social media.  There are many ways to share embedded here in this site.

    Donate an item or service for a silent auction we will be having later this year.

    Collect or donate specific items to help with the school.  Email Quentin or Janet for a full list of supplies which are cheaper or easier to buy here and send to Guyana.

    You may have a new, clever, or innovative idea to help.  Let us know; we will support you in any way we can.

story:
Short Summary

  • The Lyric Foundation is a long standing arts institution of Hollywood and haven for arts education. With the goal of providing a creative and safe space for artists of all ages to express themselves through live performance, the Lyric has always been committed to providing its community with the benefits of theatre education. Housed at the beautiful Lyric Theatre on La Brea in the heart of Hollywood, the Lyric foundation education program is now being headed by Co- Directors Sam Ayoub and Willem Long. Ayoub, a graduate of UCLA's prestigious Theatre BA program and Long a recent graduate of University of Londons MA Acting program are childhood friends from the Bay Area. Sam and Will have worked in many different areas of education and live performance which inspired their passion for Arts to benefit Autism.  
  •  The Lyric has recently teamed up with Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights to launch a full scale production of Ariel Dorfmans Speak Truth to Power, a dramatization of Kerry Kennedy's book on Social Justice. In the past the RFK has held celebrity readings of this play for an audience of politicians. This time they are doing the play with High School students from the Los Angeles community. The Lyric Theatre will host the production on Dec. 10 2015, which is also Human Rights Day. The Lyric Foundation will Launch a 10 week program leading up to the final production that will consist of drama therapy based classes and rehearsals that will be showcased by our students with Autism in the final performance. The final three weeks of the program will be a collaboration between the RFKs nuero-typically developing High School students and the Lyric Foundations performers with ASD. The culminating production will be a human rights performance piece voiced by passionate teens from a variety of backgrounds. 
  • The Amazing aspect of this program is that it gives a voice to those who struggle, and provides an opportunity for improvement. Drama therapy has proved exceptionally effective when applied to those on the Autism Spectrum. The techniques of drama studies are physical and interactive as well as introspective. So much of what people with Autism struggle with involves a lack of social connection and over stimulation which are directly addressed by the techniques applied when preparing to perform. The content of the play these students will be a part of directly expresses the need for social change in the realm of human rights. This program puts the power of change in the hands of those who crave change the most.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for 25,000  to kick off our initial fundraising campaign! The program will require more but this will kick start many costs that are essential to launch us. These expenses include rental space, teacher compensation, field trips, and arts supplies. The Lyric foundation sees this new education plan as a long term initiative, and showing support on this campaign will add power to our appeal for larger grants. 
  • We are operating under a flexible funding program so even if we don't make 20,000 every little bit will still help!

The Impact

  •  By contributing to this cause you can help initiate social change. The chance to speak out about afflictions and struggles that make us unique is an opportunity many take for granted. What if you couldn't tell people where it hurts or why? What if in the most successful educational realms, you became an after thought? Donating will help birth a program that will change your community for the better by inspiring human empathy and raising awareness all the while creating new opportunity for teens with Autism.
  •   We would like to Identify our mentor group: The Miracle Project. Willem Long has worked closely with the founder Elaine Hall on her successful Arts for Autism Program The Miracle Project. Her programs success is beautifully chronicled in the HBO documentary Autism the Musical. This Veteran group has already offered us guidance and support on our journey to create more opportunities for ASD students. Other supportive parties include The Music Center, RFK, Westside Regional Center, The Royal Jacks, and Lissie.
  •  1 in 68 births in the US result in ASD diagnosis. Chances are you know someone who has ASD or  someone who has a family member on the spectrum. Opportunities for those who struggle with ASD can be few and far between, but when those opportunities have been present the results are phenomenal.  
  • Risks & Challenges
  • Although the Lyric has always made education a priority, we are aware that this education plan is new. Having worked with successful education institutions and foundations like The Miracle Project and Fusion academy, we are confident that we have the support necessary to avoid first time mistakes. The combination of our passion and the investment of larger well established organizations like the RFK, will make us prime for success. The real challenge is raising the money, as the out pour of support for our program has been inspiring!
  • In the early stages of building this program it has been amazing to witness the encouragement and support being offered already. I can say confidently that our students will be given a top education by some of the most talented teaching artists in LA as well as a substantial platform to speak their truth in a safe, fun, and nurturing environment. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We understand that not everybody can give their money, but we also want support! Please get the word out about our Program. Tell everyone about the teens with Autism that have the power to change the world! 
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Lyric Foundation Arts for Autism Education Program Thanks You!!

Sincerely grateful and inspired,

Sam Ayoub & Willem Long

  Although the Lyric has always made education a priority, we are aware that this education plan is new. Having worked with successful education institutions and foundations like The Miracle Project and Fusion academy, we are confident that we have the support necessary to avoid first time mistakes. The combination of our passion and the investment of larger well established organizations like the RFK, will make us prime for success. The real challenge is raising the money, as the out pour of support for our program has been inspiring! In the early stages of building this program it has been amazing to witness the encouragement and support being offered already. I can say confidently that our students will be given a top education by some of the most talented teaching artists in LA as well as a substantial platform to speak their truth in a safe, fun, and nurturing environment.     Other Ways You Can Help  We understand that not everybody can give their money, but we also want support! Please get the word out about our Program. Tell everyone about the teens with Autism that have the power to change the world!  Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!   The Lyric Foundation Arts for Autism Education Program Thanks You!!Sincerely grateful and inspired,Sam Ayoub & Willem Long

story:
Short Summary

  • Shelton currently has no off-leash dog spaces.  Please help create a space where dogs can play and interact unleashed!
  • This project will be completely funded by the community and donors, so your donation is extremely helpful!

What We Need & What You Get

  • All of the funding from this fundraiser will be going directly to the park to cover the basic infrastructure, such as fencing, signs, waste stations, and garbage cans.  
  • We have many rewards for our donors!  Check out the pet photography session from OlyDogs! Studios and check out their website at http://www.olydog.com
  • Even if we don't reach our goal, our donors will still get their rewards and the donations will go directly to the Shelton Dog Park to help get it one step closer to being created!

The Impact of Dog Parks

    Dog parks are great off-leash spaces for dogs to exercise and socialize with other dogs.  Dog parks are also great for community-members!  They can exercise their dogs, socialize with other dog lovers, bond and play with their dogs, practice their off-leash training skills, and enjoy the entertaining antics of frolicking dogs.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please join our Facebook page to stay updated: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Friends-of-Shelton-Dog-Park/853724637991279
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share this with the world!

story:
Youtube Channel 'Fascinating Stories about Women'.

There are so many women who have lead or are leading inspiring lives, but they are not part of 'history'! Why? Simply because until now, media related men's fascinating stories... nothing wrong with that, but for so many young people it's important to have interesting rolemodels, it is for boys, so it is for girls! Hurry up to make your contribution to make women pioneers-past & present' visible in history to encourage young people to follow their passion regardless what gender you are! ‪#‎STEAM‬

See the Ada Lovelace animation above, as an example of what the animation will look like apart from the client sponsors.

  • Through my work making storytelling animations (www.quidos.net) animations i've seen so many interesting women's stories-UNTOLD! These stories involve a lot of women in STEAM (Science-Technology-Art-Mathematics)
  • Your money will make it possible to kick-off a real channel where these fascinating stories are brought in the spotlight. The first story about Ada Lovelace has found its way on the Wikipage of Ada Lovelace https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ada_Lovelace SEE : External Links.  
  • No need to say that the medium today to reach young people is videos. A Youtube Channel starting with 10 interesting women pioneers' stories makes her story visible in history. 
  • Do you have kids, do you want your daughter or son to know that 'driven by passion' you can build an interesting life- regardless what gender you belong to.
  • Here you can find my interview in Suit & Pie: http://suitandpie.co.uk/herstory/

What does it cost?

You can make a donation in PayPal or Creditcard. Takes 5' top chrono! 
#IfnotmeWHO #ifnotnowWHEN #SheforShe #HeforSHE #genderEQUALITY 

To have a real start of a channel, ideally there would be 10 animations to start with:

  • Each animation costs 2500 $. 
  • You are welcome to make suggestions of women's profiles and starting from 50$ you will be mentionned in the credits at the end of all the animations made through this Indiegogo campaign!
  • The more money I raise the more stories will be added to the 'Fascinating Stories about Women'channel.
  • Some of the names on top of my list (but suggestions are welcome!) Grace Hopper (computer scientist), Rosalind Franklin (chemistry), Sophie Germain (mathematician), Te Ata Fisher (Storyteller), Artemisia Gentileschi (painter), Martha Graham (dancer & choreographer), Lou Salome (psychoanalyst and author)...

  • FYI : anonymous contribution is possible, just click the button anonymous

    during payment info. Note, this also means if you contribute for 50€ we might not be able to put your name into the credits, if you would like to be in the credits, but still want to be anonymous on this site, you can let me know your info by email at allaeys(@)gmail.com


Her Story makes it into History!

Well, we all know at least the story of some women, let's say Marie Curie eg. is certainly one of the most easily quoted women, seen her contribution to science and being one of the rare persons winning 2x the Nobelprize. But did you know that a woman named Rosalind Franklin was actually the one who discovered the double helix structure of DNA. However, 3 other people did win the noble prize for this discovery and Rosalind never knew her work was at the origin of this discovery. 

That's why you should support 'Her Story in History'!

( Some Brag Facts: read : why i think these animations could get some visibility) I've been doodling theanimation for IYCr2014 and got shares by Nobelprize.org and RI and liked by Dan Shechtman (Nobel Prize in Chemistry 2011) who was featured in the animation.

My  EU campaign 'DeleteCyberbullying' was shared by Upworthy and Meg Cabot.

My animated version 'Low Battery' with Prince EA got +17 mio views

  • Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute in money, it doesn't mean you can not help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about  'Her Story in History' campaign.
  • If you have a community where you want to promote the 'Fascinating Stories' please do, once they are up & running.
  • If you have suggestions about fascinating women, you're most welcome
  • If you feel much more women are worth to get their story in history-which is the case ofcourse- help spreading the word, so we can add much more.
  • Don't hesitate to use the Indiegogo share tools!

That's about it. Time to launch Her story History! and by the way, you don't have to be a woman to support the 'Her story History' campaign

story:
My name is Le Do and I am creating this campaign called "Le Do it for the Kids" to celebrate my 24th birthday this August. 

My goal in 30 years is to find my own private foundation where one of its main goals is to strengthen children’s futures through hospitality, medical and technology education; I would find an institution where unfortunate kids will be taken in and given the necessary tool and knowledge to change not only their fate but also the society.

Despite its small scale, this campaign will act as a milestone, a promise to myself to work hard so I can carry out my goal in the future.

Donations made to the U.S. Fund for UNICEF will go towards helping children outside of the United States through programs that provide food, clean water and sanitation, education, medical attention and vaccines, and child protection.  90 percent of all donations are used to facilitate  these life-saving programs. The U.S. Fund for UNICEF is the fundraising arm of UNICEF international, here in the United States.

Every dollar counts. Start paying it forward now! :)

Thank you and Buddha bless,

story:
Help us hold our Florida lawmakers accountable for their public education duty.

“The education of children is a fundamental value of the people of the State of Florida.  It is, therefore, a paramount duty of the state to make adequate provision for the education of all children residing within its borders. Adequate provision shall be made by law for a uniform, efficient, safe, secure, and high quality system of free public schools that allows students to obtain a high quality education...” (From Article IX of the Florida Constitution)

The opportunity to learn should be available to all children no matter their circumstances or obstacles to success. Southern Legal Counsel’s Five for Change campaign was started as an effort to reach people from all walks of life to get involved in our case to bring a better education to Florida’s public school children. Every child in the state of Florida deserves a quality education. Our landmark case can help bring that quality education to 2.9 million children statewide.

Your small contribution can help shape a better future for Florida’s children. For more information, please visit Southern Legal Counsel.

Special credit and thanks to Analise, an eighth grade student at Westwood Middle School in Alachua County, Florida for the making of this video.

SOUTHERN LEGAL COUNSEL, INC., A NON-PROFIT FLORIDA CORPORATION, IS REGISTERED WITH THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND CONSUMER SERVICES. A COPY OF THE OFFICIAL REGISTRATION, #CH13498, AND FINANCIAL INFORMATION MAY BE OBTAINED FROM THE DIVISION OF CONSUMER SERVICES BY CALLING TOLL-FREE 800-435-7352 WITHIN THE STATE.  REGISTRATION DOES NOT IMPLY ENDORSEMENT, APPROVAL, OR RECOMMENDATION BY THE STATE. SLC IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION, TAX I.D. #59-1726382.

story:
BUILDING A DAYCARE CENTRE FOR 234 ORPHAN CHILDREN IN THE CITY OF BEIRA, MOZAMBIQUE

The orphan children of Praia Nova

Welcome to the neighbourhood of Praia Nova, in city of Beira, in the eastern part of Mozambique! Here live more than 230 orphan children who have lost one or both of their parents to HIV/AIDS and have little familiar ties left.

These children are supported by a Portuguese NGO called Padrinhos de Portugal (Godparents of Portugal) and by the Movimento das Mães Cristãs Intercessessoras contra o HIV/SIDA (Christian Mothers’ Movement against HIV/AIDS), a Mozambican NGO. All the children are fostered by Portuguese godfather or godmother, who provides for their education and financial needs, and are taken care of and followed up closely by the team of Movimento das Mães.

Most children don’t have a sound familiar structure and spend long parts of their day at a daycare centre that is run by the Mothers and funded by the Padrinhos. Even though they don’t live at the centre, that’s the place where they have all the daily meals, do their homework and spend much of their free time… Currently, the centre looks like this:

There are only two small “classrooms” and the children have to use it in turns.

The centre is located near the river and it floods frequently, so the children have no place to stay…

There are no proper bathrooms.

When we see these pictures one thing only comes to our minds: the children of Praia Nova need a new daycare centre! And that’s where the Terra-a-Terra team comes in!

The Terra-a-Terra Team

Terra-a-Terra is a Portuguese expression that means “down to earth” and it can be used to describe a person who is very practical, uncomplicated and a problem solver.

In June 2012, Madalena, a Portuguese architect travelled to India and, during that trip, she was asked to design the architecture project for a school in a small community in Khatangi-Bihar. After Madalena returned to Portugal, she started Terra-a-Terra, a group of volunteers that designs and implements sustainable architecture projects in developing countries.

In 2013, Padrinhos de Portugal asked Terra-a-Terra to design and raise the funds necessary for the new daycare centre at Praia Nova. Once we saw the current conditions of the centre we could only say YES to this challenge and start work right away! The current team has six members: Madalena, Luísa, Duarte, Marco, João, and Marta.

Team working.


This is what we have prepared for the children of Praia Nova:

The centre seen from the playground.


OUR VISION | THE PROJECT 

More than the place where they study and have their meals, the centre is the closest thing these children have to a real home .Our goal is to offer the children a new home, with all the facilities and comfort they deserve. The new centre will have:

  • 4 classrooms
  • 1 canteen, that works also as a multipurpose space where the children can play, do some exercise, throw their birthday parties…
  • 1 kitchen and warehouse
  • Toilet facilities
  • Playground and garden

THE PLAN

STAGE 1 | Get a plot of land to build the centre | CHECK!  

The municipality has granted the plot in the city of Beira, in 2011;

STAGE 2 | Submit the Project to the Municipality | CHECK!

In 23 July 2013, we submitted the project to the municipality! We managed to get an exemption to pay all the city taxes.  

STAGE 3 | 1st Meeting with the Community | CHECK!

During June and July 2013, we visited Praia Nova to present the project and meet the community! The community is engaged and committed!

STAGE 4 | Raising the €100.000 needed for the construction | BEING DONE

To build the centre we will need:

● BACKFILLING AND FENCING THE PLOT  40.000,00€

● WATER AND SEWAGE FOUNDATIONS AND INFRASTRUCTURES   20.000,00€

● STRUCTURAL WALLS, SECONDARY STRUCTURE AND ROOFING  20.000,00€

●LIGHT WALLS, FENCING AND FURNITURE     10.000,00€

● OUTDOOR ARRANGEMENTS  10.000,00€

In the worst case scenario, we may not raise all the funds we need to build and furniture the centre in its entirety. But if that happens, we will use the funds to develop the structural parts of the project, such as the water and sewage foundations, the structural walls and roofing: without them it is impossible to make a stable construction. All the secondary works will be done over-time as the funds become available.

STAGE 5 | Construction – Dream come true!

The community is engaged and committed! The centre will be built using sustainable and economic construction techniques. We will also use local materials, as a way to boost the local economy. The construction will be done by the Terra-a-Terra team of volunteers working together with members of the community.

Local Team responsable for the actual Centre

...and the schedule:


The impact in the community

Praia Nova is a poor neighbourhood where the children receive little attention and care. Many of them drop school quite early and are enticed to very low paid jobs, often illegal ones. It is not difficult to imagine that each one of these children has a good chance to become an unemployed adult and very susceptible to drug and alcohol abuse.

The centre will make a huge difference in the community: the children will have a place to call their home and where they can get stable schedules and discipline. They will be encouraged to keep on studying and, as they will use the space on a daily basis, it will be easier to check if they don’t skip school and to detect any health or behavioural problem. In this way, the centre will contribute to give the children the opportunity to break the cycle of poverty they were born in.

The whole community will also benefit: all the construction materials will be bought to local suppliers and all the services will be provided by Mozambican companies.


How to help

Donate!

If you cannot make a donation, there are many ways to support the project:

Follow us on facebook!!

Share the crowdfunding on your social networks;

Pass the word to your friends, family, coworkers…

Let us know if you know anyone at the city of Beira that could help the project!
