story:
Europe is facing its worst refugee crisis since the Second World War. So far in 2015 more than 350,000 desperate people have made the perilous journey across the Mediterranean Sea. In Italy, 7,600 children have arrived alone since January, without any parents or families at all.

For those who do survive the treacherous journey, the terrifying ordeal is not over.Children often arrive in Europe scared and exhausted. Many have seen and experienced untold horrors during their journey. 


The physical impact of travelling is also clear. Many of the children have severe

sunburns and blisters from their journey. Many have lost their toenails from the 

huge distances they have walked.

Refugees from Syria, Iraq and Afghanistan walk on the railway tracks 40km west of Budapest, trying to reach Germany. EPA.

Refugee children are frightened, homeless and many have witnessed unspeakable horrors. You can help them. Save the Children's teams are working across Europe and in the countries they are fleeing to provide aid and support. Help them to reach more refugee children. 

A baby is lifted on to the Norwegian vessel ‘Siem Pilot’ during a search-and-rescue mission off the Libyan coast, September 2015. The Independent.

 What Save the Children are doing

Save the Children work along the whole route that refugees take as well as in the countries they are fleeing. In countries like Turkey, Greece and Italy, they provide children and their families with essentials that they desperately need - like food, water and shelter, as well as items like soap and toilet paper.

They also run centres where children can shower, receive medical help and make calls.

Making sure that children are protected wherever possible is vital – Save the Children identify child protection needs and make sure that they’re aware of their legal rights.

They also continue to work in countries like Syria, where brutal war has ripped apart the lives of millions, as well as neighbouring countries where many have fled to, such as Lebanon and Jordan.

Here, they provide children and their families with much needed food, safe water, medicine and shelter.

Save the Children also help children to return to school, make sure that they are getting the psychological support they need and run literacy and numeracy centres.

How you can help

Save the Children are doing whatever it takes to provide essential support to the thousands of children in need but they desperately need your support to respond to this crisis.

For every £1 they receive, Save the Children spend 88p on activities to benefit children, 11p to raise the next £1 and 1p on governance and other costs.



The Impact

Your generous contribution will help to make a real difference. Please help. Send a little love today.

Laith Majid was photographed crying and clutching his children after they almost drowned on the voyage to Kos. The Independent.

The Majid family have now arrived safely in Berlin, Germany. The Independent.

Refugees are welcomed by locals after their arrival at the main railway station in Frankfurt, Germany. Getty Images.

story:
VOICE 4 KIDS needs you help.

"CONTRIBUTE NOW"
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/voice4kidskarlalee
www.voice4kids.com
Practically 50% of Marriages end in Divorce and nearly half of those Divorce's involve CHILDREN! 
WE NEED TO HELP THE KIDS.

Welcome. My name is Karla Lee and I am the Author and founder of "Voice 4 Kids". 

(Helping Children of Divorce have a Voice, and bringing Communication back into the home).

To first give you an understanding of why we are fundraising, let me tell you a little about myself.

My Parents separated when I was 9yrs old and for the next 17yrs I struggled with the pain from their divorce. 

Why it happened to me? 

Why did I feel like I was the only one going through this? 

What did my future now hold for me now?

I couldn't find anything to help me understand my pain. There was a lot of help out there for Parents, but what about us kids?

The reason this is important to me is because children of today are crying out to be heard but many are too young to speak up for themselves. I have moved forward after much pain, and gone on to live happily married for 13years with two beautiful daughters, but it's not like that fore everyone.

The average age of Children that are going through divorce is between (7-12yrs old). These children are too young to stand up for themselves, so I have chosen to speak up and represent them.

Children need both a Mother & Father despite the circumstances. 

Yes there is the 20% of parents who are not thinking in the best interests of the children. OR they may not be able to care for their child due their own addictions or personal behaviours.

I am not talking about them, I am talking about the 80% of Parents who both love their Children. Where one caring and loving parent has been alienated and shut out of their personal relationship with their child. 

I ASK: "Was their ANY consideration for the children and how THEY feel?"

Both Parents bring wonderful strengths to a child. A Mother can not give to a child what a Father has, and it also works the other way. 

Parents have been entrusted with a gift, a child. This child is the DNA of their Mother & Father. Children do not see faults within their parents, they just want their time and to be loved. 

They are the most forgiving human beings, and only ask that parents would put their differences aside and think of their perspective.

Ever since I launched my 2 books "Please don't go!" and "Is it my fault?" in 2003 (www.voice4kids.com) I have made it my life's mission to reach nations on behalf of these Children, and for once let them be heard.

The former Magistrate of the NSW Children Courts (Barbara Holborow OAM) endorsed both of my books and also opened my book launch in Sydney's Parliament House in 2003.

Barbara Holborow (Oam) said; "Karla Lee's books provide the sort of help needed by many children and parents during a separation or divorce. The illustrations will help children absorb the important message Karla Lee is sending."

"CONTRIBUTE NOW"

THE REASON WE NEED FUNDING:

On Wed the 12th of August this year (2 weeks time) "Voice 4 Kids" has been asked to speak in Parliament House, Canberra. This is unheard of. A miracle opportunity that could change children's lives for ever. Will you help us?

I spoke in Canberra briefly last year about Children of Divorce, and you could have heard a pin drop in the room. People were so touched, they heard another side to the story.

I will be representing the Children of Australia as "Voice 4 Kids" and I will be addressing the Government with the true facts, with an honest heart, and why Children of Divorce deserve need both a Mother and a Father.

Children need the Government hear that "THEY ALSO" have a right to be heard. 

There is is much NOISE going on at the moment with the Marriage debate and the messy divorce courts, that Children are crying out.... but I ask you WHO is listening to them?

Are you?

We are looking for funding for this project, and further projects with Voice 4 Kids.

Ever since I started Voice 4 Kids it has been funded totally by my family.

Events like these never come cheap. The funding will be used to take the message forward and to put Voice 4 Kids on the map. 

To help us take this movement to the Heads of Government and further. Our desire is to reach Global attention with this Cause, through both social media and speaking events....Really all things are possible. 

We need to remember that these Children are the next generation. 

Children of Divorce have sadly ended up in situations likes these: suicide, early pregnancies, abusive relationships, and drug addiction.

If you feel in your heart that you would like to help "Voice 4 Kids" we would greatly appreciate any financial donation, may it be big or small.

*Our Desire is to take these 2 books with Voice 4 Kids to the Nations

*Have the Books translated into other languages

* Have an opportunity to speak on global platforms, and change hearts and mindsets.

*Bring Governments to a place of compassion

and the list goes on...

Before you close this page ask yourself this.

Q: What would you do if this was your family, or your child?

Sometimes we are not the ones who are going through this, but I guarantee that you know someone's family is.

Thank you, we appreciate your donation, and please follow us on Facebook at Voice4Kids, and view our website at www.voice4kids.com

We understand that no everyone can make a financial donation, but just helping us get "Voice 4 Kids" out there in the social media would be greatly appreciated.

Please help us to get the word out there and "CONTRIBUTE NOW". Help us make some noise about our campaign VOICE 4 KIDS, and also use the Indiegogo share tools.

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/voice4kidskarlalee

WHO KNOWS WHAT KIND OF IMPACT THIS COULD MAKE ON EVEN ONE CHILD'S LIFE?

Thank you,

Karla Lee

www.voice4kids.com

story:
The Facts

CameroonONE has developed a program to confront the the current orphan crisis within the country. Our team has established the first In-Home Child Sponsorship program on the continent. The project has been designed to support both an orphaned child and his or her surviving relatives with the goal of keeping families together while making the orphan communes available for only the most imperative situations. Relatives taking on the parental responsibilities of a niece, nephew, or young cousin will do so on a conditional basis; each household will receive a per annum, circumstantially determined stipend (a pre-determined monetary sum, PTA school fees, medical assistance, school supplies, uniforms, text books, shoes, as well as rice, seeds, and cooking oil) with full understanding that it will be conditional and made available only as certain requirements of the child’s rearing are met. These stipulations include that the child attend a decent school and maintain certain expectations in their evaluations, and that he or she is fully vaccinated and receives whatever healthcare that may be specific to their personal needs.

The Impact

CameroonONE, a 501(c)(3) charitable organization, focuses on helping orphaned children in Cameroon obtain basic human essentials by placing them in the households of surviving relatives and seeing that they receive access to essential healthcare, food and education. All of the funds that are raised drive will be given to children through CameroonONE's In-Home Sponsorship and Orphan Health and Education Program. If even one child no longer has to work in cement mines to pay for basic human necessities such as shoes, then we will have made a difference. Each dollar donated helps contribute to the greater effort of providing essentials to Cameroonian children!

For example:
- 2 Dollars will buy a guinea pig to go to a Destitute / Orphan child's family
- 4 Dollars would buy a chicken to enable a family to eat eggs
- 46 Dollars will buy a goat for an elderly person or orphan family
- 85 Dollars can cover the entire expenses of a toddler for a month
-450 Dollars will pay a child's apprenticeship fees for 3 years

The Goal

For Cameroonian children, the need for basic essentials is great. Here is how you can help:

- Visit www.cameroonone.org to learn more about CameroonONE and the children that they help.

- Raise Awareness! Share this campaign with friends, family, and colleagues. Word of mouth can mean more than you think!

- Join the CameroonONE group on Facebook and keep an eye out for future fundraising events: www.facebook.com/CameroonONE

- DONATE WHATEVER AND WHENEVER YOU CAN!

Your generosity means a great deal, for is frequently impossible for extended family to provide basic care to orphaned children. For the most part, they simply cannot afford to pay for the food, clothes, and medical care needed. Talk about the issues. Be aware of the hardships faced in other countries and by other populations. Help when you can. Help CameroonONE!

story:
Food for Life Vrindavan is a humanitarian aid organisation officially recognized by the Indian government. For the last ten years, we have worked in the poorest villages in the Vrindavan area 2 hours outside Delhi in India.

FFLV its a not for profit and has an admin cost below 10%, for a full financial report please visit: http://fflvrindavan.org/en/?page_id=76

Today our services include

  • Education : The Sandipani Muni Schools Providing education for 1500 needy children from kindergarten to the end of inter-school. Our school children are girls only, with boys allowed in kindergarten   We selected girls because the local culture at home boys are favored and girls get less food, less medical care, schooling possibility and lesser opportunities in general”.  
  • Education : Training courses for adult women,
  • Food distribution-serving 66,000 meals a month
  • Taking care of sick injured and abandoned cows
  • Basic medical assistance to about 1,000 people per month
  • Assistance to the elderly and the disabled,
  • Environmental projects importantly including tree planting. 

Living under the burden of their bodies, constantly suffering the “curse” of being a girl, these innocent angels didn’t realize how much power they behold. One might look at them as poor, weak, unwanted!, but for us they are rich, strong and wanted. What makes them rich is the smile that covers their suffering. We cry over a drop of a hat. They suffer to live and live and suffer, who can be more strong?

We are trying to empower these destitute girls through education to fight several of life's problems such as child marriage, premature death due to malnutrition and social evils

Are you with us?

story:
In june this year I visited Kenya with my friend Esther for 4 weeks. We spent most of our time in the south of this beautiful country. During 1 week we stayed with a dutch woman (we are both dutch as well) and her husband (a masai) and their little daughter. They live near the border with Tanzania and near the Amboseli national park. Staying with them showed us even more how difficult and hard life can be for the people who live there. 

The area we stayed in is mainly populated by Masai. The government introduced a law a few years ago that the Masai (they were originally nomads) have to send their children to school. If they don't do this they risk fines or even prison time. The problem is that there are not a lot of schools and it is very difficult for the people to collect money to build more schools. A lot of children have to walk long distances to get to school and stay with family that lives closer to a school. 

We stayed near the village of Namelok (look for Kimana if you want to find it on google maps). A few hundred meters from where we stayed there is a Masai village. The people there live very simply, they have kettle, clay houses (manyattas) and a lot of children. What they don't have is the money to let all their children go to school. By building a classroom and supplying them with books, pencils, etc. we can help about 70 children to go to school. 

At the moment there are two classrooms (that have been built by two foreigners helping the local people) and around 70 students. That means that there are 35 children in each class.  

Our goal is to build another classroom for these children so that the education level will get a lot better. 

When we visited the school in june the children were so excited to see us and all shook our hand. When we handed out pencils for everyone their joy was even bigger. Seeing what such a little thing can do inspired us to try and give them someting more sustainable.

All the money we collect will go to the school. We need around 3400 dollars to build one classroom (including everything, the people we stayed with got someone to add everything and it's approximately 3400 dollars). Anything on top of that will be spent on pens, paper, chairs, chalks, etc. If we don't reach our goal the money we collect will also be spent on making sure the children and teachers have enough supply to keep the school going. (the money will be put on the bankaccount of the people we met there, and live nearby. They have their own organisation and we will keep in close contact with them to see how it goes.)

In conclusion: if you help us build this classroom you will enable 70 masai children to go to school (which makes a huge difference for their future).

story:
Greetings!

My name is Akin Carter.  I am a 2015 graduate of St. Anne Community High School and the "true founder"of Black Oaks Center for Sustainable Renewable Living (BOC).  My parents call me the true founder because I inspired them to create the not for profit that trains and facilitates communities in being resilient through low carbon living over 10 years ago when I was 8 years old.  As an adult, I look forward to contributing to this mission in an even greater way.  I have lived on the BOC, 40 acre off grid, eco campus with my parents for over 5 years.  There are 3 gifts I have received from low carbon living:

  1. I have learned to work with my hands; to grow food, to work with tools, equipment, machinery, to fix things.  This is something that would not have happened if I lived in the city.
  2. Patience with people and things.  Low carbon living is slow.  Things do not happen spontaneously or quickly.  Things don't turn out they way you expected or hoped often times.  There seems to always be an unexpected challenge. You have to stay at it.  Keep going, keep doing
  3. An increased awareness.  Its like a mental, spiritual thing.  I am learning to observe things in detail, in depth.  From this I am finding principals of life that seem to be holding true so far.
In keeping with BOC mission, I want to help facilitate communities thriving; people young and old actualizing their potential in the face of the 21st century global  challenge of too many people living in a world with resource constraints and the progressed affects of global warming.  My love of science, problem solving and working with my hands has me securing a career in engineering at North Carolina Agriculture & Technology State University (NCAT) to take on such a feat.  My engineering priorities in the Grand Challenge for Engineers are:  food, water and renewable energy.  If communities are able to grow food to eat, have access to clean water and manage renewable energy systems, they are sustainable.  This is why I cannot miss this opportunity to go to Cuba!  Cuba is one of the most sustainable country's in the world that  improves the quality of human life and is living within the carrying capacity of it's supporting ecosystem.  I want to be submersed in this so I can help to bring innovation  and lessons learned from a people that made economic empowerment come from political empowerment to withstand the constraints of 50+ years of the  U.S. embargo. I saw this film in 2006:  The Power of Community:  How Cuba Survived Peak Oil  when I was 10 years old and I have longed to go ever since.  
With your help, I will be a delegate of the Eco Cuban Networks Sustainable Agriculture Rooted in Community/Nature's Friends from October 2 – 11, 2015

During the course of the tour we will:

  • Compare indigenous land management and modern permaculture design
  • Discuss the invisible threads that hold together urban agriculture: public policies, cultural practices, land use patterns, generativity
  • Inquire into the role of faith communities in regard to feeding people and sustainability

Formerly importing most of its food, Cuba's agriculture is now 95% organic, with the city of Havana producing over 60% of its own fruits and vegetables within the city's urban spaces.  At the same time, Cuba has been engaging in reforestation and investing in alternative energy production, with a focus on solar and biofuels.

Itinerary:

  • City Tour of Havana with Cuban Architect/Sustainable Urban Planner
  • Urban gardens/farmer's markets
  • Herbal Medicinal Farm and Green Pharmacy
  • Paolo Freire Center and Murealando Community
  • Matanzas polyclinic, family doctor clinic and school
  • Alamar Organoponico
  • Permaculture urban and rural farms
  • AfroCuban communities of Regla and Guanabacoa and Casa Africa
  • Cubasolar, NGO promoting renewable energy and energy efficiency


During my stay, I will be visiting the Cuban Polytechnic Institute to lay the ground work for a Spring  2016 Study Abroad where I will be working on  clean water and solar energy projects in the rural areas of eastern Cuba.  I hope to serve as an ambassador for North Carolina A&T State University so that future students will exchange between the 2 universities.   

This  is a unique and exciting opportunity, because I will be one of the first representatives from our community to travel to such a resilient country. Cuba has been able to  sustain itself for years using environmentally friendly and innovative practices. Funding will allow me to pay for the trip 

Funding

Funding will pay for the overall cost of the trip, including (but not limited to): air fare, room & board, travel fees, meals etc. Your contribution will put me well on my way to a successful career while fulfilling the BOC mission in a greater way.  I am saving monies from my jobs to set up residence in North Carolina so I will be able to ultimately reduce my school debt burden.  

Impact

My being a delegate on this trip will have many benefits:
  • Exchange between Cuban farmers and sustainable, organic producers in the Pembroke/Chicago area and beyond
  • Permaculture Exchange from Cuba to BOC
  •  Local Food System Modeling that will enhance our infrastructure building here.
  • Opening doors for NCAT and Cuban Polytech Institute to be in partnership
  • Foster Cuban alliances that will facilitate the BOC mission in the U.S.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to make a monetary contribution, you can help my initiative by spreading the word about what we do. Come support me at the Healthy Food Hub every Saturday Chicago, IL from 11-3pm just west of 73rd & Jeffry. Feel free to visit www.blackoakscenter.org for more information about our past projects, and forward the link to this campaign to anyone who is interested. My goal finding a model that can bring  sustainability to the black community here in the U.S.
story_txt:
Greetings! My name is Akin Carter.  I am a 2015 graduate of St. Anne Community High School and the "true founder"of Black Oaks Center for Sustainable Renewable Living (BOC).  My parents call me the true founder because I inspired them to create the not for profit that trains and facilitates communities in being resilient through low carbon living over 10 years ago when I was 8 years old.  As an adult, I look forward to contributing to this mission in an even greater way.  I have lived on the BOC, 40 acre off grid, eco campus with my parents for over 5 years.  There are 3 gifts I have received from low carbon living:



I have learned to work with my hands; to grow food, to work with tools, equipment, machinery, to fix things.  This is something that would not have happened if I lived in the city.


Patience with people and things.  Low carbon living is slow.  Things do not happen spontaneously or quickly.  Things don't turn out they way you expected or hoped often times.  There seems to always be an unexpected challenge. You have to stay at it.  Keep going, keep doing

An increased awareness.  Its like a mental, spiritual thing.  I am learning to observe things in detail, in depth.  From this I am finding principals of life that seem to be holding true so far.

Funding will pay for the overall cost of the trip, including (but not limited to): air fare, room & board, travel fees, meals etc. Your contribution will put me well on my way to a successful career while fulfilling the BOC mission in a greater way.  I am saving monies from my jobs to set up residence in North Carolina so I will be able to ultimately reduce my school debt burden.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Caven, Beseka Nnoko an African American with a bachelor of science degree in Sociology and Anthropology, currently taking a master program in another field of study and have a military background. This campaign is about giving free education to orphans with no access to education in and around the rural areas of Kumba (Camroon). The school will not only be attended by orphans but also by kids with guardians or parents who will pay a fee as a way to make the school sustainable. This fee will be used to pay staff who work for the school, in other words people can help these orphans by sending their kids to the school. In few words 'teach a man how to catch fish and not  give him fish all the time', this will make these kids independent when they grow up and not have to walk the streets begging because they don't have any education.

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking the amount of $120000 and here is a major break down of how it will be used:

Purchase of land          $20000

Building materials          $65000

Furniture(desks, boards, computer etc)          $15000

Contractors fee          $10000

Utilities(electricity bill, water bill etc)          $10000

The Impact

Doesn't it just feel great to be a part of the lives of little kids, knowing that you will be responsible in putting a smile on their faces and giving them a bright future to look forward to? I have been fortunate to work on similar projects like this with groups that are not empowered, a case in point were 40 women groups in rural communities in a poverty alleviation project with agriculture and women empowerment

 

Risks & Challenges

There will always be obstacles in any project and this is no exception,some of which include delay on the delivery of building  materials, safety hazards and accountability

  • My experience in other projects gives me a background on project management,the fact that i also know the terrain well and speak the local language.
  • I have a team of close and trusted collaborators and former government official who have been in charge of major projects in the area.

Other Ways You Can Help

I will really appreciate it if people seeing this can tell others about it to help out .

story:
1.            

Greetings,

I’m Sid Goodman, CPA, inventor, author and entrepreneur, and I am asking for your help to fund a  project near and dear to my heart.

Youth suicide rates are something you don't hear much about.

The CDC reports that there are about 4,400 suicide deaths annually among young people, and for every suicide there are 100 attempted suicides. Bullying plays a major role (up to 50%) in these attempts according to a recent study.

ABC News reported that nearly 30 percent of students are either bullies or victims of bullying, and over 150,000 kids may stay home every day due to fear of being bullied. 

New long-term study shows why bullying is a public health problem. 

According to a recent article in the LA Times "Bullying may be responsible for nearly 30% of cases of depression among adults, a new study suggests. By tracking 2,668 people from early childhood through adulthood, researchers found that 13-year-olds who were frequent targets of bullies were three times more likely than their non-victimized peers to be depressed as adults". Here is the link to that story. http://www.latimes.com/science/sciencenow/la-sci-sn-bullying-teens-depression-adults-20150602-story.html

What can be done?

Over a decade ago, before it became a prominent issue, I decided that I had the time and resources to see what I might be able do. After two years of collaboration with a highly respected illustrator and an award winning elementary school educator, we decided that the best way to target bullying was to begin with students in the 1st through 5th grades . The result of our collaboration was a 24 page book, “BULLYING, Why would you want to do that?”

This beautifully illustrated and colorful booklet was inexpensive enough to give  one book to each elementary student in a school system. It was designed to be used as a teaching aid and as an educational device for teachers, and then to be taken home to parents or guardians for reinforcement.

“BULLYING” was a hit, and in 2007 the book was awarded the Seal of Approval of the National Parenting Center. My book garnered the highest praises in every school system in which it was used. 

Over 70,000 books have been used by students. However in  2010 printing was suspended due to the scarcity of funding available in school systems nationwide. They just had no money for new programs and it became economically unfeasible.

This brings me to why I am asking for your help. I want to provide, at little to no cost, millions of books to school systems around the country. With your support, and a donation of any amount we can achieve this goal together.

The Foundation to Prevent Bullying will use these funds to hire professionals to seek out and write the grant applications to solicit millions of dollars in grants from governmental agencies, foundations and private institutions. No salaries will be paid from these funds.

There is a lot of money available for worthy causes, and this certainly is one of them. Over the ensuing years we hope to raise sufficient grant money to offer a continuous stream of books to every school district in the United States.

One million dollars in cumulative government and corporate grants can purchase and distribute two to three million books. Imagine the impact that might make! 

Some of the these funds may be used to create the Spanish version, update the current book based on feedback and to create an App for mobile phones and iPad type devices.

See the book online: www.MyBullyBook.com

A grant from Ellen DeGeneris

Jaylen Arnold,is now 14 years old and has Tourette's Syndrome. He was badly bullied in school. Along with his mom they started Jaylen’s Challenge Foundation. 

Jaylen speaks to elementary school groups about his story, and bullying, and gives each of the children one of my BULLYING books. He has given over 10,000 books to his audiences and has recently purchased another 10,000. We look to provide those books at no cost to Jaylen to support his efforts. This year Jaylen's Challenge was awarded a $10,000 grant from Ellen DeGeneris. You can see it here:  www.jaylenschallenge.org as well as the artwork from my book on their masthead.. Please consider making a donation to Jaylen's Challenge also. It will be greatly appreciated.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your contribution, small or large, to help launch this project and to help protect the children that are faced with bullying on a daily basis. 

Equally important, we need you to tell all of your contacts about our efforts via email and social media. If you take the time to do that it will result in huge rewards as more and more people spread the word.

The only path to success for us is to obtain grants, and your donations and referrals  will help provide the seed money to do that. 

All donors of $250 or more will be acknowledged on the inside cover of every book printed.

The Impact

The Foundation to Prevent Bullying can make a significant impact on bullying by starting at the beginning, speaking to the youngest children in a language and presentation which they can understand, as early as the first grade at age 5 or 6.

Risks & Challenges

As an entrepreneur I have started several successful companies. Every venture has its risks and challenges, but we have as much experience in this field as anyone and we have confidence that we can make a significant difference in the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Crowd Funding, which is what this IndieGOGO campaign is, is a highly competitive arena. 

Please share this campaign with friends via email or share on Facebook, Twitter or Google+ simply by using the appropriate button located on the top left of this page.  Everything you do will help insure that we meet or exceed our goal.

story:
Glory Fundraiser for Education is a local grassroots organization based out of Dawson Creek, BC, Canada. It has been raising funds for Glory English Secondary School in Bhaktapur, Nepal for two years. Fanni De Maio and Eva Wicha went to visit and volunteer in the school last summer.



The students, teachers and staff are the kindest, happiest and most grateful people we have ever met.

THEY ARE OUR FRIENDS AND WE ARE PART OF THE GLORY FAMILY!

We never imagined that catastrophic events will prompt us to take the fundraiser to indiegogo.com and change our mission.

April 25th, 2015 a 7.9 earthquake shook Nepal and left the Kathmandu Valley crippled. The destruction is enormous, the number of casualties is rising and the death toll is at 1500 and counting.


We spent the last 24 hours trying to connect with friends, students, teachers and staff of Glory. What we know is that the destruction in the neighbourhood is devastating, old houses just collapsed, there is not enough shelter, clean water, food or blankets. Many people took shelter in the school building where the walls are cracked but still standing.

What We Need

Our goal is to raise minimum $15000 to send over to Glory to purchase bottled water, food, blankets and whatever else they need in the community and distribute it to people in need.

The funds will also be used for rebuilding and repairing the school and the community of Bhaktapur.


The Impact

Nepal is a developing country where the government and people have little resources to respond to a disaster of this scale. They need our help, they need your help. We are now in the 48 hours time frame of the catastrophe. People need medical help, clean water, food and shelter. And they need it now. 

The Perks

To show our gratitude we will be sending you various handmade Nepali items, handwritten thank-you letters on handmade Nepali paper and/or original artwork made by the students of Glory English Secondary School.

 

 


If you are unable to help financially at least please share our indigogo link and let your friends and contacts know about this fundraiser!  
https://www.indiegogo.com/campaigns/nepal-earthquake-relief-through-glory-fundraiser

Please feel free to like and share our original Facebook fundraising page:
https://www.facebook.com/fundraiserforglory?fref=ts

story:
Summary

BODYBUILDING COMPETITION SHOW TICKETS: http://ftmfitnessconference.com/bodybuilding-show/ 
FASHION SHOW TICKETS: http://ftmfitnessconference.com/fashion-show/ 

LOCATION: Ramda Plaza, Downtown Atlanta GA (450 Capitol Ave SE).

DATES: October 1st, 2nd and 3rd, 2015

THEME: The Warrior Within You!

CLICK HERE TO READ OUT STORY

Our first annual conference was created with the goal to bring the Trans community, specifically men of Trans experience closer together: students, professionals, athletes, business owners, educators, mentors, advocates, activists, artists and the average guy who wants more out of life, through workshops, activities, exhibits, partnerships, networking and entertainment.

We are proud to have launched in 2014 the first historical bodybuilding competition for men of Trans experience.

 

Our first mission is to be as inclusive as possible: by embracing diversity in the Trans community, by focusing on what unites us versus what separates us and by bridging the gap between people based on age, sexual orientation, socio-economical background, religious affiliation, and more.

Our second mission is to empower our community. We want to leave the attendees wanting more in their lives; expecting excellence while rejecting mediocrity; pushing themselves to become the change they want in their local community; helping them realize that they have within them all the tools needed to succeed in every area of their lives; and encouraging them to focus on what unites the Trans community instead of what separates it. 

The last reason is why we are expanding our reach and opening the door to our Trans sisters, specifically for one special night where our Trans (men and women) models will showcase the work of LGBT Fashion Designers in at our red carpet Trans exclusive fashion show on Thursday night at the Ramada Plaza.

What to expect:

  • Entertainment by Trans Hip Hop Artist Wordz the Poet Mcee
  • Burlesque Show
  • Fashion Show
  • Bodybuilding Competition
  • Weightlifting Competition 
  • Boot Camps by Chloie Jonsson, Cole Timonere, Noori Jerrard and Justice Williams
  • Keynotes by Ryan Sallans, Kortney Ziegler and Buck Angel
  • And more!

Needs

The crowd funding campaign will allow us to have a separate platform to offer individual tickets so that the website is left for those who want a full registration to the entire event. This will allow us to raise partial funds for hotel expenses, honorariums, entertainment, competition trophies and prizes, fashion show, logistics, printing, marketing and overall to give you the best experience anyone could ask for.

If you're a competitor, invite friends and family to buy passes here to come support you. If you're not interested in attending the entire conference and just want to be part of the amazing fashion show event, competition or just want a day pass, you get to buy those tickets here.

You can also sponsor someone you know or add to our scholarship fund. 

For full conference ticket, go to the website (http://ftmfitnessconference.com/register/)

And of course, you can always donate any amount because every single dollar counts.

Impact

We are proud to have hosted the 1st EVER competition for men of Trans Experience and we are amazed of our reach and the impact it has made to our community.

Being able to successfully host a Trans exclusive fashion show is our second goal because we want to keep promoting and projecting a positive image for our community. This is why we will showcase models and artists of various sizes, colors and cultures. Our motto is simple:"beauty, strength, visibility!"

The FTM Fitness World Conference is a positive space that highlights the diversity of the Trans community so that together we can rise above stereotypes and statistics.

It's a place for connections, empowerment, unity, networking, and most of all HEALING of our community emotionally, financially, physically, sexually and spiritually.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't even donate a dollar or five, the least you can do is help us get the word out by using the share tool/buttons at the bottom of this campaign.

Please do mention us by using @ftmfitnessworld, @ftmfitcon, #FTMFitCon and #FTMFitCon15. We are on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, Pinterest and Youtube.

For a Business Partnership or for Marketing Sponsorship inquiries, please e-mail Neo at neo@ftmfitnessworld.com

***Partial proceeds go to the FTM Foundation.***
story_txt:
Summary
BODYBUILDING COMPETITION SHOW TICKETS: http://ftmfitnessconference.com/bodybuilding-show/ 
FASHION SHOW TICKETS: http://ftmfitnessconference.com/fashion-show/  
LOCATION: Ramda Plaza, Downtown Atlanta GA (450 Capitol Ave SE).
DATES: October 1st, 2nd and 3rd, 2015
THEME: The Warrior Within You!
CLICK HERE TO READ OUT STORY
Our first annual conference was created with the goal to bring the Trans community, specifically men of Trans experience closer together: students, professionals, athletes, business owners, educators, mentors, advocates, activists, artists and the average guy who wants more out of life, through workshops, activities, exhibits, partnerships, networking and entertainment.
We are proud to have launched in 2014 the first historical bodybuilding competition for men of Trans experience.
 

Our first mission is to be as inclusive as possible: by embracing diversity in the Trans community, by focusing on what unites us versus what separates us and by bridging the gap between people based on age, sexual orientation, socio-economical background, religious affiliation, and more.
Our second mission is to empower our community. We want to leave the attendees wanting more in their lives; expecting excellence while rejecting mediocrity; pushing themselves to become the change they want in their local community; helping them realize that they have within them all the tools needed to succeed in every area of their lives; and encouraging them to focus on what unites the Trans community instead of what separates it. 
The last reason is why we are expanding our reach and opening the door to our Trans sisters, specifically for one special night where our Trans (men and women) models will showcase the work of LGBT Fashion Designers in at our red carpet Trans exclusive fashion show on Thursday night at the Ramada Plaza.What to expect:


Entertainment by Trans Hip Hop Artist Wordz the Poet Mcee

Burlesque Show
Fashion Show
Bodybuilding Competition
Weightlifting Competition 
Boot Camps by Chloie Jonsson, Cole Timonere, Noori Jerrard and Justice Williams
Keynotes by Ryan Sallans, Kortney Ziegler and Buck Angel
And more!

Needs
 The crowd funding campaign will allow us to have a separate platform to offer individual tickets so that the website is left for those who want a full registration to the entire event. This will allow us to raise partial funds for hotel expenses, honorariums, entertainment, competition trophies and prizes, fashion show, logistics, printing, marketing and overall to give you the best experience anyone could ask for.
If you're a competitor, invite friends and family to buy passes here to come support you. If you're not interested in attending the entire conference and just want to be part of the amazing fashion show event, competition or just want a day pass, you get to buy those tickets here.
You can also sponsor someone you know or add to our scholarship fund. 
For full conference ticket, go to the website (http://ftmfitnessconference.com/register/)
And of course, you can always donate any amount because every single dollar counts.
    Impact




We are proud to have hosted the 1st EVER competition for men of Trans Experience and we are amazed of our reach and the impact it has made to our community.
Being able to successfully host a Trans exclusive fashion show is our second goal because we want to keep promoting and projecting a positive image for our community. This is why we will showcase models and artists of various sizes, colors and cultures. Our motto is simple:"beauty, strength, visibility!"
The FTM Fitness World Conference is a positive space that highlights the diversity of the Trans community so that together we can rise above stereotypes and statistics.
It's a place for connections, empowerment, unity, networking, and most of all HEALING of our community emotionally, financially, physically, sexually and spiritually.




Other Ways You Can Help If you can't even donate a dollar or five, the least you can do is help us get the word out by using the share tool/buttons at the bottom of this campaign.
Please do mention us by using @ftmfitnessworld, @ftmfitcon, #FTMFitCon and #FTMFitCon15. We are on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, Pinterest and Youtube.
For a Business Partnership or for Marketing Sponsorship inquiries, please e-mail Neo at neo@ftmfitnessworld.com
***Partial proceeds go to the FTM Foundation.***

story:
The International Organization for Self-Determination and Equality (IOSDE), an international Human and Indigenous Rights legal-advocacy, non-profit organization based out of Sweden, has teamed up to help the Lawyers' Association for Human Rights of Nepalese Indigenous Peoples (LAHURNIP), an organization working in Nepal defending the human rights and fundamental freedoms of Indigenous Peoples in Nepal, to gather international collection and distribution of relief to earthquake victims in the remote indigenous villages in Nepal via LAHURNIP's Humanitarian Relief Committee (LHRC).


From LAHURNIP Humanitarian Relief Committee (LHRC) member Shankar Limbu:

"Thank you for your willingness to support the victims of earthquake. Indigenous peoples are affected disproportionately. LAHURNIP has been focusing to those areas where there is no alternative to get the supports either from government or any other organisations. We are working with priorities based focusing on those who need urgent support. It is quite challenging to Indigenous peoples to get support in villages in Nuwakot Districts, Sindhupalchok, Gorkha, Sindhuli due to their geographical location and systematic marginalization. Right now we are distributing tents. We need to provide tents and utensils to the 900 displaced people who came for shelter with bare hands."


There is no limit to donations needed at present, we have posted a monetary 'goal' for the sake of initiating this campaign but with the hopes of far surpassing it.


Everyone from Indigenous Human Rights Defenders, to villagers already victims of rights violations in the process of being assisted by defenders, and villages and families still need urgent help- help with acquisition of tents for their families staying in makeshift camps, food, clothes... all funds will go directly to the needs of the victims, also including basic shelter, food supplies, medicines, clean drinking water and assisted rescue operation.

More information is available, including LHRC coordinating contact information in Nepal, via LAHURNIP's initial web post here.


*Photos provided by LAHURNIP Indigenous Human Rights Defender and Indiegogo campaign team member, Ghokul Bhujel, from his village. Mr. Bhujel says: "I need support to help to make a house, the three houses of my family have all been destroyed by the earthquake, and my family is staying in plastic tents (in photo). My family should have been moved into a flat and protected area, because my village is located in an area that has been cracked by the earthquake, and therefore there is a possibility of a landslide. I would like to humbly request, please donate what you can to help build a house for my family to stay in."

Thank you so much for your kindness; The Indiegogo campaign team, IOSDE and the LAHURNIP LHRC team will provide follow-up information and updates from the field to donors who would like to stay informed.

story:
Autism Flintshire is a parent formed group that provides activities and outings for parents/carers of those with or going through an Autism diagnosis.

we provide a weekly meet and mingle with free refreshments, where parents and carers can chat, exchange tips and information and be signposted to what help may be available in the area. This is important for many carers feel isolated and are unsure where to find others who share an understanding of the day to day problems and challenges they face.

We are also providing a once a  month play evening where parents and carers can chat while allowing their children to run, climb and play with no worries about the noise level or having to explain to others why their children may be behaving in what some may see strange or inappropriate for their age. for the exclusive 2 hour use of the indoor play centre we must pay £9 per child (this includes a hot meal)  we are hoping to subsidise this as much as we are able to in order for more families to attend what for some may be their only monthly activity outside of the home or school environment and enables parents and carers to meet.

we are hoping to be able to fund or part fund some inexpensive trips out to local venues in the summer.

story:
Hi, my name is Tiana and I am 11. I have two goals in life: to get the best education possible, which will give me more of an opportunity to achieve my second goal to be a politician to help England and the rest of the world. These are goals I haven't fulfilled and I need your help. I am currently applying for senior schools in Portsmouth and I have my sights set on Portsmouth Grammar School. To be a student at Portsmouth Grammar School it takes four steps; an interview, exams, being accepted and paying. Already I have successfully done the first three, however my family are unable to afford the school fees. My Dad and I are summoning the masses to help me achieve my dreams.

I am hoping to raise enough money to fund the first two years of my education at PGS. After this, I will have to be evaluated again in order to progress to the 13+. If we are still unable to afford the fees, I will launch another campaign!!

I have chosen not to offer "perks" through indiegogo. Read my blog post here to find out why? ... PERKS!!

story: The IPSF was created by Darrian Jordan to assist a specific population of students in furthering their education.  Nationally, over 1.5 million children have a parent incarcerated in state or federal prison.  The absence of those parents can have a potentially devastating impact on the emotional, social, spiritual and economic welfare of a student.  As a consequence of these complications, their educational ambitions may also suffer.  Mr Jordan wants to encourage these students to continue to rise above the challenges of their situations.  As a father of a ten year old son, Jordan hopes to  represent the masses of incarcerated parents and show these students that their parents want them to succeed without making the mistakes that they did.  As a result, the IPSF was created for students who plan to attend college and pursue a degree.  The IPSF will be awarded to high school seniors in the amount of $250 to supplement their educational pursuit.

story:
Hello everybody,

I’m Ceyhun from Turkey, 26 years old, an MBA master student at Bilkent University, my bachelor degree was in industrial engineering at Middle East Technical University

Since age 14, I want to be an internationally recognized musician solo or in a band. To achieve this goal I have always intended to go to Musician Institute Independent Artist program in USA which is a certificate program of 1 year for those musicians like me who want to learn the fundamentals, build a network and get into the music business anyhow. However I don’t have the necessary funds to apply to this program. Its tuition fee amounts to 15k dollars excluding living expenses. I intend to find a part-time job to cover living expenses so I ask you only to help me out with the tuition fee. If the campaign doesn’t reach its target amount, I will work hard to save the remaining amount but I hope it does. I am glad to share my previous records with you in the perks section. I hope you like at least one of my pieces. 

 

I’ve started playing guitar and singing at 14. Since then I played in bands and recorded my own songs solo and shared them on my Facebook page. Using advertising I made 8k followers on the page. Even though I am working in full time jobs, I can’t help but think of composing and recording my projects and because of this I can’t concentrate on my job and advance in my career to make savings. This fact for the past few years took away quite a big portion of what I found to make me happy in life.  Now I’m looking out for ways to turn back to this very big passion of mine. 


BRING THE TALENT THAT WILL LEAD MUSIC

I believe each single dollar you donate in helping me realize my dream and potential will help you let you follow yours and find help along the way. I promise I will be there to return the favor. Who knows you may one day listen to one of my songs and feel inspired to take a very important decision which you’ve never dared or you’ve always procrastinated. I promise as far as I can I will help those in need whenever I am able to do so just like you do now.

Thank you in advance for your contribution and good wishes. I hope everything will be great for me. Don’t forget to check out what I offer in perks section. Please get the word out and ask your friends to contribute to this call by any means possible such as Indiegogo share tools.

I wish you the best for what you wish for yourself…

Love, Peace and Light…

Click here to go to my Linkedin

***************************************************************************

Mükemmel bir albüm kaydetmeye kendini adamış olan Ceyhun, müzik eğitimi almak için desteğinizi bekliyor.

Merhaba

Ben Türkiye’den Ceyhun, 26 yaşındayım, endüstri mühendisi mezunu ve şu anda MBA master öğrencisiyim

14 yaşımdan beri uluslararası tanınan solo ya da bir grupta müzisyen olmak istiyorum. Bu hedefe ulaşmak için uzun süredir Amerika’da bulunan Müzik Enstitüsü’nde benim gibi, müziğin temellerini öğrenmek, çevre oluşturmak ve bir şekilde müzik piyasasına girmek isteyen müzisyenler için 1 yıl süren Bağımsız Müzisyen  sertifika programına gitmeyi istiyorum. Ancak bu programa başvuracak yeterli birikimim yok. Programın harç ücreti yaşam masrafları hariç 15 bin dolar. Yaşam masrafları için bir part time iş bulmayı düşünüyorum ancak harç ücreti için sizlerin yardımına ihtiyacım var. Bu kampanya hedef tutarına ulaşmazsa geri kalanı kısmı biriktirmek için çok çalışacağım ancak umarım hedeflediğim tutara ulaşırım. Kaydettiğim parçaları yandaki “perks” bölümünde bulabilirsiniz. Umarım içlerinden en az bir tanesi hoşunuza gider.

 

Gitar çalmaya ve söylemeye 14 yaşımda başladım. Bu zamandan beri gruplarda çaldım ve solo parçalarımı kaydedip facebook sayfamda paylaştım. Reklam sayesinde sayfada 8 bin takipçiye ulaştım. Tam zamanlı işlerde çalışıyor olsam bile, şarkı yazıp kaydetme tutkusuna kapılmadan duramıyorum ve bu yüzden birikim yapmak için işime ve kariyerimde yükselmeye odaklanamıyorum. Son bir kaç yılda devam eden bu durum hayatın beni en fazla muttu ettiği zamanları elimden alıyor. Şu an yeniden bu büyük tutkuma dönmenin yollarını arıyorum.

 

MÜZİĞE YÖN VERECEK YETENEĞE YOL AÇ

İnanıyorum ki hayalimi ve potansiyelimi gerçekleştirmeme yardımcı olmak için durumunuzun el verdiği ölçüde yapabileceğiniz her katkı sizin kendi hayalinize gitmenize izin vermenizi ve bu yolda yardım bulmanızı sağlayacak. O gün geldiğinde iyiliğinizin karşılığını vermek için orada olacağıma söz veriyorum. Kim bilir belki bir gün bir parçamı dinler ve önemli bir karar alma yolunda ilham alırsınız. Şu anda sizin de yapıyor olduğunuz gibi elimden geldiğince hayalini gerçekleştirmek isteyenlere yardım edeceğime söz veriyorum

Katkınız ve iyi dilekleriniz için şimdiden teşekkürler. Umarım benim için her şey güzel olacak. Sağdaki perks bölümüne göz atmayı unutmayın. Lütfen bu ilanı yaymama yardımcı olun ve arkadaşlarınızdan bu çağrıya kulak verip destek olmalarını rica edin ( Indiegogo araçları yoluyla Facebook, Twitter gibi)

Kendiniz için dilediğiniz ne ise olması dileğimle

Click here to go to my Linkedin

story:
Short Summary

I am Dr. Brenda Lynch, a career educator with a permanent craving, a passion, to help as many children as I can during my lifetime.  I first worked to help them in schools in the US and Europe – in positions including teacher, technologist, counselor, librarian, and assistant principal.  Whatever the position or the place, I have diligently worked to prepare children to live a successful adult life.  I now help school children by preparing their teachers to become school counselors; I am a university professor.   My team are all school counselors who also want to help future generations to live successfully.

For five years, our non-profit has been taking students on college and university tours. We've included all the full gamut of higher education from Ivy Leagues to universities to 4-year colleges to community colleges.  This year, we will tour HBCUs (Historically Black Colleges & Universities).  The students learn a lot but, those who need it most can't afford to go.  Donors can help us to carry first generation college students and those whose parents can't afford to send them on tour. Every year, we leave behind busloads of deserving but poor students who can't afford the fee, which pays for bus transportation, 2 meals a day, and hotels every night.

    What We Need & What You Get

    We need sponsors for the students who need to tour the HBCUs - but they also need to learn the information we provide on the "Rolling University." We devote some of every day's riding time for information-sharing. Students learn about SAT/ACT, FAFSA, and they share information about what others have learned using the books and videos we play.  Although our goal of $6,500 can fund 10 students, we can (and NEED to) take many more students.

    All donors  will receive a letter that acknowledges the gift to Love and Truth Ministries; as a 501c3 Non-Profit Organization, this letter entitles the donor to claim the donation on his or her federal income tax.  In addition, there are other perks that include personal communication from the students as they travel, name or logo on t-shirts for the trip, and links or banners on our website. 

    Our perks include amounts that exceed our goal because, as can be easily summized, there are many students who need to attend above the goal for this campaign.

      In the event that we don't reach our entire goal, all funds will be used to help with ministries that include this tour and a Residential Care Home for children.


      The Impact

      First generation college and university students become banners and anchors for their families and commuities.  Banners, because they uphold the higher education standard - and anchors, because they ground the family and community in the knowledge that the higher education goal is attainable 'even for us!'

      We have successfully taken from one to three busloads on annual tours from Texas.  Among the students taken, Houston has only taken one student who normally could not afford the trip.  That student was a former juvenile detention student and he is now preparing to enter college in the fall!  I personally sponsored that student and have worked with him to keep him reaching higher.  Everyone knows that travel is educational but equally educational are the opportunities to see the campuses, hear from tour guides, speak with students and receive universities paraphernalia.


      Risks & Challenges

      Along with funding hurdles, there are additional challenges that are inherent with working with children.  And, during our many years of working and traveling with teenagers, we have learned from our experiences and have, therefore, instituted many safeguards to ensure accountability.  We consider all potential risks!

      The tour bus company we now use provides modern state-of-the-art buses; we have endured a bus breakdown in Virginia before.  Our chaperones (both male and female) are all educators and/or lovers of children; we require one chaperone for every 5 students.  We also remain in contact with parents and readily address their concerns.  Before leaving, we have parents to supply paperwork that includes medical history and insurance information.


        Other Ways You Can Help

        Everyone can help us!!! If assisting with funding is not possible for you, please help spread the word about the work we're doing.  Utilize your Facebook and other social media accounts to let others know of our need.  Don't be surprised if someone you know provides the connection or the funds we need to take a busload of students who need this experience!  There are Indigogo share tools to help us spread the word - please use them!
story_txt:
Short Summary 
I
am Dr. Brenda Lynch, a career educator with a permanent craving, a passion, to
help as many children as I can during my lifetime.  I first worked to help them in schools in the
US and Europe – in positions including teacher, technologist, counselor, librarian, and
assistant principal.  Whatever the
position or the place, I have diligently worked to prepare children to live a
successful adult life.  I now help school
children by preparing their teachers to become school counselors; I am a
university professor.   My team are all school counselors who also want to help future generations to live successfully.For five years, our non-profit has been taking students on college and university tours. We've included all the full gamut of higher education from Ivy Leagues to universities to 4-year colleges to community colleges.  This year, we will tour HBCUs (Historically Black Colleges & Universities).  The students learn a lot but, those who need it most can't afford to go.  Donors can help us to carry first generation college students and those whose parents can't afford to send them on tour. Every year, we leave behind busloads of deserving but poor students who can't afford the fee, which pays for bus transportation, 2 meals a day, and hotels every night.

story:
I am excited to share that More To Love’s mission of teaching women how to love their bodies is about to grow even more!

I have been accepted to the Kripalu Center of Yoga & Health and, in June 2015, will take up residency for one month to become a trained and certified yoga instructor. During my stay, I will be immersed in daily teacher training and comprehensive mind-body education at the longest and most well-respected schools of yoga and healthy living in the U.S.

Why yoga? Why now? I have been doing yoga for over eight years and know firsthand how rewarding, healing, and empowering this practice can be for people who have long struggled with weight and poor body image. But too often, larger bodies are scared to try a class, believing their body type isn't suited for it, and that's a shame.

The truth is: The image of yoga has not been as inclusive to all body types as it can be . . .

But the world is changing. 

                                                    

I want to help make yoga more accessible to all bodies by creating inspiring programs (in person and online) that blends the incredible body-acceptance work of More To Love with the holistic practice of yoga. The beauty of yoga is how connected one can feel to their own body through the practice, and building a positive, encouraging community to support this lies at the heart of why I created More To Love.

Kripalu Yoga, excited by my vision to share and expand yoga this way, has generously provided me a partial scholarship to attend the program. While it certainly helps, I need to raise additional funds to ensure I can participate fully in the program. 

Funds raised will support:

  • Kripalu Yoga teacher training program fees + accommodations
  • Required training materials and supplies
  • Essential upgrades to More To Love business capital
  • Development  of in-person and online programming (workshops, e-courses) once training is complete

I hope you will consider contributing towards my yoga training, which will directly impact and make possible the work of bringing health and happiness to people of all shapes and sizes.

Please know how deeply I appreciate your support, encouragement, and belief in me and for what More To Love stands for.

Sincerely,

Rachel

Rachel Estapa
Founder, More To Love

Real women from the More To Love community!

story:
Hey everyone! This is Leo Chan of Levitate Style and I am turning 26 on May 7th (Less than 10 days away...ahhh quarter-life crisis mode activated!) I've always wanted to do a fundraiser with my birthday for a good cause. Birthday is a time of celebration and to be thankful for all the blessings in my life. I want to take this opportunity to bless others especially during this emergency time of need. I hope to raise $2,600 to support Save the Children in their relief efforts for the children and families in Nepal.

All the proceeds will go directly to Save The Children! The fundraiser is set up to link funds right to the organization.

This is the worst earthquake in Nepal in the last 81 years and almost ONE MILLION children urgently need help after 3,200+ lives have been lost. Save the Children has worked in Nepal since 1976 and has extensive programs throughout the country. They have launched a disaster response on the ground in Nepal with emergency assistance during this difficult time. 

Thank you very much in advance for my "birthday gift" to Nepal this year and for your support!

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi my name is Mii (Virasack Viravong), I’m a writer and want make a book about science in Laos. I’m graduated in Master of Science in computer engineering therefore I’m quite familiar with science and technology. I’m a writer and knowledge sharing writer with experience in writing short stories, articles, news, used to work as an editor for e-Corner Magazine and an editor for Lao Doraemon. Moreover I’m also a producer and a host for Science Talk radio show via FM 98.8MHz, a host for a TV show about IT and technology call Lao Tech TV on air through Lao Star Channel and I’m also a creator of LaoSci page on Facebook which is the only Facebook page in Laos that talking about Science. Another person that help me creating this project is Air (Vilaphonh Chanthalavong), he’s a graphic designer who help drawing all the creative artworks and designing the layout for this book.

  • In Laos, we have a very low reading ratio, the majority of Lao citizen can’t speak English, books that written in Lao are even rarer and if there is the contents are very limited. This cause Lao people lack interest in reading, entrepreneur in this field have a very low budget and limited resource in distributed books to reach everywhere and in big quantity.


  • This is why we motivated to make this first ever science book in Laos, the book I’ve written is call “ເລື່ອງໃຫຍ່ໃນໂລກນ້ອຍ” (Translate: Big Stories in a Small World) which is a book in Pop Sci genre. It’s about stories in science, scientific finding that change the world, thinking in science perspective, concept and the important of it. This book will open a brand new world for Lao reader to enter the world of science in a very easy and enjoyable way, which I’m sure it will help people to love in reading more, think more reasonably and motivate Lao kids to study in science.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need a funding of $7.500 to make this book come to life, all the fund we receive from you will use in printing this book and some of the books will be donate to various library in Laos. We are determine that if we receive a help from you guys we will distribute this book to reach as many people as possible both buy selling and donating.
  • We hope that you would help us make this project happens, at least the initial goal. Even if we can’t get it to print in a big quantity but we will make sure the books can reach as many people as possible by using the money we earn from selling to use in printing more books. But if the donation is higher than our initial goal, we will print and donate more books as following below:
  1. Initial goal for make this project happened is at $7.500, we will print and distribute 2.000 copies and donate 1.000 copies.
  2. If we reach $15.000 we will print and distribute 3.000 copies and donate 1.800 copies.
  3. If we reach $20.000 we will print and distribute 5.000 copies and donate 3.500 copies.
  4. If we reach $25.000 we will print and distribute 8.000 copies and donate 6.000 copies.
  5. If we reach $30.000 we will print and distribute 10.000 copies and donate 8.000 copies.
  6. If we reach more than $30.000 we will get the book translate into English so you guys supporter can enjoy the book as well. More over we will use the over funding money to considering print and distribute more as demand and if possible we will use it to support reading encouraging campaign in Lao and part of them will be using as a budget to print the next book in the future.
  • Every support from you will help Laos kids and citizen to have a chance in reading science book that is not a study book, a book about science that easy to read, understand and enjoyable to read, encouraging people to think in science perspective and motivate kids to like science. Apart from that you’re also help support in reading and donate books to library in all around Laos.

Perk

We have various perk for you supporter to select on. We understand that since the book will be written in Lao so you may not understand it but we have a gift and souvenir for you, especially there are a perk that give you a chance to come to Laos and join our book open ceremony and join us in donating the books for kids to read.


About Laos

  • The only landlocked country in Southeast Asia, Laos sits between Thailand on the west and Vietnam on the east. In 1975, the Pathet Lao (Lao Nation) ended six centuries of monarchical rule when they triumphed in the revolution that established the Lao People's Democratic Republic. Since the revolution, isolation and economic deprivation have plagued the country, which is now one of the poorest and least developed in the world.
  • In Laos the majority of people still can’t read. Outside of the city there are only handful of teacher, school, room to study, study book are very limited; more over reading book outside school are even less, so kids are still far from enough access to education and reading. Even in the city, reading book that written in Laos are too little to almost non-existed, lack variety in term of contents and at a very small quantity.

Source: http://uwcm-geog.wikispaces.com/Disparities%20in%20wealth%20and%20developmentSource: http://uwcm-geog.wikispaces.com/Disparities%20in%20wealth%20and%20development

The Impact

  • According to Laos National Library the total number of all types of library in Laos is 1.310 libraries, in which 41 public libraries, including 5 mobile libraries (one of which is on a boat), 40 special libraries, 15 University libraries, 1.220 school libraries (mostly reading rooms) and 10 ecclesiastical libraries. If we compare it to Laos’s population of 7 million, libraries are far too few.

  • So if you help funding this project, you are helping us making the first ever science book in Laos while encouraging writer to create more variety type of books. And perhaps by making this project happened you may help kids in Laos and Lao citizen not too credulous believe in superstition, thinking before believing and who knows, maybe you may help created the next Einstein.
  • I’ve finished writing 80% and at the process of designing and drawing. After finished the writing there will be a process of review and editing before printing which is the reason why we need the fund from you. We are hoping that you’ll help us and invite your friends to make our dream of true.
  • Part of the book we’ve printed will be donate to Lao National Library who will be responsible for distribute the books to all the libraries around Laos, moreover we will also donate the books to another organizations who working on encouraging reading campaign which are: Room to Read, ALC (Action with Lao Children) and SVA (Service and Shanti Volunteer Association) so the book can reach all kids in Laos.

About Book

  • “ເລື່ອງໃຫຍ່ໃນໂລກນ້ອຍ” or Big Stories in a Small World is a book in Pop Sci genre which tell many stories in 4 different worlds, the book will cover basic in every type of science, aim for ease of reading and understanding, enjoyable; with many scientific finding and research from scientists around the world, explaining the danger of not understanding and use science in a wrong way.
  1. The World We Are Living In: The book start with the world we are living in which will tell a story about how space and time was born, knowledge about solar system and earth (how they measure & weight the earth, volcano, how they discovered chemistry, the danger of radioactive and more).
  2. The World In Skull: This chapter will be about brain science that effect human behavior, emotion and feeling. Reader will get to know evolutional theory, heredity, gene, illusion, eating behavior, stress are bad for human and the topic that will challenge many belief in Laos which is about “Do ghosts exist?”
  3. Microorganism World: We are now entering even smaller world, this chapter cover about the micro living organism. Reader will get through a very interesting topic about how living being start from 1 cell to many cells, bacteria, parasite, virus, cancer cells, HIV, malaria, rabies and more.
  4. Atom World: Ending the book with the atom world and particle. In the last chapter we will build a road for new age of physic, general theory of relativity and quantum physic. Reader will now start to know the miracle of science and learn that we still know so little about this space & time we are living in.


And that’s all the stories in this book which we believe that it will open a brand new world for Lao kids and create new creativity, scientific thinking and motivate them so they may want to grow up and become a scientist.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Tweet. Facebook. Email.
Thank you so much for taking the time to get involved. This means so much more to us than you will ever know.

story:
Let's provide a safe education for the children of Serbia today!

Every child has the right to a fun and engaging education in a safe environment, regardless of their family or personal circumstances.  Some children cannot access education due to being from poor families or being handicapped. We believe there has to be a better way.

We are a newly founded charity organisation called “Charity Butterflies” and our objective is to put a smile on every child's face. Our team is keen to get started with our first project in Serbia - we want to build the first Children Care Centre in a small town called Kikinda. It will not only be a school but a place where children can visit to have fun, get some food, study and a lot more. We know the solution, and now is the time to implement it.

The land that the school is to be built on has generously been given to us by the town. - the town help us here. The school will be run by staff who will be paid by funds raised by local fundraisers. All the items that are necessary to have in a school's inventory are will be provided by this campaign. The town is dedicated to helping us help itself.

One of our team member’s sister has got Down Syndrome - so it is important to us that this school will be inclusive to all. Handicapped children will get the same opportunity as any other child. In Kikinda around 450-500 children are handicapped, just a small part compare with a total of 13000 in Serbia. The children care centre will be there to support the parents of the children also. The building will include a kitchen, an outside play area, a small library, a garden where children can grow their own food and many other facilities that any school needs to educate children. It will also be a place where children can stay after their parents are not with them anymore.

Children of all learning ages will be catered for. The education provided will range from early years curriculum until each pupil is ready to progress to further education. Giving them this wonderful opportunity will help to give them confidence and install in them the value of education for the next generation. The families of handicapped children in Serbia are receiving ~100 $ from the country. Our school is free to use as it’s all coming from people who want a better life for poor handicapped children.

This is our first project but it will certainly not be our last. The building is scheduled to take six months to complete and we will try to find a new project every year aimed at putting smiles on children's faces by building them a school where they can be children and have fun. We can build them hope.

The Objective: Education and Opportunity

  1. Charity Butterflies to build a Children Care Centre in a small town called Kikinda.
  2. Provide an environment where all children, despite their circumstances, can learn and have fun.

Building Hope: One Major Obstacle is Funding

We have planned as much as possible for the success of this project. The next important step for the project to succeed is raising the funds to complete the project. The Care Centre will cost USD$275,000 and will take six months to complete. A further USD$75000 will be used to buy furnishings, educational and playground equipment, and a small van. All the things any school can't do without.

This Indiegogo campaign aims to fund the Care Centre.

Help by Donating

Donate whatever amount you can. This is a ground-breaking project that will change the course of children's lives in Serbia. Be a part of it!

Help by Sharing

Share this campaign with your friends, family and colleagues around the world via email and social media!

Who Can I Contact?

For more information about this project, please get in touch with us:

  • By email: indiegogo@charity-butterflies.com
  • On Facebook

Let's do this together!

A project of this scale and scope relies on the support of hundreds of people from around the world. Thank you for your interest and your support. The time is now. Education and hope for Serbia's children today!

Let's provide a safe education for
the children of Serbia today!
Every child has the right to a fun and engaging
education in a safe environment, regardless of their family or personal
circumstances.  Some children cannot access education due to being from
poor families or being handicapped. We believe there has to be a better way.
We are a newly founded charity organisation called
“Charity Butterflies” and our objective is to put a smile on every child's
face. Our team is keen to get started with our first project in Serbia - we
want to build the first Children Care Centre in a small town called Kikinda. It
will not only be a school but a place where children can visit to have fun, get
some food, study and a lot more. We know the solution, and now is the time
to implement it.
The land that the school is to be
built on has generously been given to us by the town. - the town help us here.
The school will be run by staff who will be paid by funds raised by local
fundraisers. All the items that are necessary to have in a school's inventory
are will be provided by this campaign. The town is dedicated to helping us help
itself. 

One of our team member’s sister has
got Down Syndrome - so it is important to us that this school will be inclusive
to all. Handicapped children will get the same opportunity as any other child.
In Kikinda around 450-500 children are handicapped, just a small part compare
with a total of 13000 in Serbia. The children care centre will be there to

story:
As a newly-qualified teacher I have just got my first job in a small school in Hungary, Europe. My professional career starts in September and I am very excited about working with my first class. Fifteen adorable, creative, honest and funny children are waiting for the big day to arrive.

Like so many others, I joined the profession to make a difference, and I do want to make a difference. I am full of promise, hope and ambition.

My dream is to realize a so called moveable classroom project for my first grade students. Instead of traditional desks and chairs, students would sit at low benches that can be moved and utilized in a multitude of ways: in a circle, a horseshoe, as a long lunch table, an obstacle course or upside-down as balance beams. 

The school is rather underfinanced and not supported by the state and the parents have limited means to provide more funds to the operation of the school. 

It is not a huge campaign but it would mean the world to me; it would enable me to offer something new to our children.

Please help me make a difference, please help me turn my classroom into one as shown in the pictures below!





It devolves on you!
